title: Content Marketing For Beginners: Complete Guide
description:
In this video, youâ€™ll learn how to do content marketing and some tips to help you get started (even if youâ€™re a beginner).

***************************************
Additional Content Marketing Resources

Keyword Research Tutorial: From Start to Finish â–º https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OMJQPqG2Uas 

How to Do Keyword Research for a NEW Website (Full Tutorial) â–º https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x5IJ0APR0EQ 

Keyword Research Pt 1: How to Analyze Searcher Intent - 1.2. SEO Course by Ahrefs â–º https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zXPZ0L2cOw4 

SEO Course for Beginners (by Ahrefs) â–º https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLvJ_dXFSpd2vk6rQ4Rta5MhDIRmakFbp6 

Complete SEO Course for Beginners: Learn to Rank #1 in Google â–º https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xsVTqzratPs 

YouTube SEO: How to Rank Your Videos #1 â–º https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NY3y0V9UDwM 

How to Get More YouTube Subscribers â–º https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NR_V2nGSp98 

YouTube SEO / Video Marketing â–º https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLvJ_dXFSpd2tsn8vwEmhFM0McBH4PhEty 
***************************************
Content marketing is the process of creating and distributing content to attract and retain customers.

Youâ€™re creating blog posts, videos, podcasts, or whatever, promoting it, and your contentâ€™s job is to lead people towards a profitable action.

If youâ€™ve never really bought this whole idea of â€œcontent that sells,â€ this concept might not make a whole lot of sense or just sound cliche.

But if you think about why and how you made your last purchase that wasnâ€™t a necessity like groceries, or clothes, content was probably involved. You probably had a problem, searched for solutions, and content from blogs, videos, and reviews led you through your entire purchasing journey. 

With so much information available at the tip of our fingers, consumers will be influenced by content. Through the power of content marketing, you can intentionally integrate your company and products within these purchasing journeys. 

Content marketing helps to creates awareness and attracts potential customers to your content, your content engages them and builds credibility for your brand, it converts visitors into customers, it allows you to build a loyal following, and for a software product like ours, it helps retain customers because they learn how to do new things with our tools leading to increased usage. 

Best of all, your revenue compounds because unlike advertising where your ads stop appearing the minute you stop paying, content that surfaces where and when your customers are searching, is consistent. 

And itâ€™s important to note that no matter how good your content is, if your products arenâ€™t up to scratch, then content wonâ€™t save you at least for the long haul.

The two main parts of content marketing is:
â–º Create content
â–º Distribute or promote it

Youâ€™ll learn everything you need to know about how to do those two things well in the video.

11:21 How to promote YouTube content

title: 1.2M Followers in 6 Monthsâ€¦ My Content Marketing Strategy REVEALED
description:
Download your free scaling roadmap here: https://www.acquisition.com/roadmap-yt-d
The easiest business I can help you start (free trial): https://www.skool.com/hormozi
Business owners: Want to scale faster? We provide in-person advisory for companies doing at least $1M per year: https://www.acquisition.com/workshop-yt

If youâ€™re new to my channel, my name is Alex Hormozi. Iâ€™m the founder and managing partner of Acquisition.com. Itâ€™s a family office, which is just a formal way of saying we invest our own money into companies. Our 10 portfolio companies bring in over $250,000,000+ per year. Our ownership stake varies between 20% and 100% of them. Given this is a YT channel, and anyone can claim anything, Iâ€™ll give you some stuff you can google to verify below.

How I got hereâ€¦

21: Graduated Vanderbilt in 3 years Magna Cum Laude, and took a fancy consulting job.
23 yrs old: Left my fancy consulting job to start a business (a gym).
24 yrs old: Opened 5 gym locations.
26 yrs old: Closed down 6th gym. Lost everything. 
26 yrs old: Got back to launching gyms (launched 33). Then, lost everything for a 2nd time. 
26 yrs old: In desperation, started licensing model as a hail mary. It worked. 
27 yrs old: "Gym Launch" does $3M profit the next 6 months. Then $17M profit next 12 months.
28 yrs old: Started Prestige Labs. $20M the first year.  
29 yrs old: Launched ALAN, a software company for agencies to work leads for customers. Scaled to $1.7mmo within 6 months. 
31 yrs old: Sold 75% of UseAlan to a strategic buyer in an all stock deal. 
31 yrs old: Sold 66% of Gym Launch & Prestige Labs at $46.2M valuation in all-cash deal to American Pacific Group. (you can google it)
31 yrs old: Started our family office Acquisition.com. We invest and scale companies using the $42M in distributions we had taken + the cash from the $46.2M exit.
32 yrs old: Started making free content showing how we grow companies to make real business education accessible to everyone (and) to attract business owners to invest or scale their businesses. 
34 yrs old: I became co-owner of https://Skool.com to help the many people who want to start a business online do so.

Today: Our portfolio now does $200M/yr between 10 companies. The largest doing $100M/yr the smallest doing $5M per year. Our ownership varies between 20% and 100% ownership of the companies. Many of them we invested in early and helped grow (which is how we make our money - not youtube videos).

To all the gladiators in the arena, weâ€™re all in the middle of writing our own stories. The worse the monsters, the more epic the story.

You either get an epic outcome or an epic story. Both mean you win. 

Keep crushing. May your desires be greater than your obstacles. 

Never quit,

Alex

Information shared here is for educational purposes only.  Individuals and business owners should evaluate their own business strategies, and identify any potential risks.  The information shared here is not a guarantee of success. Your results may vary.

description:

I give tips about spending time on every detail of your content, capturing consumers' attention, and what you should not be focusing on. Hope you enjoy!

Life, Business, and Career Advice l Gary Vaynerchuk Original Films: http://www.garyvee.com/gvoriginals
How to Make Money at Garage Sales l TrashTalk: http://www.garyvee.com/trashtalks
Inside the Life of a $300M+ Company's CEO l DailyVee: http://www.garyvee.com/dailyvees
â€” 
Gary Vaynerchuk is a serial entrepreneur and serves as the Chairman of VaynerX, the CEO of VaynerMedia, and the Creator & CEO of VeeFriends. Gary is considered one of the leading global minds on what's next in culture, business, and the internet.

Known as "GaryVee," he is described as one of the most forward thinkers in business. He acutely recognizes trends and patterns early to help others understand how shifts in consumer attention impact the realities of the business world today. Gary's approach sits at the intersection of business and pop culture. He keenly understands how to bring brand relevance to the forefront. He is a prolific angel investor with early investments in companies like Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Venmo, Snapchat, Coinbase, and Uber.

This year, Gary unveiled his seventh book, "Day Trading Attention" where he provides fresh insights into navigating the modern social media landscape. Gary's expertise guides readers on harnessing underpriced attention channels in the digital age. He emphasizes mastering storytelling in these arenas and highlights the "TikTokification of Social Media," where content relevance surpasses follower counts. Businesses can leverage this shift to enhance their brand and boost sales. "Day Trading Attention" equips readers with essential skills to succeed in today's dynamic digital world. Gary also announced his first children's picture book, based on his VeeFriends characters, titled "Meet Me in the Middleâ€. The picture book, which will prominently feature two VeeFriends characters, Eager Eagle and Patient Pig, delves into the emotional elements essential for nurturing children's empathy â€“ a crucial skill for their future success.

Gary is an entrepreneur at heart â€“ he builds businesses. Today, he helps Fortune 1000 brands leverage consumer attention through his full-service advertising agency, VaynerMedia, which has offices in New York, Los Angeles, Toronto, Mexico City, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, Singapore, Tokyo, Bangkok, and Kuala Lumpur. VaynerMedia is part of the VaynerX holding company, which also includes Eva Nosidam Productions, Gallery Media Group, The Sasha Group, VaynerSpeakers, VaynerCommerce, and Tingley Lane Trading. Gary is the Co-Founder of VaynerSports, VCR Group, VaynerWatt, ArtOfficial, Resy, and Empathy Wines. He guided Resy and Empathy to successful exits -- which he later sold to American Express and Constellation Brands, respectively. He also owns a Major League Pickleball team called the 5s, is part owner of a Big3 basketball team, and is an investor in the revival of the SlamBall League.

Gary is also the founder and creator of VeeCon â€“ a contemporary super conference that converges business and pop culture with innovation and technology. In addition to running multiple businesses, Gary documents his daily life as a CEO through his social media channels, which have more than 44 million followers and garner over 300 million monthly impressions/views across all platforms. His podcast, "The GaryVee Audio Experience," ranks among the top podcasts globally.

Gary serves on the board of MikMak, Bojangles Restaurants, Global Citizen Forum, and Pencils of Promise. He is also a longtime Well Member of charity: water. 

Gary's life ambition is to buy the New York Jets.

title: What is Content Marketing?
description:
In this video, Jen (a content marketer, herself) explains what content marketing is, why you should invest in it for your business, and what you can expect from good content.  

Content marketing is a digital marketing strategy that uses assets like videos, blog posts, articles, images, and graphics to engage your audience and build relationships online. The ultimate goal is to strengthen the trust between you and your audience so that they come to you when they're looking for information or to purchase something you offer. 

You should create content for each stage of the customer journey. People are searching for different information at each stage of the buying process, and having that information ready can help you stand out among your competitors. You want your content to answer questions, solve problems, and give advice that helps people make decisions. More on this in the video.

A great digital marketing strategy includes content that's tailored to your audience and full of helpful information.

00:00:30 // Definition of content marketing
00:00:52 // Benefits of content
00:02:04 // Types of content you can create

00:05:19 // Conclusion

title: Content Marketing Strategy in 7 Minutes
description:
In this video, you'll learn how to create a Content Marketing strategy in just 7 minutes. ğŸ¯ Explore our free content marketing certification courses â–º https://smr.sh/KOP

Compelling content is a cornerstone of any modern marketing strategy. More than 50% of businesses currently invest money, time, and energy into content marketing, with most of them publishing new material every. single. day. 

With so much content out there and demand for new, engaging content growing, it can be hard for someone marketing a small business, running a blog, or helping out clients to know where to begin. Well, this video is going to show you exactly where to start.

A great place to start when building a content plan is by taking a look at the competition. Understanding which keywords your competitors are focusing on can clue you in to areas you may be lacking content, and missing out on capturing your potential customers.

The first Semrush tool you're going to use is our Keyword Gap Tool. 
A great tool that compares your site with your competitorsâ€™ and shows keywords that you share, and most importantly, ones that you are missing. Now, this tool will actually suggest competitorâ€™s here that you can compare your site to. So, even if you donâ€™t have an exact idea of who to compare yourself to, the tool takes care of that for you.

Clicking on a keyword is going to take us to the Keyword Overview tool. This tool shows helpful stats about that particular keyword, such as search volume and difficulty score. The Questions section can provide very useful insights into the questions people are asking about your keyword. Understanding what information people are searching for, what questions they want answered, can guide your content writing. Your content should provide valuable information to people asking these questions. Add these keywords to your keyword list.

Clicking on the name of your keyword list is going to bring you directly to the Keyword Manager Tool, where all of the keywords are compiled, along with key metrics. 

By following these steps you should be able to easily create a content plan, and even create some of the content. 

Timestamps:
00:00 Intro
00:40 What you'll be able to get out of this tutorial
01:01 First step: take a look at the competition
01:24 Getting the keywords you're missing and your competitor are targeting

04:37 How Semrush helps you writing the actual content

title: Welcome to the Content Marketing Unlocked! - Free Content Marketing Course with Neil Patel
description:
I'm excited to announce another course; content marketing unlocked. This course is going to teach you how to grow your traffic through content marketing. It works for all different types of business, doesn't matter if you're B2B, B2C, e-commerce, services, consulting, freelancer, it doesn't matter what industry you're in, you can use content marketing to get more traffic through social media and SEO. 

RESOURCES & LINKS: 
____________________________________________
Ubersuggest - https://neilpatel.com/ubersuggest/

Playlist - Content Marketing Unlocked: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9_rULUbLqE4&list=PLJR61fXkAx134Wp5NgFSP5-nIruNRm033
____________________________________________

Do you want more traffic through content marketing, do you want higher rankings on Google, do you want more social traffic? Define what you're looking for, so that way you can keep that in mind throughout the whole course. 

Now, anytime you do a Google search, you'll notice that the content is in the middle of the results. At the top tends to be ads or product ads or any type of ads. There is also, in some cases, local listing ads. But in the middle is organic SEO results. This is what you don't have to pay for. These results are typically earned through content or content marketing.

The benefits of content marketing, you're going to get a ton of value in goodwill to people, and by doing that, you're going to build a much more loyal brand, you're going to have people coming back, you're going to build that virality, that word of mouth, it's going to help you increase your organic traffic on Google, it's going to help you increase your social media traffic, it may even cause speaking engagements, like I've gotten book deals, investment opportunities, people coming to you trying to invest in you, you'll also of course get leads and more sales as well. If you want to do well, you got to think about what Google wants. 

Google wants high quality content that people love, that's what they want to rank. They don't want to rank it because this is what Google has deemed important, they want to rank that type of content because Google has deemed that that's what people want. 

Remember, Google adjust their algorithm to what people want, what their searchers want. And their searchers want high quality content that people love and can take action on. Now, during this course, you're going to end up learning a lot. It's broken down into four modules, one module per week. I'm going to teach you everything on, hey, what is content marketing, how does it work? To how to create content, to how to market it, how to leverage all those channels out there, how to repurpose your content, and much, much more.

The big part that people mistake when it comes to content marketing is just not about creating content, you also have to do the marketing as well. It's the only way that you're going to get loved by Google. 

The program structure, you already know, it's over four weeks, three lessons a week. You're going to be implementing your learnings each week. If you put in the time, you will get results. The assignments, the worksheets, the cheat sheets, assessments, whatever you want to call them, they don't take too long. You can typically fill them out and do a lot of them within 15, 20 minutes. 

And when you're going throughout the whole content marketing unlocked course, take your time with the videos, pause where you need to, re-watch if you have to as well, because if you do things right, you can get amazing results. 

So some action items for you, go do the goals worksheet, and the second one is download the course itinerary so you can get a real good overview of what you're going to learn over the next four weeks. And you can get this all at neilpatel.com/training, click on content marketing unlocked. 

By the end of the course, you'll be able to know how to build shareworthy content, and on top of that, get that traffic to that content so people can see it and convert that traffic into leads or sales, so that way you're generating revenue. 

The key to content marketing is to make sure you're consistent. If you're consistent over the long run, you are going to be successful. I look forward to helping you grow your traffic through content marketing. 

If you have any questions, just leave a comment below. We're here to help you, I'll answer it.

â–º If you need help growing your business check out my ad agency Neil Patel Digital https://npdigital.com/

â–ºSubscribe: https://goo.gl/ScRTwc to learn more secret SEO tips.
â–ºFind me on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/neilkpatel/
â–ºOn Instagram: https://instagram.com/neilpatel/

https://youtu.be/9_rULUbLqE4

#ContentMarketing #NeilPatel #DigitalMarketing

title: History of Content Marketing
description:
The History of Content Marketing from the Content Marketing Institute. Content marketing is not new.  Brands have been telling stories to attract and retain customers for hundreds of years.  The difference today is that the barriers to entry (content acceptance, talent and technology) no longer exist for brands to get into the publishing arena.

description:

title: Power of Content Creation
Multi million dollar business idea! Influencer Marketing | Social Media Marketing #startup
What Does Content Marketing Look Like in 2019 | Neil Patel
description:
In this video I'm going to share with you what content marketing looks like in 2019.

The blogosphere is competitive. There's over a billion blogs. That's one blog for every seven people. How are you going to compete? What is content marketing going to look now in today's competitive environment? 

How many of you push out content and get very little traffic to it? In 2019 content won't rank as well as it used to. Today Iâ€™m going to share with you how to get content marketing work for your business in 2019. 
__________________________________________

RESOURCES & LINKS: 

â€œHow Digital Marketing Will Change in 2019â€ (video): 
https://youtu.be/b-gwbVJqi9Y 

â€œDoes Blogging Still Work in 2019?â€ (video):
https://youtu.be/i4CY-XD6agM 

â€œContent Creation Hacks to grow your Business Fasterâ€ (video): 
https://youtu.be/3x9AWh7g1YQ 

â€œHow I Write a Blog (Start to Finish)â€ (video): 
https://youtu.be/Q8rN3JKqUc8 

â€œFavorite Hack To Increase Website Traffic That Youâ€™re Not Doingâ€ (video):
https://youtu.be/WTWZQ_4_zNk 

â€œSEO in 2019 What Will And Wonâ€™t Workâ€ (video):
https://youtu.be/I0joqcqpiO4 

â€œSEO For Beginners: 3 Powerful SEO Tips to Rank #1 on Google in 2019â€:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gmB_TC92I8w&t=30s 

â€œThe 3 SEO Tools I Use Rank #1 on Google | Neil Patelâ€ (video): 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GK-0Ix1fUz8&t=4s

Neil Patel Digital AGENCY: 
https://neilpateldigital.com/ 

Ahrefs: 
https://ahrefs.com/ 

Buzzsumo:
https://buzzsumo.com/ 

Read more Content Marketing tips on my blog: https://neilpatel.com/blog
____________________________________________

â–º If you need help growing your business check out my ad agency Neil Patel Digital https://npdigital.com/

â–ºSubscribe: https://goo.gl/ScRTwc to learn more secret SEO tips.
â–ºFind me on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/neilkpatel/
â–ºOn Instagram: https://instagram.com/neilpatel/


See in 2019 content won't rank as well as it used to. Yes they say content is king, but you already know there's over a billion blogs. Nowadays Google isn't just picking from, hey what content do we wanna rank, 'cause we lack content. They're like, we have content on everything under the sun, and the same thing a hundred other times. So now they're just not picking, what content do we wanna rank? They're looking at authority, user metrics, they're even looking at when was the content created. Why would they wanna rank a content that's two years old, when they can rank something that's less than one week old. So when it comes to content marketing in 2019, you need to make sure that your content's also being up to date. If you don't update your old content, you're not going to get as much love as people who're continually pushing out new fresh content.

Second tip I have for you is don't regurgitate the same information over and over again. People are tired of reading 12 SEO tips that'll double your traffic. You can google it, there's probably different variations of that number, but there's probably hundreds of articles on that subject. Write something new, fresh, that hasn't been seen before, you're more likely to get traffic, rankings, and even social shares.

I know you're not gonna like this third tip, but the third tip for you guys is to create video and audio based content. Text is overrated, it doesn't help you connect with people as much as video. I still love text, I still crank out text, but the future is video. It's much more personable, people get to know you, your personality, your company better. So create video based content, upload it to YouTube, Linkedin, heck you can even do Twitter and Instagram if it's short enough, and of course Facebook. Don't share the same video over and over again, like sharing your YouTube video on Facebook. You gotta take that video all over again, and reupload it into Facebook. Linkedin for example, you gotta reupload the video all over again versus sharing the link to that Facebook video. Or that YouTube video. Now with audio you wanna create a podcast, it's easy, you can just bust out your phone, create a audio file, upload it to Itunes or Lip Sync, and you're off and to the races. Same with video, you don't actually have to go into a studio like I am, and shoot all these fancy videos and pay money. You can just bust out your phone. I would even say most the time, from all the tests we've ran, the videos that you end up running on your iPhone convert better if you're selling a product or service. So there's nothing wrong with doing that. Just look at Tai Lopez, he's known for just busting out his phone, and recording videos and it does very well for him.

And the last tip I have for you is promoting your content. In 2019 you gotta spend more time promoting than writing.

#NeilPatel #ContentMarketing #SEO

This is my COMPLETE content marketing strategy,

In fact, this is the same step-by-step process that I used to get 2M+ visitors to my site last year.

With that, here's a quick summary of what I'm going to cover in today's video:

First, I'm going to show you how to find proven topics for your content. So whether you're writing blog posts, shooting YouTube videos or recording podcasts, you'll learn how to find topics that get results.

The next step in my content marketing strategy is to choose a content format. Specifically, a content format that's working right now.

Next, you'll learn how to optimize that content for SEO. Specifically, I'll show you how I optimize my blog posts so they rank in Google for competitive terms.

Finally, you'll learn how to promote your content the right way.

In the end, you'll have a legit content marketing strategy that you get use to get more traffic to your site.

This video will break down some content marketing tips to scale your content strategy without a big budget or taking up valuable time you can spend running your business. Content strategies you can use include: repurposing your high-performing content, leveraging UGC and collaborations, outsourcing creation to an agency, and one of the biggest time-savers is using automation tools to help create and schedule things easily and efficiently. 

These are all ways to deliver more relevant content, higher quality content, and also using 3rd parties to put out more content and build trust with your audience. One of the most important things small business content strategies can focus on is creating quality content over quality. In the AI age we're in, you might feel like you need to create more content to keep up, but high-quality content is perfect for businesses looking to get more out of their time.

title: ğŸ”¥How Much Does A Content Marketer Make ? | What Does A Content Manager Do ? #Shorts | Simplilearn
description:
In this video on How Much Does A Content Marketer Make ?, we explore the role of a Content Marketing Manager and their earning potential. Hi. What do you do? I am a content marketing manager. A Content Marketing Manager plans and creates content to promote a brand. They ensure the content is high-quality, SEO-friendly, and fits the brand's voice. They collaborate with different teams, manage social media, and analyze content performance to boost brand awareness and engagement. Their main goal is to align content with the company's objectives.

And what kind of salary do these roles command? Entry-level salaries range from 6 to 8 lakh per annum. As you gain more skills and experience, the salary can increase to 25-30 lakh per annum. Wondering if content marketing is a good career choice? Watch this video to find out more about the role and potential earnings! #ContentMarketing #DigitalMarketing #CareerAdvice #Salary #MarketingManager #ContentCreation #SEO #BrandAwareness

 #ContentMarketing #DigitalMarketing #CareerAdvice #Salary #MarketingManager #ContentCreation #SEO #BrandAwareness #Shorts #YTShorts #Simplilearn

âœ…What skills are important for a Content Marketing Manager?

Important skills include strong writing and editing abilities, SEO knowledge, social media management, analytical skills, and creativity.

âœ…What qualifications do you need to become a Content Marketing Manager?

Typically, a bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field, along with experience in content creation and marketing.

âœ…What industries hire Content Marketing Managers?

Content Marketing Managers are needed in various industries including tech, healthcare, finance, retail, and more.

title: What Is Content Marketing?
description: What is content marketing?

title: How to create a content marketing strategy? | Digital Marketing Institute
description:
Interested in learning more about Content Marketing? Check out the link below to one of our online short courses:

Looking to learn more about content marketing?:
https://bit.ly/3hLbcMK

How to create your content marketing strategy

What is content marketing?

The purpose of content marketing is to drive both inbound customer engagement and organic searches (using search engine optimization, or SEO) from a defined audience, which can then be nurtured to convert into valuable customers. Content is strategically created or curated, and distributed in key locations across the internet to attract customers to your website. 

What is Inbound marketing?

But what exactly is inbound marketing? Well, itâ€™s a strategy where brands use content marketing to attract customers. The key driver of inbound marketing is consumer intent as potential customers actively seek out the brandâ€™s content. As a result, consumers are more engaged and open to taking action than if the brand were to communicate with them when they are not actively interested. 

What is Outbound Marketing?

Outbound marketing, on the other hand, is when the brand pushes its messages out to as many people as it can within a target audience. The brand believes that this audience is a good match for the product or service being advertised. Of course, consumers might not be interested in the product at that particular time! So outbound advertising is generally less effective than inbound marketing at driving action.  

00:00 : What is content marketing?
01:01 : What is the purpose of content marketing?
01:25 : What is inbound marketing?
01:47 : What is outbound marketing?

title: Understanding Content Marketing
description:
00:07 Intro
00:19 What Is Content?
00:51 What Are Your Business Goals
01:10 5 Parts Of A Winning Content Strategy
02:43 The Customer Journey

Read more: 
https://www.strategybeam.com/blog/top-8-types-of-content-how-when-where-to-use-them/

Content marketing is a great way to grow your business and attract new customers. But there are many different types of content marketing strategies you can use. 

==
WEBSITE: https://www.strategybeam.com/ 
LINKEDIN: https://www.linkedin.com/in/seo-copywriter-chris/
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/StrategyBeam/ 
TWITTER: https://twitter.com/CJGiarratana
===
Video Transcript:
Content marketing is a powerful way to reach your audience, but it can also be really confusing to figure out what content you should use and when you should use it. 

One of the first things that I had to iron out as I became a practitioner of content marketing is to realize that content is just a tool. Uh, content is king, is kind of a, a non-issue saying because it's kind of like saying tools are king or cars are king. 

There are different types of tools, there are different types of cars and trucks for different purposes, and the same thing goes with content marketing. 

Content is the fuel of any marketing strategy because this is how your message and speak to and speak with your audience and push them towards a sale one way or the other, or a conversion.

But which type of content should you use? You have limited time and resources so you need to know what kind of content to focus on, depending on your audience, and that's really what we're going to go over today. 

And this is important because great content takes a lot of time and energy to create and you don't want to waste either one.

So there are different types of content to think about, and one of the first things that you need to consider are, is, what are your business goals? 

You need to think about the needs of your customers when choosing the type of content but also overlay that with your goals because your company is putting out the content, so you need to make sure that the content is getting conversions, having people sign up, making sales.

A winning content strategy has five things in common, who, what, where, when, and how. Who are your customers and what do they look like? What's their age, gender, location, demographic? These kinds of features tell who your audience is composed of. 

So you need to know what their pain points are and the solutions are you providing. These are really basic business points but they also carry over to content marketing and different types of content for your business.

Where do your customers look for answers and solutions? Do they look to Google, are they're on Reddit, do they go to YouTube, Facebook, LinkedIn? 

This is important because every channel that you work with will require different types of content to really reach your core audience. Where are your customers or when are they ready to buy? Where are they in the customer journey? 

This is important because different types of content, and we'll go into this more in detail, different types of content need to be used at different points of the customer journey. 

And how do your customers search for answers and solutions online? Do they use a laptop or a phone, are they looking for a restaurant as they're driving? Hopefully in the passenger seat. 

Or are they looking for a hotel right when they get off a plane? 

This is also a vital piece because we have to know how people consume our content to know if we need to optimize that for mobile or if we need to m- optimize it for laptops or Bing or Google, whatever that might be.

And then the third piece is the customer journey. Uh, the customer journey comprises of mainly three different segments, awareness, consideration and decision. 

Each one of these is o- one part of a relationship. And within that relationship, you can use content in different points to foster, uh, you know, moving on to the next stage. 

So with that said, what we're gonna do is, is go over, in the next couple of videos, the eight different types of content that I consider important for any content strategy. 

Those are blogging, social media posts, infographics, video content, eBooks, white paper, paid search and case studies/ testimonials. 

So stay tuned as we go in and we answer those questions about when should you use different types of content, how much does it cost, how much does it take

title: How to create the ultimate content marketing strategy in six steps
description:
Ready to ace your content marketing game? Then you're at the right place. In this video, we discuss how to create a killer content marketing strategy that helps you strike a balance between quality and quantity while delivering results. 
 
0:00 Introduction  
0:15 The case for a content marketing strategy 
0:46 Tip 1 Define your goals 
01:24 Tip 2 Understand your target audience 
01:59 Tip 3 Brainstorm ideas and plan 
02:43 Tip 4 Create meaningful relevant content 
03:18 Tip 5 Publish, promote and optimize 
04:06 Tip 6 Analyze and improve 
04:46 Summary and conclusion 

First of all, what is a content marketing strategy? 
A content marketing strategy is a game plan to reach your target audience through content crafted to meet their needs and likes. Imagine it as a menu card with various items such as blogs, ebooks, videos and social media, tailored for different audiences with different tastes at different parts of the customer journey. 

How to make a marketing and content strategy? 

Tip 1: Define clear goals ğŸ¯ 
A well-defined and effective content strategy starts with a clear goal. What does your brand wish to achieve with your content? Are you aiming to boost leads, increase website traffic, build a community or increase awareness for your brand? Defining your goals and documenting them on paper is the first step for success. 

Tip 2: Understand your target audience ğŸ” 
What drives your target audience? What information would help them in their decision-making process, what problems do they face and where do they consume content? When you know the answer to these questions you will be able to create content that resonates with them. 

Tip 3: Brainstorm ideas ğŸ§  
A successful content strategy will have content tailored to various stages of the customer journey while employing content types that work for your audience such as blogs, videos, social media posts, podcasts, infographics etc. By brainstorming with teams for ideas you will be increasing your chances of coming out with creative content that stands out from the crowd. 

Tip 4: Create meaningful content ğŸš€ 
If you create content without stopping to think whether it appeals to your end users and potential customers then you are fighting a losing battle. Aim to create content that adds value to your target audienceâ€™s lives and do so by planning in advance. Employ tools such as a content calendar to bring structure to your content creation efforts.  

Tip 5: Amplify, optimize, promote ğŸŒ 
To help your content achieve its full potential, plan a distribution and promotion calendar. Employ various marketing channels at your disposal such as social media, email marketing and internal and external newsletters, to increase your content reach. Also, SEO optimize before publishing the content. 

Tip 6: Analyze and improve to succeed ğŸ“ˆ 
Data, data, data. Harness the power of data and analytics to see what is performing and what is not to finetune your content strategy. Continuous improvement is the recipe for success.  

Are these tips helpful in creating your own winning content marketing strategy? Tell us in the comments section below. 

Wish to know more about how to build an effective content marketing strategy for higher reach? Check out this page: https://www.sprinklr.com/cxm/content-marketing/.    

Find out more about how to increase the performance of your marketing and content strategy with a unified content marketing platform here: https://www.sprinklr.com/products/marketing-and-advertising/content-marketing/.

title: How I'd Create Content in 2025 (If I Had To Start Over)
description:
Download your free scaling roadmap here: https://www.acquisition.com/roadmap-yt-d
The easiest business I can help you start (free trial): https://www.skool.com/hormozi
Business owners: Want to scale faster? We provide in-person advisory for companies doing at least $1M per year: https://www.acquisition.com/workshop-yt

If youâ€™re new to my channel, my name is Alex Hormozi. Iâ€™m the founder and managing partner of Acquisition.com. Itâ€™s a family office, which is just a formal way of saying we invest our own money into companies. Our 10 portfolio companies bring in over $250,000,000+ per year. Our ownership stake varies between 20% and 100% of them. Given this is a YT channel, and anyone can claim anything, Iâ€™ll give you some stuff you can google to verify below.

How I got hereâ€¦

21: Graduated Vanderbilt in 3 years Magna Cum Laude, and took a fancy consulting job.
23 yrs old: Left my fancy consulting job to start a business (a gym).
24 yrs old: Opened 5 gym locations.
26 yrs old: Closed down 6th gym. Lost everything. 
26 yrs old: Got back to launching gyms (launched 33). Then, lost everything for a 2nd time. 
26 yrs old: In desperation, started licensing model as a hail mary. It worked. 
27 yrs old: "Gym Launch" does $3M profit the next 6 months. Then $17M profit next 12 months.
28 yrs old: Started Prestige Labs. $20M the first year.  
29 yrs old: Launched ALAN, a software company for agencies to work leads for customers. Scaled to $1.7mmo within 6 months. 
31 yrs old: Sold 75% of UseAlan to a strategic buyer in an all stock deal. 
31 yrs old: Sold 66% of Gym Launch & Prestige Labs at $46.2M valuation in all-cash deal to American Pacific Group. (you can google it)
31 yrs old: Started our family office Acquisition.com. We invest and scale companies using the $42M in distributions we had taken + the cash from the $46.2M exit.
32 yrs old: Started making free content showing how we grow companies to make real business education accessible to everyone (and) to attract business owners to invest or scale their businesses. 
34 yrs old: I became co-owner of https://Skool.com to help the many people who want to start a business online do so.

Today: Our portfolio now does $200M/yr between 10 companies. The largest doing $100M/yr the smallest doing $5M per year. Our ownership varies between 20% and 100% ownership of the companies. Many of them we invested in early and helped grow (which is how we make our money - not youtube videos).

To all the gladiators in the arena, weâ€™re all in the middle of writing our own stories. The worse the monsters, the more epic the story.

You either get an epic outcome or an epic story. Both mean you win. 

Keep crushing. May your desires be greater than your obstacles. 

Never quit,

Alex

title: Content marketing for small business owners
description:
Marketing won't solve all your business problems. And I'm tired of pretending it will. ğŸ« 

Story time: In college, I worked with a logistics company trying to break into the Mexican market. My group created this gorgeous, comprehensive marketing strategy that should've gotten us an A+.

Then we threw the whole thing away.

Why?Â 

Because they had ZERO Spanish-language materials.Â 

âŒ No bilingual salespeople.Â 
âŒ No Spanish customer service.Â 

They wanted to market to Spanish-speaking customers... in English only. ğŸ™ƒ

No amount of brilliant marketing was going to fix that fundamental business issue.

Fast forward to today, and I see small business owners making similar mistakes:

â†’ Thinking more content will fix a pricing problem

â†’ Blaming "low engagement" when they're talking to the wrong audience

â†’ Creating endless posts when their offer isn't even clear

Your "content isn't working" problem might not be a content problem at all.

Before you create another post, ask yourselfâ€¦Â 

Is this actually a marketing issue, or is there something deeper in my business that needs attention first?

Because sometimes the best marketing strategy is fixing your business operations before you try to market them.

How I'd Create Content in 2025 (If I Had To Start Over)
description:
Download your free scaling roadmap here: https://www.acquisition.com/roadmap-yt-d
The easiest business I can help you start (free trial): https://www.skool.com/hormozi
Business owners: Want to scale faster? We provide in-person advisory for companies doing at least $1M per year: https://www.acquisition.com/workshop-yt

If youâ€™re new to my channel, my name is Alex Hormozi. Iâ€™m the founder and managing partner of Acquisition.com. Itâ€™s a family office, which is just a formal way of saying we invest our own money into companies. Our 10 portfolio companies bring in over $250,000,000+ per year. Our ownership stake varies between 20% and 100% of them. Given this is a YT channel, and anyone can claim anything, Iâ€™ll give you some stuff you can google to verify below.

How I got hereâ€¦

21: Graduated Vanderbilt in 3 years Magna Cum Laude, and took a fancy consulting job.
23 yrs old: Left my fancy consulting job to start a business (a gym).
24 yrs old: Opened 5 gym locations.
26 yrs old: Closed down 6th gym. Lost everything. 
26 yrs old: Got back to launching gyms (launched 33). Then, lost everything for a 2nd time. 
26 yrs old: In desperation, started licensing model as a hail mary. It worked. 
27 yrs old: "Gym Launch" does $3M profit the next 6 months. Then $17M profit next 12 months.
28 yrs old: Started Prestige Labs. $20M the first year.  
29 yrs old: Launched ALAN, a software company for agencies to work leads for customers. Scaled to $1.7mmo within 6 months. 
31 yrs old: Sold 75% of UseAlan to a strategic buyer in an all stock deal. 
31 yrs old: Sold 66% of Gym Launch & Prestige Labs at $46.2M valuation in all-cash deal to American Pacific Group. (you can google it)
31 yrs old: Started our family office Acquisition.com. We invest and scale companies using the $42M in distributions we had taken + the cash from the $46.2M exit.
32 yrs old: Started making free content showing how we grow companies to make real business education accessible to everyone (and) to attract business owners to invest or scale their businesses. 
34 yrs old: I became co-owner of https://Skool.com to help the many people who want to start a business online do so.

Today: Our portfolio now does $200M/yr between 10 companies. The largest doing $100M/yr the smallest doing $5M per year. Our ownership varies between 20% and 100% ownership of the companies. Many of them we invested in early and helped grow (which is how we make our money - not youtube videos).

To all the gladiators in the arena, weâ€™re all in the middle of writing our own stories. The worse the monsters, the more epic the story.

You either get an epic outcome or an epic story. Both mean you win. 

Keep crushing. May your desires be greater than your obstacles. 

Never quit,

Alex

DISCLOSURE 
Information shared here is for educational purposes only.  Individuals and business owners should evaluate their own business strategies, and identify any potential risks.  The information shared here is not a guarantee of success. Your results may vary.
Copyright Â© 2025.

title: What is content marketing?
description:
Content Marketing, What is it and how is it a powerful tool to help you grow your brand, generate in-bound leads and how to do it is successfully. In this video we explain what is content marketing, how to use it effectively to meet you business goals. How to build out a content marketing strategy and what tools you can use to keep on top of your content marketing strategy. 

--------------------- Resources and Links------------------------
Content Marketing - purpose and benefit of using buyer personas - Free lesson 
https://digitalmarketinginstitute.com/resources/lessons/content-marketing_purpose-and-benefit-of-using-personas_1xy1

Free Content Planning template:
https://digitalmarketinginstitute.com/resources/toolkits/content-planning-template

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


No matter what kind of digital marketing you engage in, youâ€™re going to need great content. Great content doesnâ€™t involve plugging your products endlessly. Instead, it offers real value to people â€“ and most importantly, it serves a purpose.

When you have great content, your customers will look forward to receiving it â€“ whether thatâ€™s via a new video uploaded to your website, a funny email, or an informative blog post. They will want to spend time with it and share it with their friends. This positive sentiment, in turn, can be great for your bottom line, as it usually leads to better customers who are loyal to your brand. 

So it makes sense to ensure that content marketing is at the heart of all your marketing tactics. Letâ€™s dive straight into the world of content marketing and what it can do for your business.

description:
In today's hyper-competitive business landscape, creating a winning content strategy is easier said than done. Pam Didner is a seasoned B2B consultant, speaker, author and podcaster. Pam's extensive knowledge covers various areas such as strategic planning, account-based marketing, demand generation and sales enablement. description:

Content marketing isnâ€™t about fancy hacks. Itâ€™s about 3 simple things: relevance, consistency, and value. Get those right, and youâ€™ll win.

#ContentMarketing #BrandStrategy #MarketingTips

title: Apa Itu Content Marketing
description:
Di video kali ini, kita akan membahas apa itu content marketing dan bagaimana cara memanfaatkannya untuk jualan online di sosial media . Apakah kamu ingin meningkatkan penjualan tanpa terlihat "jualan" secara langsung? Content marketing adalah jawabannya! Kami akan mengupas strategi ini agar kamu bisa menarik perhatian target pasar dengan cara yang lebih natural dan efektif. ğŸ’»ğŸ“ˆ

ğŸ“Œ Apa yang akan kamu pelajari di video ini?

âœ… Pengertian Content Marketing:

- Content marketing adalah strategi membuat dan menyebarkan konten yang bermanfaat, relevan, dan menarik untuk membangun relasi dengan audiens.
- Tujuannya bukan langsung menjual, tapi membangun awareness dan kepercayaan terlebih dahulu.

âœ… Kenapa Content Marketing Penting?

- Saat ini, audiens semakin selektif. Konten promosi langsung sering diabaikan.
- Dengan content marketing, kamu bisa menyelipkan nilai edukasi, inspirasi, atau hiburan sebelum melakukan penawaran produk.

âœ… 4 Tipe Konten dalam Content Marketing:

- Edukasi: Memberikan informasi berguna yang relevan dengan target pasar.
- Inspirasi: Menyentuh emosi audiens sehingga mereka merasa terhubung dengan brand-mu.
- Hiburan: Membuat konten yang menghibur agar audiens tetap tertarik.
- Promosi Halus: Menyelipkan penawaran produk secara tidak langsung setelah membangun engagement.

ğŸ’¡ Kenapa ini penting?
Dengan menerapkan content marketing, kamu bisa:
âœ”ï¸ Meningkatkan engagement dan trust dari audiens.
âœ”ï¸ Mengedukasi calon pembeli sehingga mereka lebih siap untuk membeli.
âœ”ï¸ Membangun brand yang kuat dan berkelanjutan di dunia digital.

title: Content in Crisis: How Content Marketing Became So Unsustainable (and What We Can Do to Fix It)
description:
All of a sudden, content marketing feels like the wild, wild west. 

Tactics and channels that worked yesterday are failing today. You find yourself chasing algorithms, scaling volume, and publishing â€œrandom acts of content.â€ But you know itâ€™s a losing game in the AI era.

This feeling isnâ€™t just in your head. 

Itâ€™s nearly universal across content leaders at companies big and small.

Our latest survey of 50+ content leaders confirms that this critical content crossroads is leaving teams feeling adrift and powerless.

So how do we get through this crisisâ€”without stepping right into the next one?

In this live webinar, weâ€™ll help you escape this treadmill of uncertainty and architect a sustainable, strategic plan for the new future of content.

Was ist Content Marketing?  

Content bedeutet Ã¼bersetzt Inhalt und kann unterhaltend, informierend oder beratend sein. Im Bezug aufs Marketing ist Content zum Beispiel ein Bild oder Video in einem Sozialen Kanal wie TikTok oder YouTube. Marketing ist die Ausrichtung eines Unternehmens am Markt mit dem Ziel durch unterschiedliche Strategien fÃ¼r steigende Absatzzahlen zu sorgen. 

Content Marketing bezeichnet also die Social Media Kommunikation im Online Marketing. Hier wird eine Zielgruppe durch verschiedene Inhalte angesprochen und im besten Fall Neukunden gewonnen und langfristig gebunden. 

 
Content Marketing am Beispiel TikTok 

Basti erklÃ¤rt am Beispiel TikTok wie man beim Content Marketing vorgeht und worauf man auch bei der Auswahl der Social Media KanÃ¤le achten sollte. Vor allem um auf sich als Unternehmen aufmerksam zu machen und unterschwellig eine Bindung aufzubauen, eignet sich TikTok als Marketingkanal gut. 

 
Wie kann ich Content Marketing effektiv in meiner Marketing Strategie nutzen? 

Die passende Content Martketing Strategie ist fÃ¼r jedes Unternehmen und seine Zielgruppe individuell. Herausgefunden wird sie, in dem Unternehmen ihre Zielgruppe genaustens kennen. Auch die Wahl der Medien spielt da eine Rolle. Dabei helfen vor allem auch die W-Fragen.

title: Are Content Marketing Templates Worth Using?
description:
Content marketing is crucial for modern businesses, but are templates the secret weapon or a potential pitfall? This video from Business Guide 360 explores whether using pre-designed content marketing templates is truly worth your time and effort.

Discover the key insights into leveraging content marketing templates effectively:
 â–º Understand the pros and cons of using content marketing templates for your strategy.
 â–º Learn how templates can streamline your workflow and improve consistency across your content.
 â–º Identify situations where templates might hinder creativity or lead to generic content.
 â–º Discover best practices for customizing templates to maintain brand voice and originality.
 â–º Determine if content marketing templates align with your business goals and resource availability.

title: 13 Years of Marketing Advice in 85 Mins
description:
Download your free scaling roadmap here: https://www.acquisition.com/roadmap-yt-d
The easiest business I can help you start (free trial): https://www.skool.com/hormozi
Business owners: Want to scale faster? We provide in-person advisory for companies doing at least $1M per year: https://www.acquisition.com/workshop-yt

If youâ€™re new to my channel, my name is Alex Hormozi. Iâ€™m the founder and managing partner of Acquisition.com. Itâ€™s a family office, which is just a formal way of saying we invest our own money into companies. Our 10 portfolio companies bring in over $250,000,000+ per year. Our ownership stake varies between 20% and 100% of them. Given this is a YT channel, and anyone can claim anything, Iâ€™ll give you some stuff you can google to verify below.

How I got hereâ€¦

21: Graduated Vanderbilt in 3 years Magna Cum Laude, and took a fancy consulting job.
23 yrs old: Left my fancy consulting job to start a business (a gym).
24 yrs old: Opened 5 gym locations.
26 yrs old: Closed down 6th gym. Lost everything. 
26 yrs old: Got back to launching gyms (launched 33). Then, lost everything for a 2nd time. 
26 yrs old: In desperation, started licensing model as a hail mary. It worked. 
27 yrs old: "Gym Launch" does $3M profit the next 6 months. Then $17M profit next 12 months.
28 yrs old: Started Prestige Labs. $20M the first year.  
29 yrs old: Launched ALAN, a software company for agencies to work leads for customers. Scaled to $1.7mmo within 6 months. 
31 yrs old: Sold 75% of UseAlan to a strategic buyer in an all stock deal. 
31 yrs old: Sold 66% of Gym Launch & Prestige Labs at $46.2M valuation in all-cash deal to American Pacific Group. (you can google it)
31 yrs old: Started our family office Acquisition.com. We invest and scale companies using the $42M in distributions we had taken + the cash from the $46.2M exit.
32 yrs old: Started making free content showing how we grow companies to make real business education accessible to everyone (and) to attract business owners to invest or scale their businesses. 
34 yrs old: I became co-owner of https://Skool.com to help the many people who want to start a business online do so.

Today: Our portfolio now does $200M/yr between 10 companies. The largest doing $100M/yr the smallest doing $5M per year. Our ownership varies between 20% and 100% ownership of the companies. Many of them we invested in early and helped grow (which is how we make our money - not youtube videos).

To all the gladiators in the arena, weâ€™re all in the middle of writing our own stories. The worse the monsters, the more epic the story.

You either get an epic outcome or an epic story. Both mean you win. 

Keep crushing. May your desires be greater than your obstacles. 

Never quit,

Alex

DISCLOSURE 
Information shared here is for educational purposes only.  Individuals and business owners should evaluate their own business strategies, and identify any potential risks.  The information shared here is not a guarantee of success. Your results may vary.
Copyright Â© 2025.

title: Content Marketing in 3 Minuten erklÃ¤rt
description:
Content Marketing gewinnt im Marketing zunehmend an Bedeutung. Doch was ist das eigentlich und wie lÃ¤sst es sich im Unternehmen einsetzen? Das erklÃ¤ren wir euch in diesem handmade ErklÃ¤rfilm.


youknow ist einer der fÃ¼hrenden Anbieter von ErklÃ¤rvideos und E-Learning-LÃ¶sungen im deutschsprachigen Raum. Weitere Infos auf https://you-know.de, https://you-know.ch und https://you-know.at.

Du darfst dieses ErklÃ¤rvideo gerne fÃ¼r eigene Zwecke verwenden. Voraussetzung ist, dass du uns namentlich nennst (youknow) und auf unsere Website verlinkst (https://you-know.de). 

â€Niemand auÃŸer dir interessiert sich fÃ¼r deine Produkte. Erstelle interessante Inhalte!â€œ 

So provokativ aber auch prÃ¤gnant bringt der Marketing-Stratege David Meermann Scott eine wichtige Marketing Ãœberlegung auf den Punkt: das Content Marketing.
Beim content marketing stehen Inhalte im Zentrum. Produkt oder Marke rÃ¼cken bewusst in den Hintergrund. Die Inhalte sind informierend, beratend oder auch unterhaltend. Know-how, Werteversprechen und Produktvorteile werden also nicht einfach nur behauptet â€“ sondern durch den Inhalt veranschaulicht.
Aber warum ist das fÃ¼r Sie als Unternehmer wichtig? 
Vor allem emotionale Inhalte und Unternehmenswerte, wie zum Beispiel Nachhaltigkeit oder soziales Handeln, werden mit content marketing gut transportiert. Denn damit sind diese Werte nicht nur leere WorthÃ¼lsen, sondern Sie kÃ¶nnen dem Kunden zeigen, wie Sie die Werte in Ihrem Unternehmen konkret umsetzen. So beeinflussen Sie auch die Wahrnehmung Ihres Unternehmens. 
Kunden suchen nicht nach Produkten, sondern nach LÃ¶sungen und glaubwÃ¼rdigen Antworten. Inhalte die auf dieses BedÃ¼rfnis eingehen, bekommen also mehr Aufmerksamkeit. Im Internet bedeutet das auch eine bessere Platzierung bei Suchmaschinen. AuÃŸerdem wird der Traffic auf Ihrer Website erhÃ¶ht und Sie generieren mehr Leads. 
Um diese Vorteile zu erreichen, muss content marketing aber auch richtig eingesetzt werden: Die Informationen sollen die LÃ¶sung eines Problems aufzeigen, praktisch anwendbares Know-How vermitteln oder Spezialwissen fÃ¼r Fachleute kommunizieren. Content marketing ist also auch fÃ¼r den B2Bâ€‘Bereich wichtig. Die Formen der Umsetzung sind vielfÃ¤ltig: Blogposts, Whitepapers, Infografiken, Videos oder Facebook posts.eignen sich besonders gut. 
Wie gutes content marketing funktioniert zeigt zum Beispiel der Kosmetikhersteller Schwarzkopf mit seinem Internetauftritt. Hier stehen die Infos im Vordergrund! Die Seite wirkt wie eine Frauenzeitschrift, bietet inhaltlichen Mehrwert und gibt praktische Tipps. Die Produkte werden nur dezent plaziert. Ã„hnlich ist es bei Betty Bossi. Sie teilt Ihre Kochrezepte nicht nur im Internet, sondern auch in KochbÃ¼chern und einer Zeitschrift. UrsprÃ¼nglich wurde mit Betty Bossi fÃ¼r die vermehrte Verwendung von Margarine und Ã–l geworben. Heute dient diese Form des content marketing auch dazu, Produkte von Coop zu bewerben.

Denken Sie also daran: Erstellen Sie aussagekrÃ¤ftige Inhalte, dann kommt das Interesse an Ihren Produkten von ganz allein.

title: Content Marketing / Co to jest i dlaczego warto? Fakty i Mity
description:

title: Content Marketing 101 : Insights from a 14-Year Veteran | Ep. 01 | Simplilearn Podcast
description:
In this Simply Learn Podcast episode, we dive deep into the world of content marketing with experienced professional Kartik. He shares invaluable insights on why content is the backbone of marketing and the importance of developing a versatile skill set in this field. Kartik emphasizes the roles of various sub-functions such as email marketing, social media, SEO, and product marketing, highlighting how each plays a crucial part in driving business growth. The conversation also explores how AI and generative AI are revolutionizing content creation and marketing strategies. Kartik sheds light on his own career journey, offering guidance for aspiring content marketers on where to start and how to grow in this ever-evolving industry. Finally, the discussion touches on the importance of continuous learning and how to stay relevant in a rapidly changing landscape.

Everybody talks about the glamor part of being a content creator, earning through brand deals, getting big guests on your channel, and much moreâ€¦

But no one really talks about how to become a content creator and how one can stand out in this field, given the huge competition.

Since I belong to this industry, I decided to make a video on this and document all the important lessons I learned over 4 years of my content creation journey.

In this episode, I've discussed 5 practical steps that you can start implementing from today to start your YouTube channel and I've even covered the number of opportunities that this field can open in your career. 

The best part about content creation is that you can even do it with a job, your business, or other side hustle. It's all about building the right systems and consistency.

description:

Zusammen mit Sarah und Patrick beleuchtet Stephan die Herausforderungen und Chancen, die sich aus einer kohÃ¤renten Strategie fÃ¼r beide Disziplinen ergeben.

title: Net New Value Content #seo #content #marketing
description:
Creating a bunch of â€œwhat isâ€ articles that say whatâ€™s been said a hundred times already is a waste of resources. What you should do instead is create net new value content. Let me explain.

I was talking to Margarita Loktionova (Content Marketing Lead @ Semrush) on a new #MastersOfSearch episode, and she introduced this concept of â€œnet new value content.â€

Her definition: Content that AI cannot easily synthesize from whatâ€™s already online.

This includes proprietary data, customer research, thought leadership, unique points of view. Basically, the content you need to be seen as an authoritative source for AI to reference and cite, but also for people to share and talk about.

_____________________

So hereâ€™s my practical framework for actually creating net new value content:

1) Tap into internal proprietary data

Think about what data sources you have internally that others donâ€™t have access to.

A great example Iâ€™ve seen recently is Ramp, the US-based spend management company. They analyzed their corporate card transaction data to prove that San Francisco tech workers are actually working Saturdays now (the whole 996 schedule trend).

They looked at employee transactions for restaurants, delivery, and takeout by hour of the week. Compared 2025 to 2024. Found a pronounced jump in Saturday activity that wasnâ€™t there before.

This is data only Ramp has. Nobody else can create this analysis. It got shared everywhere.

2) Create research through external surveys

If you donâ€™t have unique internal data, you can create it by surveying your industry.

A great example Iâ€™ve seen for this is from Paddy Moogan (The New Leader), and Rand Fishkin (SparkToro). Paddy surveyed 600+ agency owners about revenue growth, sales pipelines, remote work trends, and AI impact.

They didnâ€™t have this data sitting in a database. They went out and collected it. The result? One of the most comprehensive reports on the state of digital agencies.

_____________________

Once you have these insights, hereâ€™s the multiplier effect:

You can create multiple formats from one research piece.

â†’ Series of blog posts
â†’ Social posts with takeaways
â†’ Interviews with people who participated
â†’ Infographics that highlight key highlights
â†’ Podcast episodes discussing the findings
This is how you turn one piece of research into a content engine.

title: How To Measure Content Marketing ROI
description: Stop guessing if your content works. We break down the key metrics, industry benchmarks (like the 500% 'strong' ROI target), and the tools you need to transform your marketing from a cost center into a predictable revenue engine. title: content marketing | L24
description:
an analytics program tells you how and why people are coming to your site. without it, you know little about your customers, your community, or the content theyâ€™re consuming.

the type of analytics program you use depends on your needs, but most bloggers are comfortable with the free, tried-and-true google analytics. use google analytics to see how many visitors are coming to your pages and what they're doing after they arrive.

analytics programs are simple to install and come with detailed, easy-to-follow instructions. you upload a plug-in or place some code on your blog or website. #education #learning #lecture

What is Digital Marketing?
The digital marketing concept has its roots in traditional marketing methods but has a lot of online-specific aspects. Digital marketing involves connecting with customers and potential customers and convincing them they need your product or service. This is done through the Internet, social media, and other digital platforms. It is also known as ONLINE MARKETING, the most accessible, modern, and easy-to-use form of Promotion available today.

*Discover top digital marketing certifications to kickstart your career. Check out the full blog here* https://www.upgrad.com/blog/top-digital-marketing-certifications-to-kickstart-your-career/

Want to stay ahead in the competitive digital marketing industry? Hello and welcome to upGrad. In this video, we'll reveal the Top 5 Digital Marketing Courses in 2025 that will equip you with the skills and knowledge you need to succeed.

*Top 5 Digital Marketing Courses for 2025*
01:15 5. SEO For Beginners Course by Ahrefs
02:32 4. Digital Marketing Courses by Semrush Academy
04:07 3. Advanced Certificate in Digital Marketing and Communication by upGrad and MICA
07:35 2. Digital Marketing Specialization by University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (Coursera)
09:18 1. LinkedIn Learning's Online Marketing Certified Associate

*Top 5 Digital Marketing Courses for 2025 in Detail*
*1. LinkedIn Learning's Online Marketing Certified Associate:* A 12-hour, self-paced course covering digital marketing disciplines, with certification from OMCP.
*2. Digital Marketing Specialization by University of Illinois:* A 7-course series on Coursera, providing a comprehensive education in digital marketing, with a career certificate upon completion.
*3. Advanced Certificate in Digital Marketing and Communication by upGrad and MICA:* A 4-month program offering industry-aligned curriculum, live projects, and placement support, with flexible payment options.
*4. Digital Marketing Courses by Semrush Academy:* Free courses and certifications covering various digital marketing topics, with interactive content and practical assignments.
*5. SEO For Beginners Course by Ahrefs:* A free, self-paced course covering SEO fundamentals, keyword research, and technical SEO, with a certificate upon completion.

*Digital Marketing Roadmap 2025*
As a beginner, learning Digital Marketing can be challenging, it might feel overwhelming at first. But don't worry! 
*Understand Digital Marketing Fundamentals:* Learn key components like SEO, content marketing, and social media.
*Pursue Online Courses and Certifications:* Take courses and certifications from platforms like we discussed to deepen your knowledge.
*Develop Practical Skills:* Work on hands-on projects to build real-world experience.
Build your personal brand on LinkedIn by optimizing your profile, gaining experience through internships or freelancing, networking with industry professionals, and showcasing your work in a strong portfolio.
*Stay Updated with Industry Trends:* Follow top blogs and podcasts to keep up with the latest developments. Also, you can start your own blog on Digital Marketing. 
Measure and Optimize: Continuously track key metrics and optimize your strategies for better performance.

I hope you found this video insightful and that it helps you choose the right digital marketing course to advance your career! If you enjoyed this video, give it a thumbs up and share it with friends or colleagues who might benefit from it.

We believe that every individual has a unique path to success, and sometimes all it takes is a little guidance to unlock your full potential. Our expert career advisors are ready to help you discover the path that's perfect for you. Don't miss out on this chance to invest in your future.

title: Digital Marketing defined in Tamil | what is digital marketing #shorts
description:
Who is Sangeetha S Abishek?
In this Channel, SSA shares her 14 years of combined experience as a Marketer, Professor and Digital Marketing Consultant.
She is a Digital Marketing consultant working with leading retail brands mainly in fashion. Her clients are spread across Southern India- Chennai, Coimbatore, Madurai, Salem, Bangalore, Hyderabad etc
She helps brands and agencies in formulating Digital marketing strategies and help them work with a specific plan of action.
She is also a Professor at some B Schools teaching Digital marketing for the 2nd year MBA Students.

title: How to Make $1,000 With Affiliate Marketing in 2023
Digital Marketing Interview Questions and Answers
description:
In this video, Faisal Nadeem shared 7 most important digital marketing interview questions and answers or digital marketing course or digital marketing manger interview questions and answers or marketing interview questions and answers or marketing job interview questions and answers for freshers completely explained by @Knowledge Topper with suitable examples.

Q1) Tell me about yourself.
Answer: I am a creative and analytical individual passionate about online marketing. I have basic knowledge of SEO, social media marketing, and content creation, and I am eager to learn more.

Q2) What are the key responsibilities of a digital marketer?
Answer: Managing social media, optimizing content for SEO, running paid ads, analyzing performance metrics, and engaging with target audiences.

Q3) What digital marketing tools are you familiar with?
Answer: Google Analytics, Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, SEMrush, Ahrefs, and Canva for content creation.

Q4) What is SEO, and why is it important?
Answer: SEO (Search Engine Optimization) improves website visibility on search engines, driving organic traffic and increasing brand awareness.

Q5) What is the difference between organic and paid marketing?
Answer: Organic marketing relies on SEO, content, and social media engagement, while paid marketing involves ads like PPC (Pay-Per-Click) for faster results.

Q6) How do you measure the success of a digital marketing campaign?
Answer: By tracking metrics like website traffic, conversion rates, engagement, ROI, and click-through rates (CTR).

Q7) Why do you want to work in digital marketing?
Answer: I enjoy creativity and data-driven strategies, and digital marketing allows me to connect brands with their audiences effectively.

title: Digital Marketing Full Course (2025) | Digital Marketing Complete Course For Beginners | Intellipaat
description:
This Digital Marketing Course by Intellipaat is designed to provide a complete understanding of modern online marketing strategies and tools. The course starts with an introduction to digital marketing and dives into social media marketing, consumer behavior, and the networks of channels that drive online engagement. You will gain practical knowledge of search engine optimization (SEO), including keyword research, SEO planning, content optimization, and copywriting for higher rankings. Hands-on demonstrations using tools like Google Ads Keyword Planner, SEMrush, and WordPress will help you understand real-world applications of digital marketing strategies.

 The course also covers technical SEO essentials such as indexing, website experience, and optimization techniques to improve performance. Off-page SEO strategies, including backlink building, are explained in detail to enhance authority and visibility. With insights into measuring SEO success and understanding different types of content, this training ensures you are equipped with both theoretical knowledge and practical expertise. Perfect for beginners and professionals, this digital marketing tutorial will help you master SEO, social media, and content strategies to grow in 2025 and beyond.

description:
What is marketing? Get to Know in seconds:

Imagine you own a circus and bring it to a city:

Advertising: Putting up posters everywhere to spread the word.

Promotion: Sticking a poster on an elephant and parading it around the city.

Publicity: If the elephant enters a politicianâ€™s garden and the story gets covered in the news.

Public Relations (PR): If the politician laughs about it, creating a positive image.

Sales: Informing people about ticket prices, performances, and tricks.

And if you plan, manage, and execute all this, thatâ€™s perfect marketing!

title: ğŸ”¥Will AI Take Over Digital Marketing ? | Will AI Replace Digital Marketers AI ? #Shorts #Simplilearn
description:
In this video on Will AI Take Over Digital Marketing ?, we explore the impact of AI on the future of digital marketing. Will AI take over? Discover how AI is revolutionizing content creation, customer engagement, and data analysis, offering unprecedented efficiency and personalization. We'll delve into the benefits and potential challenges, examining whether AI will complement or replace human marketers.

Join us as we chat with a digital marketing professional who shares their insights on the role of AI in the industry. They explain how AI is seen as a powerful tool that handles repetitive tasks and provides valuable data insights, allowing marketers to focus on creative and strategic aspects. AI acts like a super-smart assistant, enhancing skills and making the job more interesting.

We'll discuss real-world examples, expert opinions, and what this means for the future of digital marketing. Whether you're a marketer, a business owner, or just curious about AI's impact, this video offers a comprehensive look at how AI is shaping the digital marketing landscape. Don't miss this deep dive into the evolving world of AI-driven marketing! Subscribe for more insightful content.

#DigitalMarketing #DigitalMarketingProfessional #BestCourses #OnlineCourses #Shorts #YTShorts #DM #Simplilearn

âœ…Will AI Replace Digital Marketers?
AI enhances, not replaces, digital marketers. It handles repetitive tasks and offers insights, allowing marketers to focus on creativity and strategy.

âœ…How AI is Revolutionizing Digital Marketing
AI automates content creation, customer segmentation, and social media management, providing data insights for more effective and personalized campaigns.

âœ…Benefits of AI in Digital Marketing
AI boosts efficiency and accuracy, personalizes customer experiences, and optimizes ad strategies, making it a game-changer for digital marketers.

title: Top 8 skills required to become a digital marketing expert in 2023
description:
ğŸŒ Top 8 Skills Required to Become a Digital Marketing Expert in 2023

The digital marketing world is evolving rapidly, and to stand out in this competitive landscape, one needs a blend of creativity, analytics, and strategy. Here are the top 8 skills every aspiring digital marketer must master in 2023:

1ï¸âƒ£ SEO & SEM Mastery â€“ Understanding how search engines work, optimizing websites for visibility, and running paid ad campaigns is the backbone of digital success.

2ï¸âƒ£ Content Marketing â€“ High-quality, engaging, and value-driven content across blogs, videos, reels, and infographics helps brands build authority and trust.

3ï¸âƒ£ Social Media Marketing â€“ Platforms like Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, and Twitter demand strategy-driven campaigns to connect with the right audience and boost brand awareness.

4ï¸âƒ£ Data Analytics â€“ Learning tools like Google Analytics, GA4, and marketing dashboards to measure campaign success and make data-driven decisions.

5ï¸âƒ£ Email Marketing â€“ Personalized, automated, and conversion-focused email campaigns are still one of the highest ROI strategies in 2023.

6ï¸âƒ£ Paid Advertising (PPC & Performance Marketing) â€“ Mastery of Google Ads, Meta Ads, and programmatic advertising ensures maximum ROI for every marketing budget.

7ï¸âƒ£ Video Marketing & Storytelling â€“ Short-form videos, YouTube content, and storytelling strategies are essential for capturing attention and driving engagement.

8ï¸âƒ£ Marketing Automation & AI Tools â€“ Leveraging AI-driven tools for content creation, chatbots, predictive analytics, and CRM automation to stay ahead of the competition.

âœ… To become a Digital Marketing Expert in 2023, one needs not just technical knowledge but also adaptability, creativity, and a strong understanding of consumer psychology.

title: Digital Marketing is Officially Dead | Case Study | Sahil Khanna
description:
Are digital marketing agencies becoming obsolete? In this video, we dive deep into how giants like Meta and Google are fundamentally changing the advertising landscape with AI. Traditional digital marketing, especially manual targeting, is fading away, making way for sophisticated algorithms that know your customers better than you do.

We explore the shift from manual control to automated systems like Meta's Advantage+ and Google's Performance Max. Is there a future for digital marketers when AI can create ad creatives, predict consumer reactions using neuroscience, and optimize campaigns automatically? The answer is YES, but your role is about to change dramatically.

title: How much does a DIGITAL MARKETING COMPANY make?
Digital Marketing in Kenya: Why Weâ€™re Still Bargaining Over Value
description:
Digital Marketing in Kenya: Why Weâ€™re Still Bargaining Over Value

Letâ€™s talk about something frustrating.

I pitched SEO services to a Kenyan business.
Explained how if someone searches for their product or service, they could appear on Google, get traffic, and grow their business.

Their first reaction?

â€œEh, hiyo bei iko juu... unaweza reduce kidogo?â€

Five thousand shillings.
And weâ€™re already in the tupunguzie zone.

Now hereâ€™s the twist.

I pitched the exact same thing â€” same words, same process â€” to a Muzungu client.
Not once did they ask, â€œWhy does it cost that much?â€
They didnâ€™t even blink. Because they understand one thing Kenyan businesses are still struggling with:

Digital marketing is not an expense. Itâ€™s growth fuel.

I have a rule in my agency:
I donâ€™t negotiate on price. I negotiate on service.
You want a value add? Iâ€™ll throw in an extra post, a report, or some analytics.
But I wonâ€™t lower the cost. Ever.

Why? Because once you start devaluing your work, clients start devaluing you.

Digital marketing is not just about logos and pretty captions.
Itâ€™s about visibility, trust, and conversions.
If you donâ€™t see that â€” youâ€™re not ready for the game.
And the clients who get it? Theyâ€™re already playing internationally.

Dear Kenyan businesses:
If you keep asking for 3K work, youâ€™ll keep getting 300-shilling results.

#DigitalMarketingKenya #ValueVsCost #KnowYourWorth #ElvisW #SEOInKenya #MarketingMaturity #MuzunguPerception #WorkSmartAfrica #StopBargainingStartGrowing

The Psychology of People Who Donâ€™t Post on Social Media
description:
The Psychology of People Who Donâ€™t Post on Social Media

We live in a world obsessed with sharing, yet some people remain completely invisible online. They scroll quietly, observe deeply, and never post. Why do they choose silence when the whole world is shouting for attention? This video dives deep into the fascinating psychology behind 'ghost scrollers' and non-posters. It's not just about being shy; itâ€™s about control, emotional independence, and a quiet rebellion against a culture that equates visibility with value. We explore the concepts of psychological ownership, internal locus of control, and the hidden peace found when you detach your worth from digital applause. If you've ever felt burnt out by the performance of social media, or wondered about the power of being unseen, this analysis is for you. Discover why sometimes, the most profound things happen quietly, and how non-posters might just be guarding their authenticity in a staged world.
