title: Is Social Media Hurting Your Mental Health? | Bailey Parnell | TEDxRyersonU
description:
Scrolling through our social media feeds feels like a harmless part of our daily lives. But is it actually as harmless at seems? According to social media expert Bailey Parnell, our growing and unchecked obsession with social media has unintended long term consequences on our mental health. As social media continues to become part of the fabric of modern life â€“ the â€œdigital layerâ€ â€“ abstinence is becoming less of an option. Bailey think itâ€™s high time we learned to practice safe social before itâ€™s too late. What are the common triggers? How are they affecting you over time? How can you create a more positive experience online? Bailey covers this and more in â€œIs Social Media Hurting Your Mental Health?â€  

Bailey Parnell was recently named one of Canada's Top 100 Most Powerful Women. She is an award-winning digital marketer, public speaker and businesswoman with a talent for helping people tell better stories. Her work and expertise have been featured on CBC, CTV & in other local Toronto media. Bailey recently founded SkillsCamp, a soft skills training company where they help people develop the essential skills needed for professional success. She also currently works in digital marketing at Ryerson University. 

Bailey is a frequent public speaker having spoken to more than 10 thousand people. She primarily speaks about social media, personal branding, and media and mental health. She guest lectured her first MBA class at 21-years-old and has been the youngest speaker as multiple academic conferences. She is currently pursuing her Masters in Communication and Culture with a research focus on social media and mental health, and holds an honours BA from the RTA School of Media at Ryerson.

This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Why I Quit Social Media & How it Changed My Life (Already)
description:
In this video, I talk about my journey of quitting social media and the surprising freedom that came with it. I grew up without social media, but once I got into it, I found myself constantly living for other peopleâ€™s approval instead of focusing on my own life. The frustration of low engagement on Instagram, the pressure to keep up, and the endless comparisons left me feeling anxious, depressed, and disconnected from my own reality.
But after just a few days without the constant noise of social media, I gained so much mental clarity and space. Iâ€™ve learned to appreciate my life more and live in the moment, rather than in the lives of others. This video is all about how stepping away from social media has helped me rediscover gratitude and peace.

If youâ€™ve ever felt trapped by the need for likes and followers, or just want to learn how to be more present, this video is for you.

title: How to Successfully Delete Social Media | Dr. Cal Newport & Dr. Andrew Huberman
description:
Dr. Cal Newport and Dr. Andrew Huberman discuss the effects of social media on human potential, focusing on how social media can sometimes mask unmet potential and interests, and how taking a break from it can lead to productive self-reflection, untapped creativity, and enriched lives.

Cal Newport, Ph.D. (@CalNewportMedia), is a professor of computer science at Georgetown University and bestselling author of numerous books on focus and productivity and how to access the deepest possible layers of your cognitive abilities in order to do quality work and lead a more balanced life. Dr. Andrew Huberman is a tenured professor of neurobiology and ophthalmology at Stanford University School of Medicine and host of the Huberman Lab podcast.

Watch the full episode: https://youtu.be/p4ZfkezDTXQ

title: Social media battleğŸ”¥ğŸ˜‚
How Social Media Slowly Ruins Society & What You Can Do
description:
The war for attention isnâ€™t just about distractionâ€”itâ€™s about control. Itâ€™s a battle to influence how you think, what you value, and how you act.

And if we donâ€™t wake up to whatâ€™s happening, we risk losing the most important thing we have: our ability to think for ourselves.

The ability to direct your attentionâ€”to consciously choose what you consume and how you engageâ€”is the most powerful skill you possess.

So if youâ€™ve reduced â€œbrain rotâ€ down to being a social media problem, concluding that we should just reduce our screen time to improve our mental health, then I have bad news for youâ€¦

Youâ€™ve only scratched the surface.

This is the war of our time. And itâ€™s time we fight back.

In this video I discuss discuss the silent epidemic which plagues the modern world: brain rot.

Defined as Oxfordâ€™s word of the year in 2024, brain rot is the deterioration of a personâ€™s mental or intellectual state, especially as a result of overconsumption of material considered to be trivial or unchallenging.

title: The Psychology of People Who Donâ€™t Post on Social Media | Elon Musk
description:
In a world where everyone is encouraged to share everything, there exists a quiet group of people who choose the opposite. They don't post their vacations, their meals, or their achievementsâ€”not because they're hiding, but because they've discovered something most of us overlook. This video explores the fascinating psychology behind people who rarely share on social media and why their silence might actually be a sign of strength, not weakness. We'll dive into the power of privacy, the freedom that comes from living without an audience, and why mystery in an oversaturated world creates more value than constant visibility.

If you've ever felt exhausted by the pressure to document everything, or if you've wondered what it would be like to simply live without performing, this video offers a different perspective. We'll examine how not posting protects your emotional security, deepens your relationships, and allows you to reclaim experiences as truly your own. Whether you're someone who shares constantly or someone who prefers to stay quiet, this exploration will challenge how you think about identity, connection, and what it means to live authentically in the digital age. Join us for a thoughtful conversation about choosing presence over performance and discovering who you are when no one is watching.

Disclaimer: This is a fan-made channel, and its content is not affiliated with Elon Musk or his companies. The videos are inspired by Elon Musk's public statements and ideas for educational and motivational purposes only, using a synthesized voice that does not belong to Elon Musk. We use visual lip-syncing and dubbed narration to match the spoken words with on-screen footage, purely to enhance clarity, create a cinematic experience, and make the content more engaging for viewers. 

Our aim is to amplify the original message by making it easier to understand for the end consumer, helping us reach and educate more people with Elon Musk's valuable perspectives. We also make the messages of Elon Musk more accessible to people who are deaf or hard of hearing by applying professional transcription to the majority of our videos. We share his visionary ideas in a respectful and inspiring manner, without any intent to mislead.

Our channelâ€™s content is based on facts, rumors, and fiction. Nothing on this channel is financial or medical advice. Like Elon Musk uses AI in most of his companies, we may sometimes use AI models to help us with specific video production and publishing processes for this channel.

#elonmusk #elonmuskmotivation #elonmuskpsychology

title: What Social Media Is Doing To Gen Alpha, with Jonathan Haidt
description:
Is social media rewiring childhood and fueling a mental health crisis? Neil deGrasse Tyson is joined by comic co-host Chuck Nice and Gary Oâ€™Reilly to explore the costs of growing up online and how to take back childhood with social psychologist and author of The Anxious Generation, Jonathan Haidt.

Have we been overprotecting kids in the real world and underprotecting them online? What happens when children miss out on risky play that builds resilience and antifragility? Could over-cushioned playgrounds and cancelled sports have set the stage long before Instagram arrived? 

We discuss the developing brain in adolescents and why it's a critical period for socialization. How does myelination contribute to locking in behaviors during puberty? What happens if social skills fail to develop during critical windows? Can TikTok rewiring replace the conflict and growth of real-world interaction?

Are tech companies exploiting adolescent fears of missing out? Do algorithms push kids toward loneliness instead of connection? We compare which platforms cause the most harm: Instagramâ€™s social comparison, TikTokâ€™s â€œbrainrot,â€ Snapchatâ€™s dangers, or Discordâ€™s hidden risks.

How will Gen Z, the first generation raised on the internet, raise their own children? Can communities, schools, and even state laws restore independence and protect kids without criminalizing parents? And how do we confront the next wave of technologies, AI â€œfriendsâ€ embedded in toys, and chatbots designed to keep children hooked?

Learn about the four steps individuals and communities can take to help reclaim childhood socialization: no smartphones before high school, no social media before 16, phone-free schools, and far more independence in the real world. Will families, educators, and governments rally to make this change or are we heading for â€œsociological apocalypseâ€?

Thanks to our Patrons Maz Dunic, gummibear359, Jack Bovee, Richard McCullough, Margaret, Daniel Zaibelt, Micheka K, Steph, Laura Kat Corey, Mark Benthien, Thompson Mhlanga, Robbie James, Micheal Fields, Nathanial Evans, John Malkin, Jonathan Madsen, Luis, Pete hall in Wi, Boonifa-Latifa-Shaweefa-Haweefa-Erikson-Vendez-Jackson-Hausenfef the First, Timmy Johansson, Shatesha, Jay, Lynne Henderson, Nimrod Nir, Candice Manion, Cody Rosenberg, Hai-Tue Han, Brandon DeYoung, Robert Guillot, james, Edward Madden, Jan Bart Verbist, Matthias, Orlando Calvo Arias, Raghav Kaushik, Elisa Castro, No Name, Samuel Griffith, Suresh Narayanan, Chris, Jacob, Duvall, Maarten van Nieuwstadt, Sockrateez, Cozine_stones, ERICA LOPEZ, Larry Maguire, jeffrey l. mueller, Hugo Dart, Alex Wayne, summer barker, Jonathan Thomas-Stagg, and  Vanniar Hernandez Giniebra for supporting us this week.

title: If ALL Social Media Became Illegal
Social Media Is Over â€” This Is the Future of Content | GaryVee w/ Mick Unplugged
description:
Todayâ€™s episode is a podcast with Mick Hunt from @mickunplugged, and we go all-in on why people are stuck, how â€œinterest mediaâ€ has changed the entire game, and why your niche is YOU. We talk entitlement, fear, content strategy, negativity, family energy, and why accountability is the cheat code most people refuse to use. Hope you enjoy!

00:00 â€“ â€œThe only niche is youâ€
02:15 â€“ Interest media vs social media (the game changed)
04:30 â€“ Why random honest content still wins

#garyvee #mindset #entrepreneurship #motivation #selfawareness #accountability #contentstrategy #interestmedia #veefriends #mickunplugged

Did you catch my Q&A with John Hu, founder of Stan? Check it out here: https://garyvee.com/stanpod
â€”
Thanks for watching!

Sign up for the GaryVee x Stan challenge: http://www.garyvee.com/stan
Join My Discord!: http://www.garyvee.com/discord
Check out another series on my channel:
Gary Vaynerchuk Keynote Speeches: http://www.garyvee.com/keynotespeeches
Gary Vaynerchuk's thoughts on NFTs, Web3, cryptocurrencies and more: http://www.garyvee.com/web3nfts
Life, Business, and Career Advice l Gary Vaynerchuk Original Films: http://www.garyvee.com/gvoriginals
How to Make Money at Garage Sales l TrashTalk: http://www.garyvee.com/trashtalks
Inside the Life of a $300M+ Company's CEO l DailyVee: http://www.garyvee.com/dailyvees
â€” 
Gary Vaynerchuk is a serial entrepreneur and serves as the Chairman of VaynerX, the CEO of VaynerMedia, and the CEO and creator of VeeFriends. Gary is considered one of the leading global minds on what's next in culture, business, and the internet.

Known as "GaryVee," he is described as one of the most forward thinkers in business. He acutely recognizes trends and patterns early to help others understand how shifts in consumer attention impact the realities of the business world today. Gary's approach sits at the intersection of business and pop culture. He keenly understands how to bring brand relevance to the forefront. He is a prolific angel investor with early investments in companies like Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Venmo, Snapchat, Coinbase, and Uber.

Gary is an entrepreneur at heart â€“ he builds businesses. Today, he helps Fortune 1000 brands leverage consumer attention through his full-service advertising agency, VaynerMedia, which has offices in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Miami, Toronto, Mexico City, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, Singapore, Tokyo, Bangkok, Delhi, and Kuala Lumpur. VaynerMedia is part of the VaynerX holding company, which also includes Eva Nosidam Productions, Gallery Media Group, The Sasha Group, VaynerSpeakers, VaynerCommerce, and Tingley Lane Trading. Gary is the Co-Founder of VaynerSports, VCR Group, VaynerWatt, ArtOfficial, Resy, and Empathy Wines. He guided Resy and Empathy to successful exits -- which he later sold to American Express and Constellation Brands, respectively. He also owns a Major League Pickleball team called the 5s, is part owner of a Big3 basketball team, and is an investor in the revival of the SlamBall League.

In 2021, Gary created VeeFriends, an entertainment company that has become a rising powerhouse in modern entertainment and collectibles. Often described as Pokemon meets Sesame Street, the company leverages stories, games, events, collectibles, and technology to scale its character universe. Vaynerchuk also has negotiated partnerships with brand powerhouses such as Crocs, Fanatics, Macyâ€™s/Toys â€œRâ€ Us, Mattelâ€™s UNO, Mattelâ€™s Masters of the Universe, Moonbug Entertainment, Reebok, Squishmallows, Topps, and more.

Gary is also the founder and creator of VeeCon â€“ a contemporary super conference that converges business and pop culture with innovation and technology. He is a six-time New York Times bestselling author, with titles including Crush It!, Jab, Jab, Jab, Right Hook, Twelve and a Half and Day Trading Attention. In addition to running multiple businesses, Gary documents his daily life as a CEO through his social media channels, which have more than 45 million followers and garner more than 300 million monthly impressions/views across all platforms. His podcast, "The GaryVee Audio Experience," ranks among the top podcasts globally.

Gary serves on the board of MikMak, Bojangles Restaurants, Global Citizen Forum, The Paley Center, and Pencils of Promise. He is also a longtime Well Member of charity: water.

Gary's life ambition is to buy the New York Jets.

title: The Internet is Worse Than Ever â€“ Now What?
description:
Go to https://ground.news/nutshell to get 30% off unlimited access to Ground News - a website and app that gathers the worldâ€™s news in one place so you can compare coverage and find common ground. 

Sources & further reading: https://sites.google.com/view/sources-why-we-hate-each-other/

In 2022 nearly half of Americans expected a civil war in the next few years, one in five now believes political violence is justified. And it is not just the US but around the world. People increasingly see themselves as part of opposing teams.

There are many different reasons for this, but one gets blamed a lot: social media. Social media divides us, makes us more extreme and less empathetic, it riles us up or sucks us into doom scrolling, making us stressed and depressed. It feels like we need to touch grass and escape to the real world. 

New research shows that we might have largely misinterpreted why this is the case. It turns out that the social media internet may uniquely undermine the way our brains work but not in the way you think.

title: How to Make Learning as Addictive as Social Media | Duolingo's Luis Von Ahn | TED
description:
When technologist Luis von Ahn was building the popular language-learning platform Duolingo, he faced a big problem: Could an app designed to teach you something ever compete with addictive platforms like Instagram and TikTok? He explains how Duolingo harnesses the psychological techniques of social media and mobile games to get you excited to learn â€” all while spreading access to education across the world.

title: Why Australia is Blocking Children from Social Media? | Vantage with Palki Sharma | N18G
description:
Australia will enforce a nationwide ban on social media accounts for all children under 16 from 10 December. The law, passed last year, requires platforms to shut down existing underage accounts, block new sign-ups and verify user ages through technologies such as facial estimation, video selfies, government ID checks and AI-based tools. Major platforms like Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Snapchat, X, YouTube, Reddit, Threads, Twitch and Kick are included, while WhatsApp and Pinterest are excluded. The move follows data showing 96% of Australian children aged 10 to 15 use social media, with high exposure to harmful content. Other countries are watching the rollout.

---

Australia | Social Media | Bill | Teens | Ban | Firstpost | World News | News Live | Vantage | Palki Sharma | News

title: The Battle for Your Time: Exposing the Costs of Social Media | Dino Ambrosi | TEDxLagunaBlancaSchool
description:
Do we truly comprehend how much of our time and attention is given to technology? In his talk, Dino Ambrosi reframes how we think about our relationships to devices, and shares his ideas on how to create healthy digital habits. 
 Dino Ambrosi, the founder of Project Reboot, is an expert at guiding teens and young adults to relationships with technology that empower them. While studying at UC Berkeley, he created a popular course called Becoming Tech Intentional which he taught to over 60 of his fellow students who reduced their screen time by an average of over 3 hours per day. After graduating in May, he embarked on a mission to spread the contents of his course to a broader audience. Through school assemblies, workshops, and consulting, he has worked with over 500 students and parents to raise awareness about the addictive potential of our devices, drive conversations around digital wellness, and deliver practical strategies to build healthy digital habits. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: How Smartphones & Social Media Impact Mental Health & the Realistic Solutions | Dr. Jonathan Haidt
description:
In this episode, my guest is Dr. Jonathan Haidt, Ph.D., professor of social psychology at New York University and bestselling author on how technology and culture impact the psychology and health of kids, teens, and adults. We discuss the dramatic rise of suicide, depression, and anxiety as a result of replacing a play-based childhood with smartphones, social media, and video games.
Â 
He explains how a screen-filled childhood leads to challenges in psychological development that negatively impact learning, resilience, identity, cooperation, and conflict resolution â€” all of which are crucial skills for future adult relationships and career success. We also discuss how phones and social media impact boys and girls differently and the underlying neurobiological mechanisms of how smartphones alter basic brain plasticity and function.Â 
Â 
Dr. Haidt explains his four recommendations for healthier smartphone use in kids, and we discuss how to restore childhood independence and play in the current generation.Â 

This is an important topic for everyone, young or old, parents and teachers, students and families, to be aware of in order to understand the potential mental health toll of smartphone use and to apply tools to foster skill-building and reestablish healthy norms for our kids.

Access the full show notes, including referenced articles, books, people mentioned, and additional resources: https://www.hubermanlab.com/episode/dr-jonathan-haidt-how-smartphones-social-media-impact-mental-health-the-realistic-solutions

title: Can we really blame social media? A research showdown.
description:
Use code 'Howtown' to save 10% off all Riverside plans: https://creators.riverside.com/Howtown

To support independent science journalism
JOIN OUR PATREON: https://www.patreon.com/Howtown
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@howtown_
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/howtown_videos/

This is a pilot episode of a new podcast-like format that we're calling "Howtown Showdown." In it, we flip a coin to take sides in a contentious scientific debate and look for the strongest evidence supporting our respective positions. For this first episode, we dive into the academic controversy sparked by Jonathan Haidt's best-selling book, The Anxious Generation, which argues that social media apps on smartphones are a major driver of declining mental-health outcomes among young people. The trends show rising anxiety, depression, and self-harm among teenagers in the United States and several other English-speaking countries. But does the evidence really show that social media is the problem? 

Numbered sources and further reading: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AdAhgQtJ7dfzc7w1lEFSCqkF8Q6HXbum2scNvTJ4LR4/edit?usp=sharing

title: Meta to start closing Australian teen accounts ahead of social media ban | BBC News
description:
Australian teenagers on Instagram, Facebook and Threads are being told their accounts will be shut down ahead of the country's social media ban for under-16s.
 
Meta, which owns the three brands, said it had begun notifying users it believes to be between 13 and 15 years old that their accounts would start being deactivated from 4 December.
 
Itâ€™s the worldâ€™s strictest law relating to social media and the way young people use it.
 
The ban comes into force on 10 December and affects a number of platforms which also include TikTok, YouTube, X and Reddit.
 
Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said the ban was aimed at "letting kids be kids". Meta and other firms oppose the measure but said they would comply.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news

title: everyone wants to log off, but who actually can?
description:
please consider supporting the channel on patreon: https://www.patreon.com/blackteanosugar

in a world where weâ€™re perpetually plugged in, itâ€™s easy to forget that going #offline used to just meanâ€¦ turning off your computer.
now the internet bleeds into every corner of our lives - work, relationships, entertainment, even rest - and more people than ever are burning out from the constant #doomscrolling. moreover, logging off has shifted from a simple choice to a full-blown lifestyle trendâ€¦ one thatâ€™s being packaged, branded, and sold back to us.

so in this video weâ€™re talking everything wrong with todayâ€™s social media (#aislop , #brainrot, algorithmic chaos), the rise of â€œdigital detoxâ€ content and social media quitting, why being offline has become a status symbol, and how disconnection itself is turning into a luxury most people canâ€™t afford.

title: Psychology of People Who Don't Post their Photos on Social Media
description:
Why do some people never post pictures online â€” no selfies, no updates, no trace of their personal life?
In a world that rewards visibility, their silence stands out.

Psychology says this behavior reveals something deeper â€” about confidence, boundaries, and emotional intelligence.
These people might not crave attention, but they understand something most of us overlook about human nature and the digital world.

In this video, youâ€™ll discover the real psychology behind people who choose privacy over popularity â€” and why that might be a sign of strength, not insecurity.

This insight goes beyond social media. Itâ€™s about self-awareness, identity, and how deeply our minds adapt to constant exposure.

title: How Social Media saved a man's marriage life ğŸ˜±ğŸ™ #shorts
The Psychology of People Who Donâ€™t Post on Social Media
description:
The Psychology of People Who Donâ€™t Post on Social Media

We live in a world obsessed with sharing, yet some people remain completely invisible online. They scroll quietly, observe deeply, and never post. Why do they choose silence when the whole world is shouting for attention? This video dives deep into the fascinating psychology behind 'ghost scrollers' and non-posters. It's not just about being shy; itâ€™s about control, emotional independence, and a quiet rebellion against a culture that equates visibility with value. We explore the concepts of psychological ownership, internal locus of control, and the hidden peace found when you detach your worth from digital applause. If you've ever felt burnt out by the performance of social media, or wondered about the power of being unseen, this analysis is for you. Discover why sometimes, the most profound things happen quietly, and how non-posters might just be guarding their authenticity in a staged world.

title: Social Media Is Over â€” This Is the Future of Content | GaryVee w/ Mick Unplugged
description:
Todayâ€™s episode is a podcast with Mick Hunt from @mickunplugged, and we go all-in on why people are stuck, how â€œinterest mediaâ€ has changed the entire game, and why your niche is YOU. We talk entitlement, fear, content strategy, negativity, family energy, and why accountability is the cheat code most people refuse to use. Hope you enjoy!

00:00 â€“ â€œThe only niche is youâ€
02:15 â€“ Interest media vs social media (the game changed)
04:30 â€“ Why random honest content still wins
06:50 â€“ Followers donâ€™t matter anymore
13:20 â€“ Money, materialism, and living outside your means
16:05 â€“ Blame vs accountability
19:00 â€“ Cutting negative energy (even family)
24:10 â€“ Why intent is everything
26:40 â€“ Being original vs copying the culture
29:00 â€“ Garage sale flips and $19 to $59k
34:50 â€“ Collectibles as the next cultural pillar
36:30 â€“ How authenticity turns into impact

#garyvee #mindset #entrepreneurship #motivation #selfawareness #accountability #contentstrategy #interestmedia #veefriends #mickunplugged

Did you catch my Q&A with John Hu, founder of Stan? Check it out here: https://garyvee.com/stanpod
â€”
Thanks for watching!

Sign up for the GaryVee x Stan challenge: http://www.garyvee.com/stan
Join My Discord!: http://www.garyvee.com/discord
Check out another series on my channel:
Gary Vaynerchuk Keynote Speeches: http://www.garyvee.com/keynotespeeches
Gary Vaynerchuk's thoughts on NFTs, Web3, cryptocurrencies and more: http://www.garyvee.com/web3nfts
Life, Business, and Career Advice l Gary Vaynerchuk Original Films: http://www.garyvee.com/gvoriginals
How to Make Money at Garage Sales l TrashTalk: http://www.garyvee.com/trashtalks
Inside the Life of a $300M+ Company's CEO l DailyVee: http://www.garyvee.com/dailyvees
â€” 
Gary Vaynerchuk is a serial entrepreneur and serves as the Chairman of VaynerX, the CEO of VaynerMedia, and the CEO and creator of VeeFriends. Gary is considered one of the leading global minds on what's next in culture, business, and the internet.

Known as "GaryVee," he is described as one of the most forward thinkers in business. He acutely recognizes trends and patterns early to help others understand how shifts in consumer attention impact the realities of the business world today. Gary's approach sits at the intersection of business and pop culture. He keenly understands how to bring brand relevance to the forefront. He is a prolific angel investor with early investments in companies like Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Venmo, Snapchat, Coinbase, and Uber.

Gary is an entrepreneur at heart â€“ he builds businesses. Today, he helps Fortune 1000 brands leverage consumer attention through his full-service advertising agency, VaynerMedia, which has offices in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Miami, Toronto, Mexico City, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, Singapore, Tokyo, Bangkok, Delhi, and Kuala Lumpur. VaynerMedia is part of the VaynerX holding company, which also includes Eva Nosidam Productions, Gallery Media Group, The Sasha Group, VaynerSpeakers, VaynerCommerce, and Tingley Lane Trading. Gary is the Co-Founder of VaynerSports, VCR Group, VaynerWatt, ArtOfficial, Resy, and Empathy Wines. He guided Resy and Empathy to successful exits -- which he later sold to American Express and Constellation Brands, respectively. He also owns a Major League Pickleball team called the 5s, is part owner of a Big3 basketball team, and is an investor in the revival of the SlamBall League.

In 2021, Gary created VeeFriends, an entertainment company that has become a rising powerhouse in modern entertainment and collectibles. Often described as Pokemon meets Sesame Street, the company leverages stories, games, events, collectibles, and technology to scale its character universe. Vaynerchuk also has negotiated partnerships with brand powerhouses such as Crocs, Fanatics, Macyâ€™s/Toys â€œRâ€ Us, Mattelâ€™s UNO, Mattelâ€™s Masters of the Universe, Moonbug Entertainment, Reebok, Squishmallows, Topps, and more.

Gary is also the founder and creator of VeeCon â€“ a contemporary super conference that converges business and pop culture with innovation and technology. He is a six-time New York Times bestselling author, with titles including Crush It!, Jab, Jab, Jab, Right Hook, Twelve and a Half and Day Trading Attention. In addition to running multiple businesses, Gary documents his daily life as a CEO through his social media channels, which have more than 45 million followers and garner more than 300 million monthly impressions/views across all platforms. His podcast, "The GaryVee Audio Experience," ranks among the top podcasts globally.

Gary serves on the board of MikMak, Bojangles Restaurants, Global Citizen Forum, The Paley Center, and Pencils of Promise. He is also a longtime Well Member of charity: water.

Gary's life ambition is to buy the New York Jets.

For the first time in history, mental illness and suicide have become one of the greatest threats to school-aged children. Many parents still view dangers as primarily physical and external, but theyâ€™re missing the real danger: kids spending more time online and less time engaging in real life, free play, and autonomy. What are the effects on the next generation's mental, physical, and spiritual health? Childhood was more or less unchanged for millennia, but this is CHILDHOOD 2.0.

title: The Internet is Worse Than Ever â€“ Now What?
description:
Go to https://ground.news/nutshell to get 30% off unlimited access to Ground News - a website and app that gathers the worldâ€™s news in one place so you can compare coverage and find common ground. 

Sources & further reading: https://sites.google.com/view/sources-why-we-hate-each-other/

In 2022 nearly half of Americans expected a civil war in the next few years, one in five now believes political violence is justified. And it is not just the US but around the world. People increasingly see themselves as part of opposing teams.

There are many different reasons for this, but one gets blamed a lot: social media. Social media divides us, makes us more extreme and less empathetic, it riles us up or sucks us into doom scrolling, making us stressed and depressed. It feels like we need to touch grass and escape to the real world. 

New research shows that we might have largely misinterpreted why this is the case. It turns out that the social media internet may uniquely undermine the way our brains work but not in the way you think.

â€” 
Gary Vaynerchuk is a serial entrepreneur and serves as the Chairman of VaynerX, the CEO of VaynerMedia, and the CEO and creator of VeeFriends. Gary is considered one of the leading global minds on what's next in culture, business, and the internet.

Known as "GaryVee," he is described as one of the most forward thinkers in business. He acutely recognizes trends and patterns early to help others understand how shifts in consumer attention impact the realities of the business world today. Gary's approach sits at the intersection of business and pop culture. He keenly understands how to bring brand relevance to the forefront. He is a prolific angel investor with early investments in companies like Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Venmo, Snapchat, Coinbase, and Uber.

Gary is an entrepreneur at heart â€“ he builds businesses. Today, he helps Fortune 1000 brands leverage consumer attention through his full-service advertising agency, VaynerMedia, which has offices in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Miami, Toronto, Mexico City, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, Singapore, Tokyo, Bangkok, Delhi, and Kuala Lumpur. VaynerMedia is part of the VaynerX holding company, which also includes Eva Nosidam Productions, Gallery Media Group, The Sasha Group, VaynerSpeakers, VaynerCommerce, and Tingley Lane Trading. Gary is the Co-Founder of VaynerSports, VCR Group, VaynerWatt, ArtOfficial, Resy, and Empathy Wines. He guided Resy and Empathy to successful exits -- which he later sold to American Express and Constellation Brands, respectively. He also owns a Major League Pickleball team called the 5s, is part owner of a Big3 basketball team, and is an investor in the revival of the SlamBall League.

In 2021, Gary created VeeFriends, an entertainment company that has become a rising powerhouse in modern entertainment and collectibles. Often described as Pokemon meets Sesame Street, the company leverages stories, games, events, collectibles, and technology to scale its character universe. Vaynerchuk also has negotiated partnerships with brand powerhouses such as Crocs, Fanatics, Macyâ€™s/Toys â€œRâ€ Us, Mattelâ€™s UNO, Mattelâ€™s Masters of the Universe, Moonbug Entertainment, Reebok, Squishmallows, Topps, and more.

Gary is also the founder and creator of VeeCon â€“ a contemporary super conference that converges business and pop culture with innovation and technology. He is a six-time New York Times bestselling author, with titles including Crush It!, Jab, Jab, Jab, Right Hook, Twelve and a Half and Day Trading Attention. His social media channels have more than 45 million followers and garner more than 300 million monthly impressions/views across all platforms. His podcast, "The GaryVee Audio Experience," ranks among the top podcasts globally.

Gary serves on the board of MikMak, Bojangles Restaurants, Global Citizen Forum, The Paley Center, and Pencils of Promise. He is also a longtime Well Member of charity: water.

Gary's life ambition is to buy the New York Jets.

title: AI Marketing: What is AI Marketing?
description:
ğŸ¯ Get our Customized Marketing Course for Different Sectors
ğŸ’¡ Use the code "Youtube30" at checkout & get a 30% discount today!
ğŸ”— https://easymarketingschool.org/courses/


AI marketing  is essential for boosting consumer loyalty, corporate growth, and profitability. Sales revenues keep coming in as long as companies are able to meet or even surpass customer expectations in terms of product quality, service delivery, and touchpoint experiences. It is practically a given that clients who are truly satisfied will be happy to continue making purchases from companies that offer high-quality goods and services. Additionally, they are more inclined to recommend the company to their friends and family after having a wonderful experience with sales and service.
Artificial intelligence-based marketing efficiently automates data collection and behavioral targeting to assist firms in achieving their objectives. It eliminates human prejudice because it is used in digital channels. The data collected is thought to be more accurate and realistic in displaying actual customer preferences and online behavior.

Using preprogrammed algorithms, computers gather and process data using AI. Consumer behavior is observed when they read material, reply to affiliate marketing offers, and engage with content and social media posts. Taking it a step further, AI automatically contacts clients or prospects who display a particular behavior. With the use of technological tools, platforms, and analytics, this kind of behavior targeting is made possible.

AI marketing is the greatest strategy to use when speed is of the essence. You cannot dally and spend hours sorting and evaluating information, especially in the internet environment where your competitors are likely to be available round-the-clock and clients are searching for instant answers and solutions to their problems. Only AI will allow you to provide them with the wants and needs they have at that precise moment.

Without spending any time and without the assistance of a marketing staff, AI technologies can quickly use the data they collect to communicate using tailored messages at the point of contact. It's a helpful and effective technique to interact with clients and guarantee satisfaction. Data analysis, media buying, content creation, natural language processing, automated decision-making, and real-time customisation are a few other applications of AI marketing.
Scientifically based models are used in artificial intelligence. It is not at all random. AI borrows the cycle of perception, reasoning, and action from cognitive science. This principle is represented by the collect-reason-act cycle in artificial intelligence words.

The term "collect" refers to all actions involving gathering client information from both online and offline sources and storing it in databases. Reasoning is the next step, which is when AI turns data into intelligence or useful insight. AI then takes action based on the information acquired and communicates with customers in an effort to prompt and motivate them to take the desired action, which is often to make a purchase.

Machine learning, commonly known as ML, is a branch of artificial intelligence that investigates computer techniques in greater detail and creates models from data obtained. Applications are able to make predictions and judgments because to the models that are created using ML. ML is hence sometimes referred to as predictive analysis.


#marketing #easymarketing #aimarketing

I talk about why social creative is the only thing that matters, how AI is about to change everything, and why most of the industry needs a major wake-up call. We get into practical strategies for luxury brands, the untapped potential of B2B influencer marketing, and why "controlling the brand" is a complete fantasy. Hope you enjoy!

How to Make Money at Garage Sales l TrashTalk: http://www.garyvee.com/trashtalks
Inside the Life of a $300M+ Company's CEO l DailyVee: http://www.garyvee.com/dailyvees
â€” 
Gary Vaynerchuk is a serial entrepreneur and serves as the Chairman of VaynerX, the CEO of VaynerMedia, and the CEO and creator of VeeFriends. Gary is considered one of the leading global minds on what's next in culture, business, and the internet.

Known as "GaryVee," he is described as one of the most forward thinkers in business. He acutely recognizes trends and patterns early to help others understand how shifts in consumer attention impact the realities of the business world today. Gary's approach sits at the intersection of business and pop culture. He keenly understands how to bring brand relevance to the forefront. He is a prolific angel investor with early investments in companies like Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Venmo, Snapchat, Coinbase, and Uber.

Gary is an entrepreneur at heart â€“ he builds businesses. Today, he helps Fortune 1000 brands leverage consumer attention through his full-service advertising agency, VaynerMedia, which has offices in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Miami, Toronto, Mexico City, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, Singapore, Tokyo, Bangkok, Delhi, and Kuala Lumpur. VaynerMedia is part of the VaynerX holding company, which also includes Eva Nosidam Productions, Gallery Media Group, The Sasha Group, VaynerSpeakers, VaynerCommerce, and Tingley Lane Trading. Gary is the Co-Founder of VaynerSports, VCR Group, VaynerWatt, ArtOfficial, Resy, and Empathy Wines. He guided Resy and Empathy to successful exits -- which he later sold to American Express and Constellation Brands, respectively. He also owns a Major League Pickleball team called the 5s, is part owner of a Big3 basketball team, and is an investor in the revival of the SlamBall League.

In 2021, Gary created VeeFriends, an entertainment company that has become a rising powerhouse in modern entertainment and collectibles. Often described as Pokemon meets Sesame Street, the company leverages stories, games, events, collectibles, and technology to scale its character universe. Vaynerchuk also has negotiated partnerships with brand powerhouses such as Crocs, Fanatics, Macyâ€™s/Toys â€œRâ€ Us, Mattelâ€™s UNO, Mattelâ€™s Masters of the Universe, Moonbug Entertainment, Reebok, Squishmallows, Topps, and more.

Gary is also the founder and creator of VeeCon â€“ a contemporary super conference that converges business and pop culture with innovation and technology. He is a six-time New York Times bestselling author, with titles including Crush It!, Jab, Jab, Jab, Right Hook, Twelve and a Half and Day Trading Attention. In addition to running multiple businesses, Gary documents his daily life as a CEO through his social media channels, which have more than 45 million followers and garner more than 300 million monthly impressions/views across all platforms. His podcast, "The GaryVee Audio Experience," ranks among the top podcasts globally.

Gary serves on the board of MikMak, Bojangles Restaurants, Global Citizen Forum, The Paley Center, and Pencils of Promise. He is also a longtime Well Member of charity: water.

Gary's life ambition is to buy the New York Jets.

title: 7 A.I. Marketing Tools That Will BLOW YOUR MIND
description:
Seven AI marketing tools that'll blow your mind. If you thought that only your grandchildren will see AI dominating areas that humans could, well, think again, because there's some really cool tools that you need to check out. Over the last few years, the development of AI has skyrocketed. Tasks that would take you hours to complete can now be done in minutes automatically. 

RESOURCES & LINKS: 
____________________________________________
CopyAI: https://www.copy.ai/
Beautiful.ai: https://www.beautiful.ai/
Profile Picture Maker: https://pfpmaker.com/
Brandmark.io: https://brandmark.io/
Oribi.io: https://oribi.io/
Synthesia.io: https://www.synthesia.io/
Unscreen.com: https://www.unscreen.com/
____________________________________________

In marketing, there are already quite a few things that you can do much faster. There's a quote by Larry Page, one of the founders of Google that says, "Artificial intelligence would be the ultimate version of Google. The ultimate search engine that would understand everything on the web. It would understand exactly what you wanted, and it would give you the right thing." The global artificial intelligent market size will grow from 93.53 billion in 2021 to 997 billion in 2028. That's almost a trillion dollars. That's pretty much 10x. 

So how can you harness the power of these technologies in your marketing day-to-day? Well, AI can already do the things like designing custom logos, optimizing your paid ad campaigns, helping you write great content, and a lot of other interesting things. But most people aren't familiar with these technologies, and they still spend a lot of manual time doing the stuff that can already be automated. To be honest, up until now, I was also doing a lot of them manually, but over the last six months to a year, I've learned about a lot of these tools. 

So let's dive right in. There's CopyAI. This AI tool generates tons of copy from just one basic summary text that you input. From product descriptions to paid ad copy, to even blog titles, it can help in several different areas of marketing activities. 

Then there's Beautiful.ai. If you hate coming up with presentations because, hey, the design suck, it's messy, takes a lot of time, this tool is perfect for you. It uses AI to automatically enhance your designs accordingly so that your content looks beautiful. And it adjusts it based on your content. So you don't even need to worry about messing with the layouts. 

Then you got Profile Picture Maker. This tool uses AI to remove the background from your photos and make amazing profile photos for you to use on social media or even company about pages, like those headshots that people show on the executive pages. The end result is pretty amazing, and best all, it's absolutely free. 

Then you got Brandmark.io. Now, you don't even need a graphic designer to come up with a logo for your business. This tool uses AI to create logos automatically for you based on a set of preferences. It creates dozens and dozens of different variations that you can pick from and choose from. And if you like one of them and want to use on your business, you can purchase that logo right then and there. 

Then you got Oribi.io. This tool is basically analytics on steroids. It will automatically track all the events on your website and come up with the suggestions of things that you could be doing to improve your performance. It'll look at things like your conversion funnels, traffic sources, identify the strengths, opportunities for improvements. It pretty much does a lot of stuff automatically for you. 

Next, Synthesia.io. If you're camera shy and you don't like to talk in public, you may like this one. It generates video that looks almost identical to a human speaking, and it'll almost freak you out because it is pretty realistic. 

Then you got Unscreen.com. This tool also allows you to remove the background from any video that you shoot. You know, people are just like, "Oh yeah, I can remove background images." I'm talking about video images. You don't even need a green screen or anything like that. It'll remove even the more complex backgrounds.

title: The Marketing Opportunities and Challenges With The Rise Of AI
description:
Today's video is an interview I did with Jameson Fleming, Executive Editor at Adweek. We discuss the profound impact of AI on various industries, addressing common fears such as job loss and the rise of deepfakes. I share my two cents on AI's potential in creative fields like music and art, comparing it to past technological shifts like electricity and the advent of canvas art. The conversation also touches on the fragmentation of media consumption due to personalized algorithms and the early stages of AI adoption in marketing, highlighting both the potential and the challenges that lie ahead.

0:00 Intro

Thanks for watching!

Join My Discord!: http://www.garyvee.com/discord
Check out another series on my channel:
Gary Vaynerchuk Keynote Speeches: http://www.garyvee.com/keynotespeeches
Gary Vaynerchuk's thoughts on NFTs, Web3, cryptocurrencies and more: http://www.garyvee.com/web3nfts
Life, Business, and Career Advice l Gary Vaynerchuk Original Films: http://www.garyvee.com/gvoriginals
How to Make Money at Garage Sales l TrashTalk: http://www.garyvee.com/trashtalks
Inside the Life of a $300M+ Company's CEO l DailyVee: http://www.garyvee.com/dailyvees
â€” 
Gary Vaynerchuk is a serial entrepreneur and serves as the Chairman of VaynerX, the CEO of VaynerMedia, and the Creator & CEO of VeeFriends. Gary is considered one of the leading global minds on what's next in culture, business, and the internet.

Known as "GaryVee," he is described as one of the most forward thinkers in business. He acutely recognizes trends and patterns early to help others understand how shifts in consumer attention impact the realities of the business world today. Gary's approach sits at the intersection of business and pop culture. He keenly understands how to bring brand relevance to the forefront. He is a prolific angel investor with early investments in companies like Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Venmo, Snapchat, Coinbase, and Uber.

This year, Gary unveiled his seventh book, "Day Trading Attention" where he provides fresh insights into navigating the modern social media landscape. Gary's expertise guides readers on harnessing underpriced attention channels in the digital age. He emphasizes mastering storytelling in these arenas and highlights the "TikTokification of Social Media," where content relevance surpasses follower counts. Businesses can leverage this shift to enhance their brand and boost sales. "Day Trading Attention" equips readers with essential skills to succeed in today's dynamic digital world. Gary also announced his first children's picture book, based on his VeeFriends characters, titled "Meet Me in the Middleâ€. The picture book, which will prominently feature two VeeFriends characters, Eager Eagle and Patient Pig, delves into the emotional elements essential for nurturing children's empathy â€“ a crucial skill for their future success.

Gary is an entrepreneur at heart â€“ he builds businesses. Today, he helps Fortune 1000 brands leverage consumer attention through his full-service advertising agency, VaynerMedia, which has offices in New York, Los Angeles, Toronto, Mexico City, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, Singapore, Tokyo, Bangkok, and Kuala Lumpur. VaynerMedia is part of the VaynerX holding company, which also includes Eva Nosidam Productions, Gallery Media Group, The Sasha Group, VaynerSpeakers, VaynerCommerce, and Tingley Lane Trading. Gary is the Co-Founder of VaynerSports, VCR Group, VaynerWatt, ArtOfficial, Resy, and Empathy Wines. He guided Resy and Empathy to successful exits -- which he later sold to American Express and Constellation Brands, respectively. He also owns a Major League Pickleball team called the 5s, is part owner of a Big3 basketball team, and is an investor in the revival of the SlamBall League.

Gary is also the founder and creator of VeeCon â€“ a contemporary super conference that converges business and pop culture with innovation and technology. In addition to running multiple businesses, Gary documents his daily life as a CEO through his social media channels, which have more than 44 million followers and garner over 300 million monthly impressions/views across all platforms. His podcast, "The GaryVee Audio Experience," ranks among the top podcasts globally.

Gary serves on the board of MikMak, Bojangles Restaurants, Global Citizen Forum, and Pencils of Promise. He is also a longtime Well Member of charity: water.

description:
Astral is controversial because it can log into websites like Reddit, TikTok, and Instagram, open up individual posts, and then leave a comment that seems human-generated while also pointing to a promotional product or service.

Most people would assume that Astral's comments are human-generated, which is why this is controversial â€“ Shawn Wang called Astral out, saying, â€œimagine being proud of thisâ€ because essentially, Astral is creating AI agents that are pretending to be human.

At the same time though, people do make purchasing decisions based on social media comments, which is why Aniket Das said Astral is a â€˜Utopia for all B2C foundersâ€™.

title: CÃ”NG Cá»¤ MARKETING á»¨NG Dá»¤NG AI #marketing #ai #marketingtools #bao7marketing
AI Marketing: What is AI Marketing?
description:
ğŸ¯ Get our Customized Marketing Course for Different Sectors
ğŸ’¡ Use the code "Youtube30" at checkout & get a 30% discount today!
ğŸ”— https://easymarketingschool.org/courses/


AI marketing  is essential for boosting consumer loyalty, corporate growth, and profitability. Sales revenues keep coming in as long as companies are able to meet or even surpass customer expectations in terms of product quality, service delivery, and touchpoint experiences. It is practically a given that clients who are truly satisfied will be happy to continue making purchases from companies that offer high-quality goods and services. Additionally, they are more inclined to recommend the company to their friends and family after having a wonderful experience with sales and service.
Artificial intelligence-based marketing efficiently automates data collection and behavioral targeting to assist firms in achieving their objectives. It eliminates human prejudice because it is used in digital channels. The data collected is thought to be more accurate and realistic in displaying actual customer preferences and online behavior.

Using preprogrammed algorithms, computers gather and process data using AI. Consumer behavior is observed when they read material, reply to affiliate marketing offers, and engage with content and social media posts. Taking it a step further, AI automatically contacts clients or prospects who display a particular behavior. With the use of technological tools, platforms, and analytics, this kind of behavior targeting is made possible.

AI marketing is the greatest strategy to use when speed is of the essence. You cannot dally and spend hours sorting and evaluating information, especially in the internet environment where your competitors are likely to be available round-the-clock and clients are searching for instant answers and solutions to their problems. Only AI will allow you to provide them with the wants and needs they have at that precise moment.

Without spending any time and without the assistance of a marketing staff, AI technologies can quickly use the data they collect to communicate using tailored messages at the point of contact. It's a helpful and effective technique to interact with clients and guarantee satisfaction. Data analysis, media buying, content creation, natural language processing, automated decision-making, and real-time customisation are a few other applications of AI marketing.
Scientifically based models are used in artificial intelligence. It is not at all random. AI borrows the cycle of perception, reasoning, and action from cognitive science. This principle is represented by the collect-reason-act cycle in artificial intelligence words.

The term "collect" refers to all actions involving gathering client information from both online and offline sources and storing it in databases. Reasoning is the next step, which is when AI turns data into intelligence or useful insight. AI then takes action based on the information acquired and communicates with customers in an effort to prompt and motivate them to take the desired action, which is often to make a purchase.

Machine learning, commonly known as ML, is a branch of artificial intelligence that investigates computer techniques in greater detail and creates models from data obtained. Applications are able to make predictions and judgments because to the models that are created using ML. ML is hence sometimes referred to as predictive analysis.


#marketing #easymarketing #aimarketing

title: How AI is changing the job market - What in the World podcast, BBC World Service
description:
Applying for jobs is tough. 

Click here to subscribe to our channel ğŸ‘‰ğŸ½ https://bbc.in/3VyyriM

First youâ€™ve got to find the adverts and openings, then thereâ€™s the mental energy and time required to put in an application - and thatâ€™s before you get to the nerve wracking interviews. But some of us are finding that process even harder than normal - putting in loads of applications and never hearing back. Some recent studies suggest that AI is a contributing factor, with younger workers being replaced by AI in some industries.

Companies like Amazon and Duolingo have said using AI is going to lead to a reduction in their workforce. 

We hear some of your experiences in the current job market. BBC business reporter in New York, Nathalie Jimenez, explains which sectors are most affected by the adoption of generative AI - and what you can do to try to adapt. Plus Varun Mayya, a YouTuber and the founder of generative AI company Aeos, tells us what the situation is like in India - and how AI is changing how his company operates.

â€¢ Could even auto-publish to Spotify/Apple

Tired of checking analytics across platforms?

I prompted String to create a workflow that:
â€¢ Pulls data from PostHog (analytics)

â€¢ Delivers a daily summary to Slack

9) AI Ad Creation That Actually Works

The secret to high-converting AI ads:

title: How Agentic AI Is Transforming Marketing Workflows
description:
How do you redesign an entire marketing organization around AI? 

In this excerpt from the second episode of the "Where AI Works: Conversations at the Intersection of AI and Industry" podcast, host Kartik Hosanagar speaks with guest Jill Kramer, Chief Marketing & Communications Officer at @Accenture, about how her team adopted agentic AI systems â€“ AI agents that can work autonomously â€“ to dramatically streamline workflows, speed up execution, and reduce content and communication clutter.

Listen to the full episode and subscribe to the show: https://whr.tn/3G41Rlb

#agenticai #aiforbusiness #aimarketing #wharton #accenture 

ABOUT THE PODCAST
Brought to you by the Wharton School in collaboration with Accenture, Where AI Works explores AIâ€™s real-world impact on business. Each four-episode season takes a fresh approach, led by a different Wharton faculty expert who brings their own AI-focused expertise to the conversation, alongside practitioners actively shaping AIâ€™s role in innovation, strategy, and transformation.

Episodes are released on Thursdays every two weeks wherever you get your podcasts, with video excerpts published to the Wharton School's YouTube channel.

-----

Founded in 1881 as the worldâ€™s first collegiate business school, the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania is shaping the future of business by incubating ideas, driving insights, and creating leaders who change the world.

With a standing faculty of 241 renowned professors, Wharton has 5,000+ students across four degree programs: undergraduate, MBA, executive MBA, and doctoral. Each year 13,000+ professionals from around the world advance their careers through Wharton Executive Educationâ€™s individual, company-customized, and online programs â€“ with 200,000+ others earning certificates from Wharton Online since 2015. More than 104,000 Wharton alumni form a powerful global network of leaders who transform business every day. 

Learn more about Wharton: https://www.wharton.upenn.edu/

description:
Today's video is tactical social media advice that you can start using today. I give tips about spending time on every detail of your content, capturing consumers' attention, and what you should not be focusing on. Hope you enjoy!

Thanks for watching!

Join My Discord!: http://www.garyvee.com/discord
Check out another series on my channel:
Gary Vaynerchuk Keynote Speeches: http://www.garyvee.com/keynotespeeches
Gary Vaynerchuk's thoughts on NFTs, Web3, cryptocurrencies and more: http://www.garyvee.com/web3nfts
Life, Business, and Career Advice l Gary Vaynerchuk Original Films: http://www.garyvee.com/gvoriginals
How to Make Money at Garage Sales l TrashTalk: http://www.garyvee.com/trashtalks
Inside the Life of a $300M+ Company's CEO l DailyVee: http://www.garyvee.com/dailyvees
â€” 
Gary Vaynerchuk is a serial entrepreneur and serves as the Chairman of VaynerX, the CEO of VaynerMedia, and the Creator & CEO of VeeFriends. Gary is considered one of the leading global minds on what's next in culture, business, and the internet.

Known as "GaryVee," he is described as one of the most forward thinkers in business. He acutely recognizes trends and patterns early to help others understand how shifts in consumer attention impact the realities of the business world today. Gary's approach sits at the intersection of business and pop culture. He keenly understands how to bring brand relevance to the forefront. He is a prolific angel investor with early investments in companies like Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Venmo, Snapchat, Coinbase, and Uber.

This year, Gary unveiled his seventh book, "Day Trading Attention" where he provides fresh insights into navigating the modern social media landscape. Gary's expertise guides readers on harnessing underpriced attention channels in the digital age. He emphasizes mastering storytelling in these arenas and highlights the "TikTokification of Social Media," where content relevance surpasses follower counts. Businesses can leverage this shift to enhance their brand and boost sales. "Day Trading Attention" equips readers with essential skills to succeed in today's dynamic digital world. Gary also announced his first children's picture book, based on his VeeFriends characters, titled "Meet Me in the Middleâ€. The picture book, which will prominently feature two VeeFriends characters, Eager Eagle and Patient Pig, delves into the emotional elements essential for nurturing children's empathy â€“ a crucial skill for their future success.

Gary is an entrepreneur at heart â€“ he builds businesses. Today, he helps Fortune 1000 brands leverage consumer attention through his full-service advertising agency, VaynerMedia, which has offices in New York, Los Angeles, Toronto, Mexico City, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, Singapore, Tokyo, Bangkok, and Kuala Lumpur. VaynerMedia is part of the VaynerX holding company, which also includes Eva Nosidam Productions, Gallery Media Group, The Sasha Group, VaynerSpeakers, VaynerCommerce, and Tingley Lane Trading. Gary is the Co-Founder of VaynerSports, VCR Group, VaynerWatt, ArtOfficial, Resy, and Empathy Wines. He guided Resy and Empathy to successful exits -- which he later sold to American Express and Constellation Brands, respectively. He also owns a Major League Pickleball team called the 5s, is part owner of a Big3 basketball team, and is an investor in the revival of the SlamBall League.

Gary is also the founder and creator of VeeCon â€“ a contemporary super conference that converges business and pop culture with innovation and technology. In addition to running multiple businesses, Gary documents his daily life as a CEO through his social media channels, which have more than 44 million followers and garner over 300 million monthly impressions/views across all platforms. His podcast, "The GaryVee Audio Experience," ranks among the top podcasts globally.

Gary serves on the board of MikMak, Bojangles Restaurants, Global Citizen Forum, and Pencils of Promise. He is also a longtime Well Member of charity: water. 

Gary's life ambition is to buy the New York Jets.

I outline essential tools for the Vibe Marketing toolkit including Replit, n8n, Gumloop, Manus, Claude, and OpenRouter, then shares practical workflows for content creation, sales automation, and data analysis that marketers can implement immediately.

â€¢ Vibe Marketing combines vibe coding tools with AI agents and workflows to automate marketing campaigns
â€¢ The convergence of improved AI, accessible automation tools, and collapsed custom tool costs has made Vibe Marketing possible
â€¢ Small marketing teams using Vibe Marketing can accomplish what previously required much larger teams
â€¢ Vibe Marketing will evolve to resemble high-frequency trading with AI agents working 24/7

1) What is Vibe Marketing?

It's the combination of vibe coding tools (Bolt, Replet, Lovable) with workflow automation (Gumloop, Manus, N8n) to create AI-powered marketing campaigns.

"Marketing will resemble high-frequency stock trading in the near future."

2) The Vibe Marketing Toolkit

To get started, you'll need:

â€¢ Vibe coding tools (Replit, Bolt, Lovable)
â€¢ Workflow automation (N8n, Gumloop, Flow)
â€¢ AI assistants (Manus, Claude)
â€¢ Model router (OpenRouter)
â€¢ Visual generation (Sora, ChatGPT ImageGen)

â€¢ Interconnected AI systems working together
â€¢ Manager agents trained by human experts
â€¢ Small teams accomplishing what required 50+ people
â€¢ Goal-oriented systems ("Get me 50k visitors")
â€¢ Real-time adaptation to market opportunities

â€¢ Think in SYSTEMS, not campaigns
â€¢ Test relentlessly (50-100 variations, not just 2)
â€¢ Front-load value in everything you create

â€¢ Let machines handle the boring stuff

â€” 
Gary Vaynerchuk is a serial entrepreneur, and serves as the Chairman of VaynerX,  the CEO of VaynerMedia and the Creator & CEO of VeeFriends.

Gary is considered one of the leading global minds on whatâ€™s next in culture,  relevance and the internet. Known as â€œGaryVeeâ€ he is described as one of the most forward thinkers in business â€“ he acutely recognizes trends and patterns early to help others understand how these shifts impact markets and consumer behavior. Whether its emerging artists, esports, NFT investing or digital communications, Gary understands how to bring brand relevance to the forefront. He is a prolific angel investor with early investments in companies such as Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Venmo, Snapchat, Coinbase and Uber. 

Gary is an entrepreneur at heart â€” he builds businesses. Today, he helps Fortune 1000 brands leverage consumer attention through his full service advertising agency, VaynerMedia which has offices in NY, LA, London, Mexico City, LATAM and Singapore.  VaynerMedia is part of the VaynerX holding company which also includes VaynerProductions, VaynerNFT, Gallery Media Group, The Sasha Group, Tracer, VaynerSpeakers, VaynerTalent, and VaynerCommerce. Gary is also the Co-Founder of VaynerSports, Resy and Empathy Wines. Gary guided both Resy and Empathy to successful exits â€” both were sold respectively to American Express and Constellation Brands. Heâ€™s also a Board Member at Candy Digital, Co-Founder of VCR Group, Co-Founder of ArtOfficial, and Creator & CEO of VeeFriends. Gary was recently named to the Fortune list of the Top 50 Influential people in the NFT industry. 
In addition to running multiple businesses, Gary documents his life daily as a CEO through his social media channels which has more than 34 million followers and garnishes over 272 million monthly impressions/views across all platforms.  His podcast â€˜The GaryVee Audio Experienceâ€™ ranks among the top podcasts globally.  He is a five-time New York Times Best-Selling Author and one of the most highly sought after public speakers.

Gary serves on the board of MikMak, Bojangles Restaurants, and Pencils of Promise. He is also a longtime Well Member of Charity:Water.

title: AI-ready marketing: The next shift in digital marketing strategy

The digital marketing landscape is evolving at an unprecedented pace, with AI, automation, and data-driven strategies redefining how brands connect with consumers. How can businesses adapt and stay ahead in this rapidly changing environment?

title: The COMPLETE Facebook Ads Tutorial (2025)
description:
The BEST Facebook Ads Tutorial for Beginners 2025 (Full Guide).
â–º Shopify Free Trial https://utm.io/uh3KB
â–º Explore Shopify Community https://utm.io/ui4Du
â–º Shopify Tutorial: How To Set up Shopify https://utm.io/ui4Dy
â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“
*Master Facebook Ads in 2025: The Ultimate Guide for Beginners* ğŸš€

Want to reach billions of potential customers on Facebook? This comprehensive tutorial breaks down the latest Facebook ad strategies and tactics to help you create, launch, and optimize profitable campaigns, even if you're on a small budget.

*In this video, you'll learn:*

1. *Facebook Ads Fundamentals:* Understand the 3 levels of Facebook ad campaigns (Campaign, Ad Set, Ad) and how they work together. Learn the importance of A/B testing and how to do it effectively. We'll show you how to test creatives, audiences, and landing pages to find what works best.

2. *Setting Up Your First Campaign:* We'll walk you through creating a Facebook Page and Business Account, navigating Ads Manager, and choosing the right campaign objective (leads, sales, brand awareness, traffic) for your budget. Learn the crucial first steps to get your ads up and running.

3. *Budgeting & Bidding Strategies:* Discover how to set daily or lifetime budgets, how much to spend (even on a tiny budget!), and the pros and cons of different bidding strategies (spend-based, goal-based, manual).  Learn how to leverage Advantage+ campaigns for simplified campaign management.

4. *Targeting Your Audience:* Learn the difference between broad and niche targeting.  Understand how to use interests, demographics, and customer data to reach your ideal audience. We'll show you how to A/B test targeting options to find what works best, and discuss the importance of having customer data for niche campaigns.

5. *Creating High-Converting Ad Creatives:*  Learn how to create engaging ad copy, images, and videos that stop the scroll. Discover the importance of hooks, problem-solving, and clear calls to action. We'll even show you how to use the Meta Ads Library for inspiration and how to create organic-feeling ads that resonate with your audience.

6. *Ad Tracking & Optimization:*  Understand the importance of the Facebook Pixel and how to install it. Learn key metrics like CTR, ROAS, CPA, conversion rate, frequency, and CAC.  We'll show you how to track these metrics and optimize your campaigns for maximum ROI, including how to connect your Shopify account for seamless tracking.

7. *Scaling Your Campaigns:* Discover advanced tactics for scaling your winning ads, including lookalike audiences, incremental budget increases, and the importance of refreshing your creatives. Learn the power of retargeting to maximize conversions and remind potential customers about your products or services.

8. *The Learning Phase:* Understand what the Facebook learning phase is and why it's crucial to let your campaigns run without making major changes until it's complete. Learn how conversion volume impacts the learning phase and how to avoid disrupting it.

9. *Advanced Tactics:* Learn about lookalike audiences, incremental budget scaling, keeping creatives fresh, and the power of retargeting. We'll cover strategies to maximize your ROI and get the most out of your ad spend.

*Who is this video for?*
- Small business owners on a budget
- Entrepreneurs looking to start advertising on Facebook
- Marketing beginners who want a step-by-step guide
- Anyone who wants to learn how to run profitable Facebook ad campaigns

title: Facebook Ads Tutorial - Free Course for Beginners
description:
In this free Facebook Ads course, I guide you step-by-step on how to set up an effective Facebook ads campaign from scratch. We'll start by creating a Facebook Ads account and move on to setting up campaigns correctly, targeting the right audience, and creating compelling ad creatives with images and videos. I also provide free resources to help you get started.

What You'll Learn
Creating a Facebook Ads Account:

How to set up your account properly.
The difference between the simple method and using Business Manager.
Setting Up Campaigns:

How to set up campaigns the right way.
Defining your campaign goals (e.g., sales, leads).
Targeting the Right Audience:

Setting up targeting for Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp.
Using broad and Advantage+ audience targeting.
Creating Ad Creatives:

Designing compelling ad creatives with images and videos.
Tips on structuring your photos and videos for maximum impact.
Budget Management:

How to set and manage your budget effectively.
Understanding daily vs. lifetime budgets.
Analyzing and Optimizing:

How to analyze your ad performance.
Tips for optimizing your campaigns over time.

This course is designed specifically for beginners and covers everything you need to know, avoiding the common pitfalls and advanced techniques that other tutorials often jump to. You'll learn how to run ads not only on Facebook but also on Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp, since they're all part of Meta's ad platform.

We'll cover the two methods of setting up a Facebook ads campaign, why I recommend using the Business Manager over the simpler method, and how to connect your Facebook and Instagram accounts. I'll show you how to set up your Business Manager properly, create ad accounts, and handle billing and payments to avoid common issues.

Throughout the video, I'll explain the structure of Facebook ads, including campaigns, ad sets, and ads. You'll learn how to define your campaign goals, target the right audience, and create effective ad creatives. I also provide tips on budget management and how to analyze and optimize your campaigns for better performance.

Whether you're new to Facebook ads or looking to refine your approach, this course will equip you with the knowledge and tools to create successful ad campaigns.

How I got hereâ€¦

17 yrs old: Started my first business selling wristbands with two school friends. I made $0.
18 yrs old: Started my first ecommerce business selling second hand video games. I made $0.
19 yrs old: Joined a network marketing company (would not recommend it). Was told Iâ€™d be rich if I signed up 8 people. I signed up 26 people in 3 months. I made $0.

28 yrs old: My personal brand allowed me to attract the best talent in the world. Heath Media became an industry leading Meta ads agency, with an exceptional team and an excellent reputation. We crossed $1m/year.
32 yrs old: Today I teach over 800,000 business owners, marketers and entrepreneurs how to get insane results with digital marketing. Heath Media is a 50+ team of world class talent, working directly with over 400 clients every year. Weâ€™ve now crossed the $5m/year mark.

I hope to help you speed up that journey and come along for the ride.

Ben

title: Meta Just Changed Facebook Ads Forever
description:
Why Facebook's New AI System Requires a Complete Strategy Overhaul
*Get Marketer's Guide to Meta: Tactics for Facebook + Instagram from HubSpot* ğŸ”— https://clickhubspot.com/86b567

Facebook has 3 billion users, and Meta's new Advantage+ system just rewrote all the advertising rules.

THE BIG CHANGES:
Creative testing now MANDATORY (AI needs multiple assets)
Budget caps GONE (automatic allocation)
Manual targeting REPLACED by AI-powered buyer discovery
Campaign structure SIMPLIFIED (fewer campaigns, broader targeting)

If you're still running Facebook ads like it's 2024, you're burning money.

The new system requires multiple creative assets and uses AI optimization to find buyers you never knew existed. Single-ad campaigns are dead. This isn't just an update - it's a complete reimagining of how Facebook delivers ads.

Are you ready to adapt your Facebook ad strategy for 2025?

#FacebookAds #MetaAds #Advantageplus #FacebookAdvertising #DigitalMarketing #PaidAds

title: How To Run Ads On Facebook (Small Businesses)
description:
Here is how â¬‡ï¸

To launch successful advertising campaigns on Facebook, follow these revised steps for a comprehensive and strategic approach:

Set Up Your Facebook Ads Manager Account: Begin by creating an account in Facebook Ads Manager to access all the necessary tools for ad creation and management.

1. Launch a New Campaign: Initiate your advertising journey by starting a new campaign within the platform.

2. Determine Your Advertising Goal: Clearly define what you aim to achieve with your advertising efforts, whether itâ€™s increasing brand awareness, generating leads, or driving sales.

3. Allocate Your Budget and Schedule Wisely: Decide on how much youâ€™re willing to spend and the duration of your ad campaign to manage resources efficiently.

4. Identify Your Target Audience: Utilize Facebookâ€™s targeting options to reach a specific demographic, interests, or behavior that aligns with your business goals.

5. Design Your Facebook Ad: Craft an ad that resonates with your target audience using compelling visuals and engaging content.

6. Track and Analyze Performance: Employ Facebookâ€™s analytics tools to monitor your adâ€™s performance and adapt your strategy as needed. Set up detailed reporting mechanisms to gauge success and make data-driven decisions.

Comment â€œVaibhavâ€ and Iâ€™ll send you low Budget ad strategy in your Dm

[Begin your Facebook advertising journey by mastering the Ads Manager, launching campaigns with clear goals, carefully managing your budget and ad schedule, identifying and engaging your ideal audience, constantly crafting captivating ads, and rigorously analysing performance data to refine your strategy. By following these methods, you will improve your ability to navigate social media advertising platforms and take your campaigns to new heights.]

#facebook #instagram #facebookads #facebookadvertising #facebookadstips

title: Want to Improve the Performance of your Facebook Ads? These Two Tips May Help âœ¨
description:
#facebookads 

- Using phone numbers and emails to target is a great way to reach people who have already expressed interest in your business. If you have a list of customer phone numbers or email addresses, you can upload them to Facebook and create a custom audience. This will allow you to show your ads to people who are already familiar with your brand, which can lead to higher conversion rates.

2 - Using related audiences is another great way to reach people who are likely to be interested in your products or services. When you create a related audience, youâ€™re essentially saying, â€œI want to show my ads to people who are similar to my existing customers.â€ Facebook will then use its algorithms to find people who have similar interests, demographics, and behaviors as your existing customers.  #basicfacebookads #relatedaudience #facebookadstips #facebookadsmanager
