title: 48 Hrs in Colombo, Sri Lanka ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡° | Best Places to Visit, Local Food, Casino & Nightlife | Travel Vlog
description:
Welcome to Colombo, the lively capital of Sri Lanka â€” where culture, chaos, calmness, and coastal beauty come together in the most unexpected way. 

In this vlog, I spent one full day exploring the top things to do in Colombo, from serene temples and colorful markets to local food, history, and the cityâ€™s vibrant nightlife. Whether youâ€™re planning a short stopover or a weekend getaway, this is your complete Colombo travel guide!

ğŸª” 1ï¸âƒ£ Gangaramaya Temple

One of the most famous and beautiful temples in Colombo, Gangaramaya Temple blends modern architecture with cultural heritage. From golden Buddha statues to sacred relics and vintage cars in its museum â€” every corner tells a story. Itâ€™s peaceful, spiritual, and a must-visit for first-time travelers to Sri Lanka.

ğŸŒŠ 2ï¸âƒ£ Seema Malakaya Temple

Just a short walk from Gangaramaya, Seema Malakaya is a floating temple built on Beira Lake. Surrounded by calm waters and city skyline views, itâ€™s the perfect spot for quiet reflection or stunning photos. Designed by Geoffrey Bawa, this place shows how beautifully spirituality and design can meet.

ğŸ›ï¸ 3ï¸âƒ£ Pettah Market

If you want to feel the real pulse of Colombo â€” head to Pettah Market. Itâ€™s loud, colorful, and full of energy! From spices and fabrics to souvenirs and street snacks, this market is a treat for the senses. Bargaining is a must, and getting lost here is half the fun!

ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡° 4ï¸âƒ£ Independence Memorial Hall

A symbol of Sri Lankaâ€™s freedom, the Independence Memorial Hall is both grand and peaceful. The stone lions, colonial architecture, and the open park surrounding it make it a beautiful place to take a stroll and soak in the countryâ€™s history.

ğŸ› 5ï¸âƒ£ Sri Lankan Food Experience

No trip to Colombo is complete without tasting local Sri Lankan food! From Kottu Roti â€” a loud, sizzling street dish made with roti, eggs, and spices â€” to hoppers, sambols, and milk tea, every bite is full of flavor. I tried my first Kottu Roti here and it was absolutely addictive!

ğŸŒ… 6ï¸âƒ£ Galle Face Green & Marine Drive

As the sun sets, head to Galle Face Green, a long stretch by the ocean where locals gather to eat, relax, and watch the waves. You can grab some street food, fly a kite, or just walk by the sea. Later, take a coastal drive along Marine Drive â€” the views of the ocean and skyline at night are magical.

ğŸ° 7ï¸âƒ£ Bellagio Casino Colombo

To end the night, I visited Bellagio Casino â€” one of the most happening nightlife spots in Colombo! No entry fee, free 5-star level food and drinks, and a lively vibe â€” this place feels like mini-Vegas on a budget. You can even try your luck starting with as little as â‚¹200. Whether you play or not, itâ€™s an experience worth having in Sri Lanka!

ğŸ’¡ Travel Tips for Indians Visiting Sri Lanka:

ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ Visa-free entry (just apply for ETA online at least 3â€“4 days before your trip)

ğŸ’¸ 1 INR â‰ˆ 3.4 LKR â€” exchange at local money changers for better rates

ğŸ“± Buy a Dialog SIM at the airport (500 INR for 1-week plan â€” great network!)

ğŸš— Use the PickMe app for cabs and tuk-tuks

ğŸ¨ Mid-range hotels cost around â‚¹1500â€“â‚¹2500 per night

ğŸ§­ If youâ€™re planning your Sri Lanka itinerary, this vlog will help you plan:

Al Ula â€“ Betul ke ni Kota yang di LAKNAT?! (Hegra, Madain Saleh)
description:
Kita selalu dengar tentang AlUla, kota kaum Thamud (Madain Saleh) yang dikatakan tempat dilaknat Allah. Tapi betul ke sebenarnya kawasan ni bumi Kaum Nabi Saleh (Madain Saleh) Yang di Laknat dan disebut dalam Al-Quran?

Ramai yang cepat menghukum, judge tanpa tahu kisah sebenar di sebalik AlUla dan Hegra, tapak warisan dunia UNESCO di Saudi Arabia.

Dalam video ni, aku bersama MKM Ticketing Travel datang sendiri ke AlUla,
untuk tengok dengan mata kepala sendiri, apa sebenarnya kisah di sebalik â€œkota yang dilaknatâ€ ni.

Adakah ia benar-benar tempat kaum Thamud?

ğŸ¥ Saksikan perjalanan penuh keindahan dan pengajaran di AlUla & Hegra (Madain Saleh) tempat yang buat kita fikir semula tentang kuasa Allah, sejarah, dan pengajaran untuk manusia hari ini.

title: my solo trip to the swiss alps
description:
WATCH THIS VERSION INSTEAD IT'S MUCH BETTER: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t5daW6S3sPc&t=621s

i know some (most) of the song choices are a bit random, there were copyright claims to the original music (and i hastily edited with subpar music which apparently is IRREVERSABLE) :(


EDIT: wow- thank you guys for all the love on this video!! i've seen so many comments saying that this video has inspired them to visit appenzell, and i'm so excited for you all to explore this amazing place - it's truly an unforgettable experience

but please, if you do visit, LEAVE NO TRACE. increased foot traffic often leads to more litter, damaged trails, and harm to wildlife. so please, let's work together to protect these beautiful places - respect nature, stay on marked trails, pack out everything you bring in, and leave it better than you found it. that way, others can enjoy it just as much as you (and i) did :)


hiking routes:
day 1- https://www.alltrails.com/explore/trail/switzerland/outer-rhodes/ebenalp-schafler-seealpsee-wasserauen?u=i
*note: if you have sore/weak knees and want to do the day one hike- I would recommend doing it in reverse (starting at the lake and hiking up)- it's a steep decent that is not for the weak knees (literally)
day 2- https://www.alltrails.com/explore/trail/switzerland/appenzell-inner-rhodes/schwende-seealpsee?u=i


filmed on iphone 14

title: Epic 9-Day Road Trip: Exploring Wyoming & Montana | Grand Tetons, Yellowstone, Glacier National Park
description:
Join us on the ultimate road trip of a lifetime as we embark on an 9-day journey through the breathtaking landscapes of Wyoming and Montana! In this travel vlog, my brother, cousin, grandmother, and I take you along on our unforgettable adventure, flying into Jackson Hole and exploring iconic destinations such as the Grand Tetons, Yellowstone, and Glacier National Park and a unique glamping experience at Under Canvas North Yellowstone.

Itinerary:

â›°ï¸Day 1-2: Grand Tetons - Our journey kicks off with the stunning Grand Tetons as our backdrop. Watch as we hike through pristine trails, cliff jump, soak in the majestic mountain views, and share our favorite moments from the start of our road trip.

ğŸŒ‹ Day 3-5: Yellowstone - Next, we venture into the world-famous Yellowstone National Park. From the iconic Old Faithful to the vibrant Grand Prismatic Spring, our Yellowstone experience is packed with geothermal wonders, wildlife encounters, and the untamed beauty of the wilderness.

ğŸ•ï¸ Day 6: Glamping at Under Canvas North Yellowstone - Experience the magic of glamping as we stay at Under Canvas in their new North Yellowstone location. Immerse yourself in the beauty of nature with luxurious accommodations, stunning views, and a unique camping experience that adds a touch of comfort to our adventure.

ğŸï¸ Day 7-9: Glacier National Park Finale - As our road trip reaches its climax, we head north to Montana, concluding our adventure in the stunning Glacier National Park. Join us as we explore the glacier-carved landscapes, pristine lakes, and towering peaks that make this park a true natural wonder. We end our whole trip off with a 12 mile hike to Grinnell Glacier. 


Don't miss out on the stunning vistas, family bonding moments, and the overall joy of our road trip! Hit the subscribe button, give this video a thumbs up! Join us on this incredible journey through the heart of the American West. Share your thoughts and travel tips in the comments below! Let the adventure begin! ğŸŒŸ #WyomingRoadTrip #MontanaTravel #NationalParkAdventure #FamilyTravelVlog #YellowstoneGlacierAdventure

title: Our First Time in PAKISTAN ğŸ‡µğŸ‡° Culture SHOCK in KARACHI (emotional)
description:
We finally made it to Karachi, Pakistan â€” and our arrival was nothing short of wild. From a chaotic first drive that ended in a car crash (weâ€™re okay!) to finding comfort in a cozy local hotel, this day had it all.

After catching our breath, we hit the streets to meet some amazing locals and experience Karachiâ€™s legendary hospitality firsthand. Our evening ended at the iconic Kolachi restaurant by the sea â€” where we tried incredible traditional Pakistani food with a view to remember.

This city is raw, real, and full of energy â€” and we canâ€™t wait to explore more.

ğŸŒ Watch our full Karachi adventure â€” the highs, the chaos, and the warmth that makes Pakistan unforgettable.

title: 48 hours in Sapa, Vietnam. â›°ï¸
description:
xin chao!!! ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡³

went to Sapa last May â€” this trip felt like such a breather. honestly, Iâ€™d been feeling like a hamster on a treadmill for months, so this was exactly what I needed. ğŸ«  

every day on this trip felt surreal. no wonder they call it the Switzerland of Vietnam!! but on some days, it lowkey reminded me of Baguio too. we share so many similarities with the Vietnamese â€” especially the woven fabrics they were selling in Cat Cat Village. even the lolas! ğŸ˜„ 

alsoâ€¦ the red train!!! I donâ€™t know why but as a Harry Potter fan, I romanticized the heck out of it. every time it passed by, it felt like a movie scene. (WHAT IS LIFE W/O ROMANTICIZING IT? IT'S URS ANYWAY!!!)

~ yada yada. hope you enjoy this one â€” a travel diary of some sort :)

title: my solo trip to the swiss alps
description:
WATCH THIS VERSION INSTEAD IT'S MUCH BETTER: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t5daW6S3sPc&t=621s

i know some (most) of the song choices are a bit random, there were copyright claims to the original music (and i hastily edited with subpar music which apparently is IRREVERSABLE) :(


EDIT: wow- thank you guys for all the love on this video!! i've seen so many comments saying that this video has inspired them to visit appenzell, and i'm so excited for you all to explore this amazing place - it's truly an unforgettable experience

but please, if you do visit, LEAVE NO TRACE. increased foot traffic often leads to more litter, damaged trails, and harm to wildlife. so please, let's work together to protect these beautiful places - respect nature, stay on marked trails, pack out everything you bring in, and leave it better than you found it. that way, others can enjoy it just as much as you (and i) did :)


hiking routes:
day 1- https://www.alltrails.com/explore/trail/switzerland/outer-rhodes/ebenalp-schafler-seealpsee-wasserauen?u=i
*note: if you have sore/weak knees and want to do the day one hike- I would recommend doing it in reverse (starting at the lake and hiking up)- it's a steep decent that is not for the weak knees (literally)
day 2- https://www.alltrails.com/explore/trail/switzerland/appenzell-inner-rhodes/schwende-seealpsee?u=i


filmed on iphone 14

songs used:
lover's grip (slowed) - them & i (copyright claim)
sleepwalking - palo soprano
@savi.desilva on tiktok
space cadet- sugadaisy (copyright claim) 
yellow (cover) - by @ lh on youtube
laramee- richy mitch & the coal miners
hand/heart - palo soprano (copyright claim) 

since many have asked, here is a link to my spotify! https://open.spotify.com/user/brigettelaurie
my instagram: https://www.instagram.com/brigettel/

title: Epic 9-Day Road Trip: Exploring Wyoming & Montana | Grand Tetons, Yellowstone, Glacier National Park
description:
Join us on the ultimate road trip of a lifetime as we embark on an 9-day journey through the breathtaking landscapes of Wyoming and Montana! In this travel vlog, my brother, cousin, grandmother, and I take you along on our unforgettable adventure, flying into Jackson Hole and exploring iconic destinations such as the Grand Tetons, Yellowstone, and Glacier National Park and a unique glamping experience at Under Canvas North Yellowstone.

Itinerary:

â›°ï¸Day 1-2: Grand Tetons - Our journey kicks off with the stunning Grand Tetons as our backdrop. Watch as we hike through pristine trails, cliff jump, soak in the majestic mountain views, and share our favorite moments from the start of our road trip.

ğŸŒ‹ Day 3-5: Yellowstone - Next, we venture into the world-famous Yellowstone National Park. From the iconic Old Faithful to the vibrant Grand Prismatic Spring, our Yellowstone experience is packed with geothermal wonders, wildlife encounters, and the untamed beauty of the wilderness.

ğŸ•ï¸ Day 6: Glamping at Under Canvas North Yellowstone - Experience the magic of glamping as we stay at Under Canvas in their new North Yellowstone location. Immerse yourself in the beauty of nature with luxurious accommodations, stunning views, and a unique camping experience that adds a touch of comfort to our adventure.

ğŸï¸ Day 7-9: Glacier National Park Finale - As our road trip reaches its climax, we head north to Montana, concluding our adventure in the stunning Glacier National Park. Join us as we explore the glacier-carved landscapes, pristine lakes, and towering peaks that make this park a true natural wonder. We end our whole trip off with a 12 mile hike to Grinnell Glacier. 


Don't miss out on the stunning vistas, family bonding moments, and the overall joy of our road trip! Hit the subscribe button, give this video a thumbs up! Join us on this incredible journey through the heart of the American West. Share your thoughts and travel tips in the comments below! Let the adventure begin! ğŸŒŸ #WyomingRoadTrip #MontanaTravel #NationalParkAdventure #FamilyTravelVlog #YellowstoneGlacierAdventure

title: First Solo Girls Tripâ¤ï¸âœ¨ğŸ¥¹ #adayinmylife #minivlog #vlog #shortsviral #shorts #trip #travel
Al Ula â€“ Betul ke ni Kota yang di LAKNAT?! (Hegra, Madain Saleh)
description:
Kita selalu dengar tentang AlUla, kota kaum Thamud (Madain Saleh) yang dikatakan tempat dilaknat Allah. Tapi betul ke sebenarnya kawasan ni bumi Kaum Nabi Saleh (Madain Saleh) Yang di Laknat dan disebut dalam Al-Quran?

Ramai yang cepat menghukum, judge tanpa tahu kisah sebenar di sebalik AlUla dan Hegra, tapak warisan dunia UNESCO di Saudi Arabia.

Dalam video ni, aku bersama MKM Ticketing Travel datang sendiri ke AlUla,
untuk tengok dengan mata kepala sendiri, apa sebenarnya kisah di sebalik â€œkota yang dilaknatâ€ ni.

Adakah ia benar-benar tempat kaum Thamud?

ğŸ¥ Saksikan perjalanan penuh keindahan dan pengajaran di AlUla & Hegra (Madain Saleh) tempat yang buat kita fikir semula tentang kuasa Allah, sejarah, dan pengajaran untuk manusia hari ini.

title: Irelandâ€™s Most Beautiful Drive: Sky Road & Connemara (Day2)! ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ª
description:
Left Galway in the morning and drove into Connemara - quiet roads, open landscapes, lakes, and sheep everywhere. 
Stopped at Kylemore Abbey, then drove the Sky Road with stunning views of mountains, ocean, and fields. Continued to Clifden for a short break before heading to Sligo. 
Slow roads, peaceful towns, and beautiful landscapes all day. Ended with a late-night drive to Sligo, tired but happy.

title: NAKAKAKILABOT! SOLO CAMPING: BALER (MAY MULTO?!!ğŸ˜±)
description:

Dinaanan natin ang CLLEX (Central Luzon Link Expressway), ang scenic view ng Pantabanganâ€“Canili Bypass Road, at ang Maria Aurora to Baler Road na talaga namang napakaganda ng mga tanawin! 

Pagdating sa Diguisit, Baler, nag solo camping tayo sa isang napakagandang campsite â€” napapalibutan ng mga puno ng niyog, berdeng damo, at asul na dagat. 
Pinasyalan din natin ang mga white sand beach sa Diguisit at ang Baler Lighthouse.

Pero habang nag so-solo camp sa gabiâ€¦ may kakaiba tayong naramdaman ğŸ˜¨

title: 15 Fitness Tips That Changed My Life For The Better
description:
Do you feel like you are in a rush in losing weight or achieving your body goal? Starting a journey with fitness goals is never easy, and you must remember this is not a crash diet; it is a lifestyle. You may also find yourself giving up because crash diets are not sustainable.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ğŸ’¡Other videos youâ€™ll love!:

ğŸ¥Watch: I Tried Keto For 30 Days And This Happened
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4WFB3aM6B2Y&list=PLhpfClNWMTBLsD5Dg8GhPM45waZ8zAm8N&ab_channel=BodyHub
  
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In a nutshell:

15 Fitness Tips That Changed My Life For The Better The best approach is to make simple changes to your daily habits over time.  With any diet, the most important thing to remember is to stay hydrated.  Drinking water will support your body with digestion, transporting nutrients to your bones and muscles, and even improving cognitive function.  Ideally, you want to drink about half your body weight in ounces per day, i. 

e.  if you weigh 150 pounds, you should drink 75 ounces of water a day.  2.  Add Some Lemon and Apple Cider Vinegar to Your Water Therefore, hydrating your body first thing in the morning is absolutely necessary. 

 The best way to achieve hydration is by starting your day with a glass or even two of water.  The lemon and apple cider vinegar will help your body detoxify, cleanse, and digest.  Yes, keeping hydrated is important, but try to avoid high-calorie drinks, such as soft drinks, specialty coffee, and juices as they are full of fast-acting sugar.  This will promote a healthy cooldown, improve flexibility, and reduce next-day aches. 

 Failure to stretch can lead to injuries and muscle damage.  You may have heard about HIIT training because it is the big thing right now, and believe us when we say that it works and should absolutely be included in your fitness goals.  The benefits include lower body fat, increased stamina, leaner muscles, and fantastic hormonal benefits.  Performing a HIIT routine 1-3 times a week will lead to great results. 

 Not only does it look good, but it also has great health benefits, including: Reduced body fat 5.  Protects and improves joint health 8.  Decrease Body Fat Reducing your body fat has a lot of benefits such as: 7.  Better hormonal profiles in your body Remember, it is not a race to see how quickly you can decrease your body fat. 

 Healthy weight loss is around 1-2 pounds a week for your fitness goals.  It is important to ensure you are getting as many nutrients and vitamins from the food you are eating as possible.  Focus on dark, leafy greens, as they will provide you with a wide array of vitamins, minerals, nutrients, and antioxidantsâ€”all of which your body needs! Another top goal you can start immediately is reducing the amount of sugar you consume.  There`s no surprise we eat too much sugar, and this should be one of your top fitness goals moving forward. 

 The workout is where you go to break down muscle tissue, and it builds back through proper nutrition, rest, and recovery.  It might be tempting to go to the gym for two hours every day as hard as you can to achieve your goals, but that`s not the most effective approach.  When you are deprived of sleep, you make it next to impossible to achieve your health and fitness goals.  Lack of sleep can increase stress hormones in your body, and over time these can lead to inflammation and chronic diseases. 

Also, allow yourself some wind-down time and a pre-bed routine to help get more consistent sleep every night. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

https://goo.gl/nJ8d6r

#BodyHub #fitnesstips #fitnesslifestyle

title: Weight GAIN exercisesâœ…ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸#youtube #health #shorts #viral #fitness #motivation #weightgain #workout
description:
5 Best Exercises to Gain Weight Quickly #gymnoughtfitness #gainweight #weightgain #shorts #youtubeshorts #exercise #fitness @gymnoughtfitness 

I know youâ€™re wondering why some of the exercises that are in weight loss videos are featured in a whole video about how to gain weight. Great question and I have a great answer :-) 

All of the exercises featured in this video are what are considered to be multi purpose exercises. Which means they are equally effective for weight gain and weight loss. 

Wait. what! how? :)
If a personâ€™s goal is weight loss, and they are in eating fewer calories than they burn per day, the effect of these exercises will be more toning, more endurance, and more strength in the muscles targeted.

People eating in a calorie balance for weight maintenance will have a similar toning, strengthening and endurance effect.

If a personâ€™s goal is weight gain and they are eating more calories than they burn per day, the effect of these exercises will be more toning, more endurance, more strength AND more size in the muscles. Aka muscle growth.

It is this growth of the muscle that is being referred to here as weight gain.

These exercises do not add fat to the body. I repeat, these exercises do not cause fat gain in the body ğŸ˜„

Will these exercises make you bulky? If youâ€™re exercising with body weight or simple dumbbells are home, no. You wonâ€™t become bulky.

If youâ€™re going to the gym and lifting heavy weights like 90lb barbells or 50lb, you probably still wonâ€™t become bulky but at that stage, it really boils down to each personâ€™s genetic predisposition.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
More about the reason this weight gain video came to be :)
5 Best Exercises to Gain Weight Quickly
How to gain weight fast is one of the most asked questions I get these days. In order to gain weight, you have to take care of your diet and eat a higher calorie diet (relative to the calories you burn per day). You can then considerably influence the weight gain through exercise. This video tells how to gain weight for skinny girls. In this video I have shown 5 best exercises to gain weight quickly. The struggle of gaining weight can be quite long. However, if you do these 5 exercises, while eating a high(er) calorie diet then you can be sure of getting great results.
All these weight gain exercises are really easy to learn and you can do them at the gym as well as at home. These include pushups, squats, overhead presses, lunges, and dips. One thing to remember when doing different exercises for gaining weight, is that you have to focus on getting your form right instead of rushing through the movements. Always do these exercises slowly if you want to build muscle. Also, like all exercises, you should do these regularly in order to see great results. Gaining weight fast for women is entirely possible by regularly doing these exercises and eating a high(er) calorie diet. Through these exercises, you can easily build muscle at home or at the gym. Simply try these exercises for weight gain for a few weeks and see the amazing results in the form of curves in all the right places.
I hope you enjoy this video, make sure to subscribe to the channel so that you can continue watching da best fitness videos. Thank you.

The ONLY 2 Exercises for Chiseled Abs
description:
If you want to have chiseled abs that pop, then these are the only 2 exercises you need for that six pack. There are lots of ab exercises to pick from, but when you understand the key functions of the rectus abdominis muscle, then you know that you can narrow your choices down to the ones that are going to be most effective for getting a 6 pack.

Of course, your pursuit is always going to depend on having good nutrition. You simply cannot have a junk food diet and think that you are going to calorically remain in enough of a deficit to remain lean. 

That said, if you want to get chiseled abs that get attention when you lift your shirt then you want to choose from two distinct groups of ab exercises. The first is the exercises that move your chest towards the pelvis - or the top down movements. The second is the exercise group that moves your pelvis towards your chest  - the bottom up movements.

To make sure that each is maximally effective however, it helps to know your current ability level.

Knowing this allows me to give you a top down and bottom up recommendation that matches your capabilities and lets you scale to better and better ab exercises as you get stronger.

See the ab exercise choices here:

BOTTOM UP
beginners - reverse corkscrew (knees bent)
intermediate - reverse corkscrew (knees straight)
advanced - hanging corkscrew

TOP DOWN
beginners - upper circle crunch
intermediate - power over
advanced - cable crunch pulldown

Choose one from each group and perform 2-3 sets each day to failure. 

The more you do these the harder your abs will get as they get stronger and more developed. And again, when combined with a few sets of table pushaways to make sure that your diet stays in check and that you keep your body fat levels low, then the sky is the limit for how good your midsection can look in even a very short period of time from now.

But the key is, when you choose the right ab exercises you don't need a lot of them. In fact, only 2 ab exercise options are needed to start chiseling up that six pack.

For more tips on building muscle, be sure to stay tuned to this channel and remember to subscribe so you never miss another video from a physical therapist with a pro sports background as a PT and strength coach.

You can subscribe to this channel here - http://bit.ly/2b0coMW

Connect With Me:

For complete step-by-step workout programs, head on over to athleanx.com and make sure to use the program selector to find the training plan that is best suited to your personal goals.

Jeff Cavaliere MSPT, CSCS served as both the head physical therapist and assistant strength coach for the New York Mets. Jeff earned his Masters of Physical Therapy and Bachelorâ€™s of Physioneurobiology from the College of Health Sciences University of Connecticut Storrs. He is a certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist by the National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA).

title: Hack Squat Variations for Targeted Muscle Activation:
description:
Hack Squat Variations for Targeted Muscle Activation:
1. Glute Focused: Place your feet high on the footplate to create a 90-degree angle between your shin and upper leg for optimal glute engagement.
2. Quad Focused: Position your feet lower on the footplate for greater knee flexion, emphasizing the quads.
3. Adductor Focused: Take a wider stance with toes pointed outward to target your adductors effectively.

Hack Squat Variations for Targeted Muscle Activation:
description:
Hack Squat Variations for Targeted Muscle Activation:
1. Glute Focused: Place your feet high on the footplate to create a 90-degree angle between your shin and upper leg for optimal glute engagement.
2. Quad Focused: Position your feet lower on the footplate for greater knee flexion, emphasizing the quads.
3. Adductor Focused: Take a wider stance with toes pointed outward to target your adductors effectively.

description:

These simple yet effective exercises are perfect for anyone looking to incorporate movement into their daily routine without leaving the office. â—ï¸ HANGING KNEE RAISE â€” KNOW THE DIFFERENCE! #animation #fitness #tips #workout #bodyweight #gym
description:
Want abs? Not all knee raises hit the ABS how you think â€” itâ€™s all about TECHNIQUE!

1ï¸âƒ£ Knee Raise (No Pelvic Tilt)

â“How-to:  
â€” Simply lift your knees up, donâ€™t round your lower back or tilt pelvis.  
â€” Upper body stays still.

âš¡ï¸Activation:  
â€” Hip Flexors: 80% (main workhorses here)  
â€” Abs: Static hold only (no crunch action)

âœ”ï¸ Good for: Hip flexor strength & keeping hips mobile, especially if you sit a lot!  
ğŸš© Most do it like this, BUT think they train absâ€¦ Waste for six-pack growth!

2ï¸âƒ£ Knee Raise WITH Pelvic Tilt (Correct for Abs)

â“How-to:  
â€” Bring knees up AND tuck your pelvis (curl tailbone up!).  
â€” Feel abs contract, round lower back at top.

âš¡ï¸Activation:  
â€” Abs (Rectus): 90% â€” max tension & real six-pack work!  
â€” Hip Flexors: Still help, but abs do the main job.

ğŸ”‘ Key:  
REAL lower ab work needs the pelvis to be tucked! Otherwise, itâ€™s mostly hip flexors.

âœ… No pelvic tilt: Hip flexors in tone (great if youâ€™re stuck at a desk â€” but always STRETCH them after!)  
âœ… With pelvic tilt: TRUE lower abs work!

ğŸ‘‡ Been skipping the tilt? Share your style!

description: Adapting your workouts to meet the demands of the job is the key to success. Cal-JAC Commission to Recruit Women for the Fire Service members CAL FIRE Battalion Chief Liz Brown and San Jose Fire Captain Corey Condren share how to prepare for a career in the fire service physically. Becoming a Firefighter (@becomingaff) provides tips & resources to help you on your journey to becoming a firefighter in California. Get an inside look into fire service recruitment across the state, watch in-depth discussions about life as a firefighter, and learn how to kick-start your career. @becomingaff is a collaboration of the California Firefighter Joint Apprenticeship Committee (Cal-JAC) & the Firefighter Candidate Testing Center (FCTC). title: ğŸ“ŒBench Dip Form Tipsâœ… #triceps #tricepsworkout #tricepsexercise #fitnesstips
description:
ğŸ“ŒBench Dip Form Tipsâœ…


1ï¸âƒ£Hand Placement: Grip the edge of the bench with your fingers curled around it, rather than placing your hands flat on top.
This improves stability and reduces wrist strain.

2ï¸âƒ£Width of Hands: Keep your hands shoulder-width apart. Placing them too wide shifts tension from the triceps to other muscles, reducing effectiveness.

3ï¸âƒ£Body Distance from Bench: Avoid drifting too far away from the bench, as it takes tension off the triceps, making the exercise less effective.

4ï¸âƒ£Elbow Position: Keep your elbows tucked in throughout the movement. This keeps more tension on the triceps and helps prevent elbow injuries.

Cc @fitnessdilekofficial

Forearm Balance Fitness tips!
description:
Do you loveğŸ˜ or hateğŸ˜© backbends? Or maybe just somewhere in the middle?ğŸ˜

Today, Iâ€™m back with more Forearm Balance Fitness tips and surprise, we are back bending!ğŸ™ŒğŸ»

If you have tight shoulders, day 8 is going to be a challenge but just because itâ€™s hard doesnâ€™t mean it will always be hard. It takes courage to hop up to the wall and even more to drop down into a backbend. #yougotthis

#Backbends are generally a ğŸ˜ experience for me. If Iâ€™m honest, I donâ€™t love doing them. 

When I practice them on a regular basis, my shoulder and #backflexibility greatly improve. I also find that my back is less cranky.

I donâ€™t think I will ever love them. I donâ€™t understand when people tell me they â€œloveâ€ to do backbends. What do you love??

I wish I felt that way. Backbends are something in my practice that I do because I know I should, and the benefits outweigh my ğŸ˜ feeling.

For day 8, try kicking up to the wall and dropping one leg to the floor. Continue to kick back over several times. After 5 reps, place both feet on the floor and hold for 5 full breaths.

All the drills I share are in my Inversions Make You Hot program! Learn all things upside down!

You can sign up using the link in my profile. All my programs are included with a BYG membership!

title: Yes, Your Makeup IS Aging You! | 8 Mistakes You Might Be Making & How To Fix Them
description:
Common makeup mistakes you might be making, and how to fix them! Since Youtube and other social media wasn't around when were young, it was our mother's, friends and magazines that tried to help us learn to apply makeup. You probably didn't realize at the time that same makeup techniques that worked for you in your teens and twenties, would actually be aging you even more 20+ years later! I hope these 8 quick makeup "fixes" will be helpful, and make a huge difference when it comes to your makeup confidence!

title: Want Delicious High Protein Meals? Try This Grilled Chicken Alfredo Pasta Meal Prep #fitness #recipe
description:
High Protein Grilled Chicken Alfredo Pasta!

Best & Most Popular Meal Prep Recipes of 2024 Part 5!ğŸ”¥

One of the most indulgent meal preps iâ€™ve made! Chicken is cooked to perfection, paired with a rich creamy Alfredo Pasta. So simple and easy with great macrosğŸ¤ŒğŸ½

Macros Per Serving (4 Servings Total)

595 Calories | 59g Protein | 50g Carbs | 16g Fat

Ingredients (Makes 4 Servings)

Grilled Chicken
- 800g Raw Cubed Chicken Breast
- 1 Tsp Salt
- 2 Tsp Italian Herbs
- 1.5 Tsp Parsley
- 1 Tsp Chilli Flakes (remove if you donâ€™t like spicy)
- 1.5 Tsp Garlic Powder
- 1.5 Tsp Paprika
- 2 Tsp Olive Oil (you can leave this out too)
- 20g Light Butter (For cooking + once cooked)

Creamy Alfredo Pasta
- 210g Uncooked / 520g Cooked Pasta (I chose fettuccine)
- 80g Chopped White Onion
- 4 Garlic Cloves Chopped
- 1 Tsp Salt
- 1 Tsp Italian Herbs
- 1 Tsp Parsley
- 0.5 Tsp Chilli Flakes (remove if you donâ€™t like spicy)
- 1 Tsp Paprika
- 150g Tomato Sauce / Passata 
- 300ml Light Evaporated Milk (Brand: Sainsburyâ€™s)
- 130g Light Cream Cheese (Brand: Philadelphia)
- 30g Grated Parmesan Cheese
- Optional add Pasta Water if the sauce is too thick

Donâ€™t forget to check out my Meal Prep Cookbook with more Delicious High Protein Recipes just like thisğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ³â¤ï¸

Important Cooking Notes

- Cook the chicken cubes on medium high heat, 3-4 mins then turn them over and cook for another 3 mins
- Once cooked, lower the heat, add a little more butter then mix it all in and set aside
- Cook the onion for 5-6mins till soft then add the spices. Mix it in for a min before adding the tomato sauce
- You want to let this sauce cook for at least 5mins on low heat till it bubbles and separates a little
- Add the milk and cream cheese on low heat, then keep stirring till combined and thick
- To reheat, place both chicken and pasta in a pan, low heat, cover with a lid for 5 mins. Add a little milk if sauce is too solid
.
.
.
.
#jalalsamfit #alfredo #alfredopasta #pasta #pastalover #mealprep #highprotein #chickenalfredo #chickenpasta #weightloss #healthyrecipes #lowcalorie #chicken #foodie #eathealthy #mealprepideas

title: Dinner in 20 minutes
description:
Ground beef (or lamb) curry: 

Serves: 4
Prep time: 5 min
Cook time: 15 min


Ingredients
1 tbsp olive oil
600g beef (or lamb) mince
1 red onion, chopped
2 tomatoes, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tsp smoked paprika
1 tsp ground coriander
1 tsp ground cumin
1 tsp garlic powder
1 tsp garam masala
pinch dried chilli flakes
1 cup frozen peas
Â½ cup (125ml) water
steamed rice, chopped coriander leaves, to garnish

Method
Heat oil in a large saucepan on high heat. Add beef, cook, without stirring for 2 minutes. 
Add onion, stir to combine and start to break up the mince with the back of a wooden spoon. Cook until mince is well browned. 
Add tomatoes and garlic, cook for 2 minutes. 
Stir in spices, reduce heat to medium, cover and cook for 3-4 minutes. 
Stir in peas and water, cover, then cook for a further 2 minutes. 
Serve mince on a bed of steamed rice, garnished with coriander.

INGREDIENTS FOR RECIPE NO. 1 (ASADONG MANOK KAPAMPANGAN STYLE)

10 Depression-Era Recipes That Still Taste Amazing Today | Allrecipes
description:
Looking for ways to save money in the kitchen without sacrificing flavor? In this video, Nicole makes 10 Great Depressionâ€“era recipes that prove resourceful cooking can still be delicious nearly a century later. From pantry staples to clever substitutions, she shares thrifty tips and techniques inspired by home cooks of the 1930s â€” all while whipping up comforting, old-fashioned meals that stand the test of time.

We start with Hoover Stew, a hearty mix of pasta, beans, and canned goods that fed families across America, followed by a nostalgic Poor Manâ€™s Meal of potatoes, onions, and hot dogs. Nicole then makes a simple Egg Drop Soup, crispy Stuffed Potato Pancakes, and savory Eggs with Peppers and Potatoes that turn humble ingredients into something special. Next up are Cabbage and Noodles, creamy Chipped Beef on Toast, and homemade Depression Bread thatâ€™s easy, soft, and satisfying. Finally, she brings a touch of sweetness with Water Pie and Wacky Cake â€” two desserts that stretch ingredients while still feeling indulgent.

Whether youâ€™re cooking on a budget, love vintage recipes, or just want a cozy kitchen project, these Depression-era dishes show how simple cooking can be comforting, clever, and timeless.

title: Cheesy Garlic Potato Bites Fried #recipe #easyrecipe #food
description:
Ingredients:

2 potatoes
2 tbs butter
1/3 cup Parmesan cheese
3/4 tsp salt
1/2 tsp garlic powder
1 tsp parsley
2 tbs cornstarch
1 egg
Mozzarella cheese, cubed
Oil for frying

Directions:

1. Peel and slice potatoes. Boil until tender (until a fork can easily pierce the surface)
2. Mash the potatoes and butter until smooth.
3. Add Parmesan, salt, garlic powder, parsley, corn starch, and egg to mashed potatoes and mix until combined.
4. Add a cheese cube to a small portion of potato mix and roll into a ball
5. Deep fry in 350Â° oil until golden and crispy.

title: These KOREAN POTATO PANCAKES tried to mess with me!
description:
These KOREAN POTATO PANCAKES tried to mess with me!

âœ¨Recipe:
1 lb Potatoes
Â½ cup cornstarch
2 tbsp sugar
Â½ tsp salt
Mozzarella Sticks or Slices

Directions:
1. Peel and cube the potatoes. Boil in a medium pot until tender. (A fork can easily pierce them)
2. Mash the potatoes using a potato masher, or if you donâ€™t have one you can use a fork.
3. Mix in your sugar and salt, then combine cornstarch small bits at a time.
4. Divide your dough into around 6 - 8 equal portions, roll into a ball, then flatten.
5. Place your mozzarella cheese in the center and wrap the dough around the cheese and form into a tall pancake shape.
6. Add cooking oil to cover the bottom of a medium pan on medium heat. Fry the potato pancakes for 3 - 4 minutes per side or until golden.
7. Garnish with green onion, serve and enjoy!! ğŸ˜Š

title: 5 Easy Slow Cooker Dinners Perfect for Fall | Allrecipes
description:
Looking for cozy, comforting dinners that practically cook themselves? In this video, Nicole makes five easy slow cooker recipes that are hearty, flavorful, and perfect for chilly fall nights. From savory meats to creamy, slow-simmered stews, these dishes are all about letting your slow cooker do the heavy lifting while you enjoy the season.

We start with Swamp Potatoes and Sausage, a rich, Southern-inspired meal that combines smoky sausage and tender potatoes in one pot. Next up is a homestyle Slow Cooker Salisbury Steak smothered in gravy, followed by a sweet-and-savory Teriyaki Pork Tenderloin thatâ€™s tender enough to shred with a fork. Nicole then turns up the heat with her Widow Maker White Chicken Chili, loaded with creamy beans, shredded chicken, and just the right amount of spice. To finish, she serves up Slow Cooker Pot Roast Dips, a comforting twist on the classic roast beef sandwich thatâ€™s perfect for game day or weeknight dinners.

Whether youâ€™re meal-prepping for the week or just craving something cozy and hands-off, these easy slow cooker recipes are guaranteed to make your fall dinners simple, hearty, and delicious.

title: I learned this with a friend from Italy! From now on I only cook noodles like this
Bhindi Masala #shorts #bhindimasala #bhindirecipe #bhindicurry #indianfood #indianrecipe #food
description:
Ingredients: 
1. Okra â€“ 300g
2. Oil for frying 
3. Salt as per your taste
4. Red chili powder- 1tsp 
5. Cooking oil â€“ 2tbsp
6. Cumin seeds â€“ Â½ tsp 
7. Black Seeds (Kalonji) â€“ 1/2tsp 
8. Onion â€“ 1
9. Dry mango powder â€“ 1tsp 
10. Red Chili powder â€“ 1/2tsp 
11. Coriander powder -1tsp 
12. Cumin powder -1/2 tsp
13. Garam masala â€“ 1/2tsp 
14. Turmeric -1/2 tsp 
15. Water -2-3tbsp
16. Tomatoes â€“ 1

Cooking Steps: 
1. Fry okra 50% and then add chili powder and salt and keep aside.
2. Add black seeds & cumin seeds in hot oil and when the seeds crackle, add onion and fry till it changes color.
3. Now, add mango powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala and turmeric powder to water to make paste
4. Add the paste and tomatoes puree into the fried onion at step 2 and fry well. 
5. Now, add fried okra int the gravy and cook them well. 
Ready to be served.

PAKISTANI BREAKFAST STREET FOOD IN RAWALPINDI | 200 KG WARIS NALLI NIHARI RECIPE | MORNING NASHTA - PAKISTAN STREET FOOD

Experience the legendary Waris Nalli Nihari in Rawalpindi â€” one of Pakistan's most iconic desi breakfast dishes! ğŸ¤¤

In this video, we explore how 200 KG of beef Nalli Nihari is cooked using a traditional 24-hour slow-cooking process by none other than Waris, a name that has become synonymous with mouth-watering nihari in Rawalpindi and across Pakistan.

Watch the complete making process, from giant degs filled with rich beef marrow (nalli) to the final spicy, aromatic serving. This street food legend attracts thousands of hungry foodies every morning for breakfast.

If you're a fan of authentic desi food, Pakistani street food, or simply love a good nihari, you donâ€™t want to miss this!

description:
Crispy Aloo Patties Recipe #shorts #recipe #patties #potatosnacks  #shortsfeed #potato
Recipe:-
1. For stuffing. In a pan take some chopped green chilli, 1 tbsp jeera, and 1 chopped onion. Roast it well then add 1 tbsp Kashmiri Lal mirch, 1/2 tbsp haldi, 1/2 tbsp salt and 1/2 tbsp of garam masala.
2. For dough, In a bowl take one bowl of maida along with 1/2 tbsp of salt, 2 tbsp of oil and water.
3. Make a soft dough.
4. Take small portion and roti nd fold it as shown and apply oil and dust maida.
5. Add the stuffing and roll as shown.
6. Fry in low heat oil until it becomes crispy.
7. Your tasty aloo patties is ready.. Enjoy..â¤ï¸

description:
"Love Oreos and cupcakes? Combine the best of both worlds with this simple Oreo cupcake recipe!

Ingredient:
Oreo Biscuit
Milk 1/2 Cup.
Baking powder 1/4 tspn.

Preparation:
1. Crush the Oreo biscuit in a grinder.
2. add 1/4 tspn Baking powder and 1/2 cup milk and prepare a dough.
3. pour in oiled cup and fill only 2/3rd.
3. cook for around 15 minutes as shown in video.
4. Your Oreo  Cup Cake is ready. Let the cupcakes cool completely. Top with your choice of frosting and garnish . Enjoy Oreo Cupcake ! 
 
Learn how to make soft and delicious Oreo cupcakes at home in just a few simple steps! ğŸ§ Crushed Oreos combined with a rich cupcake batter make this dessert a perfect treat for Oreo lovers. Impress your family and friends with this easy and tasty recipe. Perfect for parties or tea-time snacks! ğŸª Don't forget to like, share, and subscribe for more mouth-watering recipes

Viral Rava Kesari Halwa Recipe #shorts #halwa #dessert #recipe
description:
Here is the detailed recipe of viral rava kesari halwa 

*RECIPE*
1. In a pan add 3 tbsp ghee and one cup of suji.
2. Roast it well.
3. In another pan add one cup of sugar and 2 cup of water.
4. Add kesar, half tbsp elaichi powder, drop of orange color and roasted suji.
5. Mix it until it becomes thick and add 1 tbsp ghee.
6. Garnish it with dry fruits and enjoy.
7. Your delicious rava kesari is ready.

description:
Easy and healthy breakfast | oil free breakfast GUilt free recipe | 
Capsicum/ à¤¶à¤¿à¤®à¤²à¤¾ à¤®à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤š -1/4cup
Tomato/ à¤Ÿà¤®à¤¾à¤Ÿà¤° -1/4cup
Onion/ à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤œ -1/4cup
Curd/ à¤¦à¤¹à¥€ -1/2cup
Semolina/ à¤¸à¥‚à¤œà¥€ -1cup
Water/ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¨à¥€ -1cup (can be adjusted as per requirement)
Green chillies/ à¤¹à¤°à¥€ à¤®à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤š -2-3
Coriander /à¤§à¤¨à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾-handful
Salt/à¤¨à¤®à¤• -as required 
Baking soda/ à¤®à¥€à¤ à¤¾ à¤¸à¥‹à¤¡à¤¾ -1/4tsp
Pav bhaji Masala/ à¤ªà¤¾à¤µ à¤­à¤¾à¤œà¥€ à¤®à¤¸à¤¾à¤²à¤¾ or you can also use sambar masala
Method 
â–ªï¸In a blender add semolina curd and water grind smooth and transfer this into a bowl add finely chopped green chillies, onion, capsicum, tomatoes , coriander and salt mix well keep aside. 
â–ªï¸Meanwhile in a pot add water and place stand cover it with lid and preheat it for about 10 min.
Mix baking soda in prepared mixture and transfer this to baking tin 
â–ªï¸sprinkle pav bhaji masala over it and let it cook in the preheated pot for about 25-30 min keep checking in between and once cooked take it out let it cool down then demold it cut into pieces and enjoy with your favourite dips or chutney.

title: Amazing Potato Gratin
description:
How to Make Au Gratin Potatoes - Easy Scalloped Potatoes
#potato #gratin #dinner #lunch #recipeideas #homefood 

Looking for more delicious recipes? Follow @ThisFamilyCooks and make every mealtime an adventure together! ğŸŒŸğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³

INGREDIENTS
700-800g peeled potatoes
Fresh scallions
4 cloves of garlic
50-100g cheese of your choice
Oil
250ml sweet cream
Salt and pepper to taste

RECIPE
Cut the potatoes into thin slices. Grease the baking dish and put the potatoes in it. Chop onions and garlic. Add them to the sweet cream. Add salt and pepper and pour mixture over the potatoes. Grate the cheese, pour over the potatoes and bake in an oven heated to 200 degrees for about 40-50 minutes.

Enjoy ğŸ˜Š

title: Instant jalebi recipe(holi special)#shorts #jalebi #viral #sweet #shortsfeed #trending #viralshorts
description:
Instant jalebi recipe(holi special)#shorts #jalebi #viral #sweet #shortsfeed #trending #viralshorts #shortvideo 


subscribe to my channel â€‹â for more recipes@Gharkakhanavlog 

*RECIPE*
1. For sugar syrup,  take 1 cup of sugar and 1.5 cup of water.
2. Add 1/2 tbsp elaichi powder ,saffron and  add food color as well.
3. Cook for 10 -12 minutes in medium flame ğŸ”¥ 
4. For jalebi batter, in a bowl take one bowl of maida, 2 tbsp of ghee and one eno powder.
5. Mix together by adding water and make a lump free batter.and keep the batter for 5-10 minutes rest 
6. Pour the batter in a bottle and make any shape of jalebi in hot oil.
7. Add the cooked jalebi in sugar syrup for 2 -3 minutes.
8. the instant crispy jalebi recipe is ready .Enjoy ğŸ˜‰

title: Viral Makhandi Halwa Recipe #shorts #halwa #dessert #recipe
description:
Here is the detailed recipe of viral makhandi halwa recipe 

*RECIPE*
1. Take 70 to 100 gm of suji and add 200 ml of milk to it, mix it well.
2. Now roast a hand full of dry fruits in 2 tsp of ghee/ oil.
3. Take that pan and add 3 tsp of ghee along with 50 gm of sugar and mix it well untill it dissolves.
4. Pour the roasted suji mixture to it and stir the mixture untill it turned golden brown.
5. Now add 1/2 tsp of cardamom powder and cook it for around 5 to 10 minutes untill it soak the ghee.
6. Garnish it with chopped dry fruits and server hot.

Please subscribe @khanaPeenaRecipes for more recipes and food hacks ğŸ™
#shortvideo #dessert #recipes #sweets #halwarecipe #viralvideo

description:

title: No Big Budget? 77 Easy Business Ideas Under $500
description:
You loved our first video on business ideas, so we've created another inspiring selection for you! Welcome to "77 Small Business Ideas You Can Start for $500 or Less in 2025." Starting a profitable business doesn't always mean huge investments. Often, creativity, understanding your market, and finding the right business idea are all it takes to succeed.

In this video, you'll discover a diverse array of low-budget business ideas suitable for aspiring entrepreneurs ready to make money with minimal startup costs. From innovative DIY projects to clever service-oriented businesses, weâ€™re covering high-profit business ideas that are accessible, practical, and trending.

Explore exciting new business ideas, like transforming regular plastic cards into luxurious metal cardsâ€”ideal for creating personalized credit cards with custom engravings and gold plating. Learn how upcycling old clothes can lead to a thriving fashion business, perfectly suited to platforms like Instagram and Etsy.

If you're creatively inclined, explore making unique jewelry from lava stones, offering aromatherapy accessories that appeal to wellness-conscious customers. Or launch a business creating magnetic stickers for refrigerators, cars, or office boardsâ€”quick to produce and consistently profitable.

Custom keycaps made from epoxy resin or metal are another standout idea, turning boring keyboards into vibrant, personalized setups. Honey production offers a natural, low investment business idea with endless possibilities, from infused honey to beautifully packaged gift sets.

Looking for something practical? A mobile brick-making business cuts delivery costs by producing concrete blocks directly at construction sitesâ€”a profitable venture for contractors and private builders. Or offer natural homemade sausages, free from additives and rich in exotic flavors.

We also cover distinctive ventures like custom marriage proposal boxes, laser tattoo removal services, and personalized phone cases printed on-demand. For food enthusiasts, Japanese desserts in stylish clear cans offer a visually appealing, profitable business opportunity.

Dive into other fascinating options like sneaker cleaning services, edible printing for personalized desserts, and selling stabilized plantsâ€”long-lasting alternatives to fresh flowers that customers adore.

Each business idea is selected for its potential to generate high profit margins with minimal investment, providing actionable insights on how to start a business successfully.

Whether youâ€™re exploring best small business ideas or seeking profitable niches to launch your entrepreneurial journey, our list of business ideas for 2025 will inspire you. Subscribe for more exciting content on entrepreneurship, creativity, and practical strategies to make money with the best business ideas around!

title: Easy Business To Start
description:
Want to SCALE your business? Go here: https://www.acquisition.com/yta
Want to START a business? Go here: https://skool.com/games 

If youâ€™re new to my channel, my name is Alex Hormozi. Iâ€™m the founder and managing partner of Acquisition.com. Itâ€™s a family office, which is just a formal way of saying we invest our own money into companies. Our 10 portfolio companies bring in over $200,000,000+ per year. Our ownership stake varies between 20% and 100% of them. Given this is a YT channel, and anyone can claim anything, Iâ€™ll give you some stuff you can google to verify below.

How I got hereâ€¦

21: Graduated Vanderbilt in 3 years Magna Cum Laude, and took a fancy consulting job.
23 yrs old: Left my fancy consulting job to start a business (a gym).
24 yrs old: Opened 5 gym locations.
26 yrs old: Closed down 6th gym. Lost everything. 
26 yrs old: Got back to launching gyms (launched 33). Then, lost everything for a 2nd time. 
26 yrs old: In desperation, started licensing model as a hail mary. It worked. 
27 yrs old: "Gym Launch" does $3M profit the next 6 months. Then $17M profit next 12 months.
28 yrs old: Started Prestige Labs. $20M the first year.  
29 yrs old: Launched ALAN, a software company for agencies to work leads for customers. Scaled to $1.7mmo within 6 months. 
31 yrs old: Sold 75% of UseAlan to a strategic buyer in an all stock deal. 
31 yrs old: Sold 66% of Gym Launch & Prestige Labs at $46.2M valuation in all-cash deal to American Pacific Group. (you can google it)
31 yrs old: Started our family office Acquisition.com. We invest and scale companies using the $42M in distributions we had taken + the cash from the $46.2M exit.
32 yrs old: Started making free content showing how we grow companies to make real business education accessible to everyone (and) to attract business owners to invest or scale their businesses. 
34 yrs old: I became co-owner of https://Skool.com to help the many people who want to start a business online do so.

Today: Our portfolio now does $200M/yr between 10 companies. The largest doing $100M/yr the smallest doing $5M per year. Our ownership varies between 20% and 100% ownership of the companies. Many of them we invested in early and helped grow (which is how we make our money - not youtube videos).

To all the gladiators in the arena, weâ€™re all in the middle of writing our own stories. The worse the monsters, the more epic the story.

You either get an epic outcome or an epic story. Both mean you win. 

Keep crushing. May your desires be greater than your obstacles. 

Never quit,

Alex

*FULL DISCLOSURE* 
I make content to make money - just - on a longer time horizon than most. I want to build trust with business owners so we can find the best ones and help them scale. And if theyâ€™re awesome, write them a check and go all the way as partners.

title: Best Telugu Business || Eggs Wholesale business | business Ideas Telugu | Startup Business #business
Your Next Startup Idea?
description:
New format, same value. I cover one startup idea, one trend, one news debate, one growth framework, one AI tool, and one product recommendation.

*Timestamps*
00:00 â€“ Intro
00:53 â€“ Startup Idea
05:55 â€“ Trend
08:17 â€“ News Item
12:05 â€“ Product Framework
15:31 â€“ AI Tool
17:00 â€“ Product Recommendation

*Startup Idea*
Solo Female Travel Safety Platform
The problem: 84% of solo female travelers feel unsafe. No reliable platform answers basic safety questions.
The solution: Map-based reviews where verified female travelers rate neighborhoods, hotels, and restaurants on actual safety metrics.
Path to $500K ARR:

* 5,000 members at $30/month
* Hotel safety certifications at $500/month
* Lead magnet: Free travel safety quiz
* Distribution: Facebook groups (400K members), travel influencers, short-form video

*Trend:*
Gamification UI: Duolingo did it. Social platforms are built on it. More apps and websites are adding points, badges, leaderboards, and challenges.
The opportunity: Launch an agency specializing exclusively in gamification. Start at $10K/month.

*News Item*
Ex-Reddit CEO: "AI Startups Have 12-18 Months"
Yishan's viral take (20M views): AI apps are flash-in-the-pan cash grabs. Foundational models will crush them.
Greg's counter: Great AI wrappers that own workflows, customers, and network effects will build billion-dollar companies. Remember when everyone said Apple would clone every successful app? That didn't happen.

*Product Framework:*
3-Step Creator Growth Playbook for SaaS

* Attach the right creator (target 120K followers or less for higher response rates)
* Offer generous affiliates (30-50% lifetime, not 10-20%)
* Gamify the experience (contests, trips, prizes for top performers)

Real example: Goji (apple cider vinegar gummy) hit hundreds of millions using gamified TikTok Shop affiliates.

*AI Tools:*
Krea AI: Alternative to Glyph AI. Generate images, video, 3D objects. Features Nodes product for building creative workflows.
Mini apps: Virtual try-on, hairstyle generator, object remover, product photo editor.

*Product Recommendations:*
La Colombe Cold Brew (Light Roast) - $5-8.49 at Target for multiple servings. Light, smooth, always cold when you need it.
Olipop Classic Root Beer - 35 cal, 3g sugar. Better than Diet Coke. 8.5/10.

title: Top 100 Startup Ideas from Top Entrepreneurs and VCs
description:
Read the complete report of 100 Great Startup Ideas in 2025 - https://www.theoryofnext.com 

00:00 - Intro
01:18 - AI
03:30 - Fintech
05:19 - About Antler
05:52 - Deeptech
07:21 - Consumer
08:52 - Climate
10:42 - Health
12:24 - SAAS

Ever wonder what top VCs and successful founders are betting on for the next big thing? Weâ€™ve got the inside scoop! In this episode of "Backstage With Millionaires," we're diving into a goldmine of opportunities: Antler India's exclusive report featuring 100 groundbreaking startup ideas for 2025, handpicked by the best minds in India's startup ecosystem.

With AI tools making it easier than ever to build, the real challenge is spotting the market's burning needs. This report cuts through the noise, giving you direct insights into what investors consider "great ideas" that can scale massively in the next 5-10 years.

We've distilled these 100 ideas into 7 crucial themes: AI, Fintech, Deeptech, Consumer, Climate, Health, and SaaS. For each theme, I'm picking one standout idea to deep-dive into, explaining the problem, the potential, and why it's poised for success.

Hereâ€™s a sneak peek at what we cover:

1. AI for India's SMEs (Aakrit Vaish - Haptik)
Discover how AI can revolutionize India's Small and Medium Enterprises, the backbone of our economy. From smart bookkeeping and inventory management to voice-first interfaces in local languages, learn how to build advanced AI tools that empower businesses struggling against modern competition. This is about more than just record-keeping; itâ€™s about providing actionable insights and seamless integration with daily apps like WhatsApp and UPI.

2. Biometric Payments (Paroma Chatterjee - Revolut India)
Imagine a future where your face, fingerprint, or voice is your payment key. We explore how India, with its advanced UPI infrastructure, is ripe for biometric authentication layers. This isn't just about seamless transactions; itâ€™s about next-level security that's hard to breach.

3. India's Robotics Opportunity (Soumitra Sharma - Operators Studio)
Tap into Indiaâ€™s massive STEM talent pool, manufacturing prowess, and global expertise to build robotics solutions for the world. Beyond factories, imagine robots assisting in education or playing sports. With government incentives and a global search for alternatives to Chinese manufacturing, the time for Indian robotics is now!

4. GenAI and the Future of Learning (Nitin Sharma - Antler)
Despite past challenges in EdTech, Generative AI is creating a new era of learning. We discuss how GenAI can power AI-tutors that guarantee learning outcomes, offer hyper-personalized content, and break language barriers, transforming education from sales-heavy to outcome-based models.

5. Fixing Pollution: A Billion-Dollar Opportunity (Nikhil Basu Trivedi - Footwork)
Air pollution is a critical problem in India, but it's also a multi-billion-dollar entrepreneurial opportunity. Learn how innovation, tailored for the Indian context, genuine technological breakthroughs, and patient capital can lead to scalable solutions for cleaner air.

6. Health Solutions for Indiaâ€™s "Wealthy 50s" (Nidhi Mathur - Axilor Ventures)
Indiaâ€™s demographic is shifting, creating a massive market of affluent individuals in their 50s and 60s who are keen on healthy aging, longevity, and wellness. Discover opportunities in luxury retreats, science-backed nutrition, and personalized fitness.

7. Scaling Global Services with Indian Talent (Gautam Mago - A91)
Explore the evolution of BPO to BPO 3.0 and 4.0, where AI combines with human expertise to deliver high-end, complex services globally. Indiaâ€™s vast pool of college graduates and decades of back-office experience position us perfectly to capture the next wave of global service demand.

Want to explore all 100 ideas? Find the link to the full Antler India report in the description below! This is a must-read for aspiring founders, investors, or anyone curious about the future of innovation.

title: How I use Reddit and AI to find winning startup ideas
description:
You can sign up to gummysearch.com/community or find startup ideas at ideabrowser.com In this episode, we dive deep into the process of finding validated startup ideas from Reddit using AI tools. I share my 4-step process and demonstrate how to use www.gummysearch.com/community to discover trending subreddits, identify problems and solutions, find creators in the niche, and create content that resonates with the audience.

1) Use Gummy Search to find trending subreddits

â€¢ Focus on 10k-100k member communities
â€¢ These answer the "why now" question
â€¢ Look for niches where you have an unfair advantage
â€¢ Pro tip: Check daily/weekly/monthly growth trends

2) Analyze subreddit for problems & solutions

â€¢ Add chosen subreddit to a Gummy Search "audience"
â€¢ Examine "pain and anger" section for common patterns
â€¢ Check "advice requests" for what people are asking
â€¢ Review "solution requests" for competitive landscape
 â€¢ Key: Look for recurring themes and write them down!

3) Identify creators in the niche

â€¢ Use Perplexity.ai to find top influencers
â€¢ Search YouTube for their most popular videos
â€¢ Read comments to understand audience needs
â€¢ Do this for 20-25 videos to get deep insights
â€¢ This helps you think like your target audience

4) Wireframe your solution

â€¢ Based on insights, sketch out your product/service
â€¢ Use tools like Framer to quickly prototype
â€¢ Come up with a catchy, relevant name
â€¢ Example: DesignScientist.com for conversion-focused design

5) Bonus: Creating content that resonates

â€¢ Use Gummy Search's "top content" feature
â€¢ Analyze what performs well in the community
â€¢ Ask AI about content preferences (e.g., "Do they love memes?")
â€¢ Remember: Treat AI tools as your "entrepreneurial assistant"

Want more info on how I use Reddit to find startup ideas, get access: https://www.gregisenberg.com/reddit-ideas

title: Making $$$ with MicroSaaS (I might delete this)
description:
On todayâ€™s episode I share a comprehensive guide to building microSaaS businesses, which are niche-focused software products that can be developed by individuals or small teams. I explain the difference between traditional SaaS and micro SaaS, share real examples of successful businesses generating $20K-40K monthly revenue, and outline a step-by-step playbook for validating ideas, building MVPs, and growing through audience building and SEO.

Timestamps:
00:00 - Intro
01:08 - What is a MicroSaaS?
02:25 - Examples of successful micro SaaS businesses
05:35 - Growth flywheel explanation
07:57 - User journey and funnel metrics
12:06 - Building in public strategy
18:28 - MicroSaaS Frameworks
21:58 - MicroSaaS Ideas 1: PermitSync
25:33 - MicroSaaS Ideas 2: PodScriptor
28:52 - MicroSaaS Ideas 3: SpecSheet
32:30 - MicroSaaS Ideas 4: CartSaver
33:58 - MicroSaaS Ideas 5: GrantGuru

Get Your Complete Financial OS at https://www.brex.com/sip  

Key Points:
â€¢ Micro SaaS businesses focus on niche markets with specific products, typically built by solo founders or small teams
â€¢ Successful micro SaaS businesses can generate $10K-50K monthly profit with 80-90% margins
â€¢ Growth comes from building an audience first, identifying pain points, creating solutions, and reinvesting revenue
â€¢ Pricing strategies typically include free trials converting to monthly subscriptions or usage-based models

1) What is Micro SaaS?

Unlike big SaaS companies targeting everyone (think Salesforce), micro SaaS:

â€¢ Targets an extremely niche audience
â€¢ Offers a "feature of a feature" product
â€¢ Focuses on profitability (not growth at all costs)
â€¢ Can be built by a solo founder or tiny team
â€¢ Often reaches $10-50K monthly profit

Why build one? 80-90% margins and lifestyle freedom! 

2) Real Examples That WORK

â€¢ Bank Statement Converter: $40K/month, solo founder
Simply converts PDF bank statements to Excel format

â€¢ Projection: $24K/month
Projects your financial net worth visually

â€¢ CleanVoice: $20K/month
Edits podcasts by removing background noise, filler words, etc.

The pattern? Simple solution to SPECIFIC pain points!

3) The Growth Flywheel

Here's the secret sauce to micro SaaS success:

1. Build an audience/community FIRST
2. Learn their acute pain points
3. Build a solution to those pains
4. Generate word of mouth
5. Create recurring revenue
6. Reinvest in growing your audience

This is why building in public WORKS. The community becomes your distribution!

4) User Journey Breakdown

The typical micro SaaS journey:

â€¢ People have a manual, painful workflow
â€¢ They search Google/ChatGPT for a solution
â€¢ They find your micro SaaS (good domain name is KEY)
â€¢ They have a "wow moment" using your product
â€¢ Free trial converts to paying customer
â€¢ They tell friends or share in communities
â€¢ Growth compounds through referrals + SEO

5) The Numbers Game

Here's what success might look like:

â€¢ 10,000 monthly site visitors
â€¢ 1,500 free trials
â€¢ 300 active users
â€¢ 150 paying subscribers ($19/month)
â€¢ 30 true advocates who spread the word

Month 1: $200 revenue
Month 3: $2,000
Month 6-7: $7,000+

It COMPOUNDS if you reinvest in growth!

6) The Weekend MVP Approach

Don't spend months building! Instead:

â€¢ Time-constrain your MVP to 48 hours
â€¢ Use no-code tools or hire a freelancer
â€¢ Automate as much as possible
â€¢ Tweet your progress DAILY
â€¢ Create feedback loops
â€¢ Focus on distribution from day one

7) Finding the Perfect Opportunity

Use these frameworks to identify winning ideas:

â€¢ Market Gap Heat Map: Focus on high demand + few tools
â€¢ Problem-Pay Matrix: Target high pain + high willingness to pay
â€¢ Innovation Matrix: Aim for niche + high polish

The sweet spot? Where your passion meets monetization potential!

8) Micro SaaS Ideas You Can STEAL

5) ideas anyone can build:

â€¢ Permitting: Help homeowners navigate city permit processes ($99 one-time fee)
â€¢ Podscripter: Auto-generate show notes and video clips from podcast episodes ($29/month)
â€¢ SpecSheet: Convert PDF spec sheets into sortable comparison tables ($49/month)
â€¢ CartSaver: AI video messages to recover abandoned Shopify carts (1% of recovered revenue)
â€¢ GrantGuru: AI-powered grant proposal generator for nonprofits ($149/proposal)

The #1 tool to find startup ideas/trends - https://www.ideabrowser.com

title: Business idea number 5
3 Creative Business Ideas #entrepreneurship #businessideas #shorts
description:
These are some of the most popular Indian brands that actually started as copies of foreign brands â€” but ended up becoming bigger and more successful than the originals! Sounds crazy, right?
In this video, weâ€™ll explore the incredible business stories of how Minimalist, Oreo, Bingo Mad Angles, and Blah Blii Blue turned imitation into innovation â€” and built multi-crore Indian companies by understanding local markets, marketing psychology, and smart product adaptation.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ Minimalist took heavy inspiration from The Ordinary â€” same white packaging, minimal design, and skincare concept. But by making it affordable and relatable for Indian consumers, it became a 3000 crore brand â€” a perfect example of brand localization done right. Oreo may be world-famous today, but did you know it was inspired by Hydrox Cookies? Through powerful branding and emotional marketing, Oreo turned the tables and became a global snack icon â€” proving that marketing beats originality when done smartly.Bingo Mad Angles clearly drew inspiration from Doritos, but they gave it an Indian twist with spicy masala flavors â€” and guess what? They started outselling Doritos in India. Thatâ€™s called understanding your audience and customizing your product for the market.And then comes Blah Blii Blue â€” the wildest copy story ever. They replicated everything â€” the bottle, the site, the packaging â€” but still made 15 crores in 60 days. Thatâ€™s speed, branding, and execution at its best.
This video reveals how copying smartly and adapting intelligently can transform a business from imitation to innovation â€” and how Indian entrepreneurs are rewriting the rules of global branding.
Watch till the end to discover how these brands proved that being a â€œcopyâ€ doesnâ€™t mean being second-best â€” it can mean being smarter, faster, and more successful.Donâ€™t forget to like, comment, and subscribe for more crazy business facts, startup stories, and marketing case studies every week!

Copyright Disclaimer: This video may contain copyrighted content used under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976 â€” Fair Use â€” for education, commentary, news, or research. All rights and credits belong to their owners.

title: How I Use AI & Reddit to Find $1M+ Startup Ideas (FULL Blueprint)
description:
I share 17 practical methods for generating viable startup ideas in the AI era. The strategies focus on identifying pain points, tedious workflows, and manual processes that could be automated or improved with AI. These techniques can help both aspiring entrepreneurs seeking new ventures and established startup founders looking to expand their product offerings.

Timestamps:

00:00 - Intro
01:48 - Method 1: Using ChatGPT to identify tedious workflows
06:08 - Method 2: Analyzing your ChatGPT history
09:11 - Method 3: Searching Reddit for tool requests
12:00 - Methods 4-7: Finding friction points and using Idea Browser
15:08 - Methods 8-11: Exploring niche groups and software review sites
19:13 - Methods 12-15: Learning from agency owners and job titles
24:06 - Methods 16-17: Finding opportunities in low-rated but high-usage plugins

Key Points:

â€¢ Use ChatGPT to identify tedious workflows in specific professions that AI could automate
â€¢ Analyze your own ChatGPT history to find repeated prompts that could become products
â€¢ Search online platforms (Reddit, Facebook, Discord) for people asking about tools that don't exist
â€¢ Examine where you copy/paste between tools as these friction points represent startup opportunities
â€¢ Browse service marketplaces like Upwork and Fiverr to find manual tasks ripe for AI automation

1) Use ChatGPT to find tedious workflows

The prompt that WORKS:
"Give me 10 tedious workflows that a [JOB TITLE] does that AI could automate"

Pain = opportunity = CASH

Pro tip: Ask ChatGPT which workflow is MOST painful and why, then build your MVP around solving it!

2) Scroll your own ChatGPT history

If you're repeating the same prompt weekly, that's a product hiding in plain sight!

Example: If you constantly ask AI to "make my writing clearer" - there's your SaaS idea.

The unbundling of ChatGPT into vertical-specific tools is happening NOW.

3) Google search hack that finds GOLD

Type: site:reddit.com "is there a tool" [YOUR NICHE]

This reveals people LITERALLY begging for tools that don't exist yet.

These are potential customers telling you exactly what they want to pay for. Pure market research for FREE.

4) Audit where you copy & paste between tools

That friction point? It's a startup waiting to happen.

If you're copying emails into a CRM manually, others are too.

The most painful workflows are often the most profitable to solve!

5) Browse Upwork & Fiverr for repeated AI tasks

Look for gigs where people are:
â€¢ Paying good money
â€¢ For manual work
â€¢ That could be automated

If multiple clients want it done manually, it's RIPE for disruption with an AI-powered product.

6) Join Discord/Slack groups and search for "does anyone have a tool for..."

These communities are GOLDMINES of unmet needs.

Set up automations to alert you when these phrases appear, then swoop in with your solution!

7) Use https://www.ideabrowser.com

Greg built this FREE tool that finds startup ideas from:
â€¢ Facebook groups
â€¢ Subreddits
â€¢ Google trends

It gives you a new idea DAILY with feasibility analysis and even pricing strategy. Why aren't you using this yet?!

8) Niche Facebook groups = untapped opportunity

Look for workflow hacking in the comments.

When people are cobbling together manual solutions, that's your cue to build the tool they're creating by hand.

Don't sleep on FB - still a BILLION monthly users with problems to solve!

9) Talk to business owners about their Excel workflows

Seriously. Just ask:
"What Excel tasks do you hate doing?"
"Which spreadsheets eat up your time?"

Pay them $50-100 for their insights if needed.

Their pain points = your AI agent waiting to be built.

10) Find multi-step tutorials using 8+ tools

When someone needs EIGHT different tools to accomplish one task...

That's your cue to build the one-click version.

People will PAY for products that make complex workflows simple and FAST.

Notable Quotes:

"If you're coming up with a startup idea that helps solve someone's pain, you will be able to make money from it."

"What I'm saying, the ideas I like to work on are the ideas that I have odds stacked in my favor."

The #1 tool to find startup ideas/trends - https://www.ideabrowser.com

title: 30 year old IBM ThinkPad puts modern #tech to shame #pc #technology #shorts
description: This 30 year old IBM ThinkPad shows how important build quality is when it comes to making a laptop last. Back in 1994 this thick piece of technology cost $4500 which is $9500 in today's money, but what you got was a computer that could physically hold up after 30 years. Of course the tech is obsolete now, but this pc proves how long they can last if the company isn't afraid to innovate and they don't cut corners with the design. Imagine having this build quality in a modern gaming laptop? Not to mention the ability to upgrade everything because it's modular. But anyways, here's some more RGB.

description: Disgusting Alienware laptop is overheating and needs a deep cleaning. A high performance computer like this Alienware M15 R7 PC needs to be taken care of and maintained or else it will eventually overheat and cook the motherboard. title: $3,000 Razer #PC can't be fixed! Razer WORSE than Apple w/ Right to Repair #tech #technology #shorts
description: This is the second time I've been stopped from repairing a 2022 Razer Blade 15 Advanced computer because of lack of replacement parts. Razer is worse than Apple when it comes to right to repair because they outright refuse to sell replacement parts for any of their technology . At least Apple will sell you overpriced replacement parts that cost more than your device is worth. My customer is stuck with a pc that has a broken 4K OLED Display that uses proprietary tech , so they will have to send it in to Razer and pay over $600 to get it fixed. This is why I say the computer repair industry is dying. It's not like I'm trying to fix a CPU or GPU in my computer repair shop, I'm just trying to replace a broken display. Crazy.

title: Why I NEVER Recommend Gaming Laptops #tech #pc #technology #shorts
description: â€œWhat gaming laptop should I buyâ€ is a question I get asked dozens of times a day, and my answer is always the same: Framework 16 or a ThinkPad P series. Because as a technician, I have a moral obligation to recommend things based on repairability and reliability. Which are the 2 least prioritized things on a gaming laptop. Whereas an enthusiast recommends things based on how new and powerful the tech is when itâ€™s brand new. And since itâ€™s impossible to tell what problems a new device will have in a few years, I can only rate things by how my past my experiences have been with certain models and companies. For example, the Acer Nitro is low-cost and fragile, but decently powerful and easy to upgrade and maintain. Higher end Lenovo Legions are fairly reliable and built sturdier than some others. But none of these have replaceable keyboards, and finding genuine parts is hit or miss. Framework 16 is expensive, but it has a modular GPU, parts are readily available, and youâ€™re supporting a company that prioritizes right to repair. The ThinkPad P series is built sturdy, has a replaceable keyboard, a â€œgamingâ€ GPU, and parts are easy to purchase. But whatever you choose, just clean the thing regularly.

Curtis is the third studio album by American rapper 50 Cent; it was released on September 11, 2007, by Shady Records, Aftermath Entertainment and Interscope Records. The album features production from Dr. Dre, Eminem, and Timbaland, among others. Music writers have noted that 50 Cent divides between "hard" and "soft" songs on the album.

Curtis received generally mixed reviews from music critics upon release. The album debuted at number 2 on the US Billboard 200 chart, selling 691,000 copies in its first week. After years of slumping sales, the album's competition with Kanye West's Graduation (2007) and the resulting record breaking performances both albums displayed was considered to be a "great day for hip hop."

title: What is ICT ? || ğŸ’»ComputerğŸ’» #ICT #computer #information #communication #technology
description:
ICT stands for Information and Communications Technology. It essentially refers to the technologies that enable us to communicate and access information in today's world.
Think of it as an umbrella term that covers a wide range of tools and technologies, including:
 * Computers: This includes personal computers, laptops, tablets, and servers.
 * Internet: The global network that connects computers and devices worldwide.
 * Mobile devices: Smartphones, feature phones, and other devices that allow us to communicate and access information on the go.
 * Software: The programs that run on computers and other devices.
 * Networks: The infrastructure that connects devices and allows them to communicate, such as Wi-Fi and cellular networks.
 * Telecommunications: Technologies used for long-distance communication, such as telephones and satellites.
 * Media and broadcasting: Technologies used for distributing information and entertainment, such as television and radio.
ICT is constantly evolving, with new technologies and applications emerging all the time. It plays a crucial role in many aspects of our lives, including:
 * Communication: ICT enables us to communicate with people around the world through email, messaging apps, and video conferencing.
 * Education: ICT is used in schools and universities to enhance learning and provide access to educational resources.
 * Business: ICT is essential for businesses to operate efficiently, communicate with customers, and manage data.
 * Healthcare: ICT is used in hospitals and clinics to improve patient care and manage medical records.
 * Entertainment: ICT provides us with access to movies, music, games, and other forms of entertainment.
Overall, ICT is a powerful set of tools that has transformed the way we live, work, and interact with each other.

title: New Technology free Energy
Japan Just Unlocked GOD MODE Internet - 125,000,000 Mbps #shorts
description:
Japan has recently set a new world record in internet speed by reaching an incredible 1.02 petabits per second. To put it simply, this speed is so fast that you could download over 125,000 gigabytes of data in just one second. Itâ€™s millions of times faster than the internet most people use today.

The breakthrough was made using a special kind of fiber optic cable that has 19 separate cores. These cores allow data to travel in multiple streams at the same time, much like a superhighway with 19 lanes. Even though itâ€™s much more powerful, the cable is the same size as regular fiber lines, making it easier to use with existing technology.

The team tested this high-speed connection over a long distanceâ€”more than 1,800 kilometersâ€”without losing speed or quality. This means it could be useful for long-range data transfer, such as across countries or under the ocean.

While this ultra-fast internet isnâ€™t available to the public yet, it shows what might be possible in the near future. It could play a big role in future technologies like 6G, global cloud services, and AI systems that need to move massive amounts of data instantly.

My name is Jonathan, I have a passion for all things gadget, travel and EDC (Everyday Carry), which has filled both my personal and work life for many years.

This includes sourcing, reviewing and product development and the creation of two UK national retail chains. Find out more here: https://youtu.be/vYCOQ5CpkXY

I welcome any feedback on my videos or the channel in general in the comments. See below for more on this.

Contents of this video to help you navigate:

00:00 - Intro
00:28 - Hoto Electric Precision Screwdriver
02:16 - 1TG Wallet Pouch
04:24 - Plaud Note Pro - Sponsored Content
07:39 - Ugreen FineTrack Smart Finder
09:29 - INIU  5000mAh Magsafe Power Bank
11:17 - INIU 5000mAh Power Bank with Apple Watch Charger
12:25 - Ugreen USB-C Extending Cable
13:22 - tomtoc Organiser Travel Pouch
14:41 - Klarus E8 Flashlight
17:07 - Sharpal
18:58 - Outro

Product Sourcing:

When it comes to sourcing a product for review, I will usually eitherÂ  purchase and item personally or reach out to a supplier requesting a sample for review.Â  Many suppliers are supportive if they are confident in their product, appreciating the value of greater exposure.

Any sponsored videos (paid for reviews) are clearly stated as such so there can be no misunderstanding.

If a product I have reviewed is available from Amazon I will often include an Amazon link in the description.Â  As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases. If you purchase a product or service with the links that I provide I may receive a small commission. There is no additional charge to you.

Replying to Comments:

I really appreciate the feedback in the comments - I find it a source of knowledge and inspiration - so thank you to all of you who take the time to contribute.  This is not just for me as the creator, it is a valuable source of information for all readers of the comments.  I have recently found that if I continue to respond to all the comments as the number of videos builds, it takes significant time away from being able to produce new content which would be very counter productive! So my aim is to read everything I can and reply when I can, after each video goes live for the first few hours at least, and beyond that when possible.  I'll see how that works out ğŸ˜Š

Please consider subscribing and being notified to keep up to date with new video releases.

Thank you for supporting the channel.

JonGadget

title: I Tried the First Humanoid Home Robot. It Got Weird. | WSJ
description:
The 1X Neo is one of the first humanoid robots built for your home and is equipped with full AI software. For $20,000, you can pre-order X1â€™s Neo now with delivery set for 2026. But a company representative might need to peer into your home, via Neoâ€™s camera eyes, to help get things done. 

WSJâ€™s Joanna Stern spent time with itâ€”and its creatorâ€”to see what it can really do and how much it still requires a human operatorâ€™s help.

0:00 The first humanoid home robot
0:37 Neoâ€™s body (hardware) and safety challenges
3:27 Neoâ€™s brain (teleoperation vs. autonomy) 
7:11 Neoâ€™s usefulness vs. privacy tradeoff
